The site sits atop a small mountain and had great views all around it. They aren\'t a lot of visitors so you have a great opportunity to wander around the site  \n\nThe trip wouldn\'t have been as good without Carlos, he picked us up and returned us to Cuernavaca and gave us a very good tour of the site and museum, explaining a lot of detail we would have otherwise missed. He\'s very knowledgeable. The site would have been much harder to get to without him (you would need a car or a local bus to the town which is still some distance and downhill from the site).  We also traveled the next day to Taxco and the Cacahuamilpa Caves with Carlos, his translation in the caves was very useful, as was his local knowledge in Taxco. We had some thick fog during the drive down from the mountains and Carlos showed himself to be a very good, cautious driver.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

633405898.name: Best Experience ever
633405898.author: a TripAdvisor user
633405898.reviewBody: Excelente trip, great scene, safe and amazing. The site is well taken care of and the location guides are knowledgeable and very nice. Above our expectations

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

629674892.name: An excellent guided tour of Xochicalco
629674892.author: a TripAdvisor user
629674892.reviewBody: We visited the pyramids of Xochicalco with a guide, Carlos Cortes, who can be found via his email address ciudadfantastica@hotmail.com. Carlos was very knowledgeable about the Xochicalco zone and his English is excellent. He picked us up in his private car at our Cuernavaca hotel, paid for our admission fee to the site and gave us a detailed tour of the site including the excellent museum. It\'s fair to say that without someone as knowledgeable as Carlos the visit to the site would have been far less rewarding. The tour lasted for about 3.5 hours and we very comprehensive. We would highly recommend Carlos as a guide.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

626771743.name: Neglected site off the the tourist trail
626771743.author: a TripAdvisor user
626771743.reviewBody:
The Xochicalco is a classic in many ways.The site is just outside Cuernavaca and easy to reach.We visited midweek and it was very quiet.It is busier at the weekends we were told.
There is a very attractive museum alongside which give insights into the culture and short history of this city-state.
The site itself is excellently maintained and all areas are accessible except where conservation or archeological work is under way.
There are panoramic views of the surrounding areas.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

621441331.name: An all too brief visit to the associated Museum and temple site. I learned a lot about the idigenous tribes and culture.
621441331.author: a TripAdvisor user
621441331.reviewBody: The weather was warm, partly cloudy, ususally rained at night if at all. Great food in various upper and mid range eateries. The markets were fun with great products and (comparatively) very reasonable prices. Part market, swap meet, flea market, and established permanent vendors. This is a great base from which to visit outlying villiages and towns.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

612440972.name: AMAZING XOCHICALCO
612440972.author: a TripAdvisor user
612440972.reviewBody: This is one of the most amazing places I have visited... Try to program your arrival so it coincides with very special astronomical reasons it was designed for... late spring/summer is the time of the year...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

589487738.name: UNBELIEVABLE
589487738.author: a TripAdvisor user
589487738.reviewBody: If you are within a couple hours of this place and you appreciate things other than cities, pools, and nightlife, DO NOT miss this. My friends who had been to Chichen Itza said this blew it out of the water. The remains are massive, you can climb them, would be easy to spend all day here. We wished we had packed a lunch so the kids would have lasted longer. It\'s accessible for all, not a big hike, but is 70 pesos admission (so cheap I thought). The coolest thing is that they\'ve only excavated 15% of all that is there!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

578419690.name: Worth your time
578419690.author: a TripAdvisor user
578419690.reviewBody: It was 70 peso for general admission. It\u2019s high up in the mountains so depending on where you\u2019re coming from it could be a long ride before you reach here. It was about 45 minutes from Cuernavaca. As you approach from afar you could kind of see the ruins, but once you step foot on the ruins it\u2019s pretty amazing. You\u2019ll start out in the museum and there\u2019s many displays about the history and artifacts. Eventually you\u2019ll get to the end which lead you to a path that takes you up to the ruins. As you walk through it, it just gets better and better. When you get to the highest point of the ruins, it\u2019s a wonderful view. The museum and ruins are well kept and very clean. I spent about 1 hour here and carrying a bottle of water is prefer. You\u2019ll enjoy it here at Xochicalco.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

576341688.name: A must go place in Mexico
576341688.author: a TripAdvisor user
576341688.reviewBody: A Mexican friend organized the visit for us for this opportunity. This archeology is hugeeee!  There are more than several Mayan Pyramids at this site, all of which have flat top and unlike other pyramids around the world.  The pyramids used smaller stone to build, which is easier to transport and build. The local stone is grey or black. Motive or pattern on the stone is intricate with mythical believe laid onto the stone similar to other archeological site stone such as Egypt. There\u2019s a lot to see and learn at this site. You need at least a few hours for this visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

575952696.name: Astounding, do not miss!
575952696.author: a TripAdvisor user
575952696.reviewBody: Definitely not the easiest archaeological site in Mexico to get to, but then again some of the most magnificent sites in Mexico (Yaxchilan, Monte Alban) aren\'t so easy to get to. The on-site museum is impressive and one of the best for the archaeological sites in Mexico. The pyramid of the feather serpent is rather astounding, and the historical importance of Xochicalco cannot be overstated. It was one of the great places of Mesoamerica. \n\nIt takes about 2 to 2-1/2 hours to drive here from Mexico City. Combine it with a visit and late lunch in Cuernavaca and you\'ve got a great day trip!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

566463715.name: This is a must see!!!
566463715.author: a TripAdvisor user
566463715.reviewBody: By not going to see this site would be a mistake!! Even if you are not interested in history of Mexico the way the Myan\'s built their temples is amazing.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

564953953.name: Excellent site, a must visit.
564953953.author: a TripAdvisor user
564953953.reviewBody: We suggest that you visit the museum first, to get an idea about the historical time of this site, before you tour the ruins. The placards are in Spanish. Because of the earthquake in September 2017, the Observatorio is closed, which is unfortunate, it would\'ve been fascinating to see. The main Temple with its carvings, and the view from the top all around the area is amazing. Bring water, and be sure to sip on it, it is always warmer than you think in the Cuernavaca region.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

556744311.name: Special Place
556744311.author: a TripAdvisor user
556744311.reviewBody: We both thought this was the best place to understand the history and culture of Mexico. Very informative and staff were outstanding. Went to Tepoztlan first but had wished we had come here first. If you only have time to do one this is the one.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

553045978.name: Great site; some structures closed due to earthquake damage (Jan 10, 2018)
553045978.author: a TripAdvisor user
553045978.reviewBody: We visited on Jan 10, 2018, and the museum and the archeological site are open, though some of the areas are closed off due to earthquake damage. The Temple of the Feathered Serpent IS accessible, and the carvings on the side are definitely the highlight of the trip. The North Ball Court was closed off but was visible from above. The Observatory and the path heading to the South Ball Court and La Malinche were roped off and inaccessible. Overall, this is still an amazing site and a visit is worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

551350649.name: Not to be missed
551350649.author: a TripAdvisor user
551350649.reviewBody: A stunning site that is well worth the visit and not to be missed while visiting Cuernavaca or the Caves of Cacahualmilpa located nearby.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

549515790.name: Is already open the most important and beautiful archaeological place in Morelos
549515790.author: a TripAdvisor user
549515790.reviewBody: After earthquake of September 19th, Xochicalco was closed due damages in the structure of the museum, however, since December 15, is open. The "pyramids" and other ancient structures are okay. Only the observatory is still closed.\nAnyway, Xochicalco is a great place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

547743193.name: Closed 13 November
547743193.author: a TripAdvisor user
547743193.reviewBody: Just an update on the last review. We were there on the 13th of November and the site was still closed. They may have reopened by now but be sure to double check. It was a longish day in the car with not much to show for our efforts. I look forward to trying again sometime soon-ish, as this is widely regarded as a very special site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

547664217.name: Archaeological Zone of Xochicalco
547664217.author: a TripAdvisor user
547664217.reviewBody:
I booked from Hotel Riazor a Private Tour with Turistica Ortega to go to see Xochicalco but the Guide did not check to make sure that it was open so we drove hours and it was closed as well as the Museum because of Earthquake damage.
Here I was alone with the Guide miles/Kms away from my Hotel and he offered a Lake( we have hundreds of Lakes near Vancouver Canada) or a cave as replacement( I have seen Cenotes and Caves throughout Mexico on my many trips all over Mexico...soooo the lake it was. It was sitting on a plastic chair getting hundreds of Mosquito bites until I said they were eating me alive lets go! He commented that I should have worn long pants as I was wearing shorts..BUT I paid for a Pyramid/Museum Tour, not a Lake, so why would I have worn long pants? 
He offered to take me to dinner back near my Hotel ( thank God I was near my Hotel) but taking me to dinner( which he should have paid for as I paid 2,500.00 pesoes cash at the Hotel for a Tour that I did not get ) but he grumbled when I thought my meal was 171 pesoes and he quickly said 181..woo woo I paid for my own meal! He offered to walk me from the Restaurant to my Hotel but all I wanted was to get back to the Hotel away from the guy . I emailed the Manager of Hotel Riazor after I got home about my experience. It has been weeks later and I am still recovering from masses of mosquito bites all over my legs!
Thank goodness all my other Tours were with Amigo Tours! My last Tour of my 2 week trip to Mexico City was Amigo Tours to Magical Towns of Real de Monte and Huasca de Ocampo with itching and hurting mosquito bites that made me look like I had measles or chicken pox...BUT Amigo Tours with Ivan was worth not cancelling my last tour( of 6 with them) as it was the very BEST Tour to me!
Beware of Turistica Ortega! I should have recived a partial refund but did not ask and he did not offer . I was just so glad to get back to my Hotel! What a crummy deal!
Lila

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

535088724.name: Xochicalco Archeological Site closed due to September 19th 2017 Earthquake
535088724.author: a TripAdvisor user
535088724.reviewBody: Due to structural damage to many of the Xochicalco\u2019s ancient buildings, the site is closed to the public. INAH and M\u00e9xico\u2019s federal engineers are currently working on accessing the damage to make the site safe to the public. There are many others wonderful things to do around Cuernavaca if you still want to visit and help the tourist industry in recover.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

529421529.author: a TripAdvisor user
529421529.reviewBody: Go and visit the pyramid of the plumbed serpent. The history and architecture are well worth the trip. Bring a hat and sunglasses as it is hot.  The vista is spectacular. Go into the cave and tour to the sun shaft. \n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

523295620.name: Amazing archeological site
523295620.author: a TripAdvisor user
523295620.reviewBody: build in 650-900 AD.  Museum and grounds are amazing.  recommend that you get a tour guide with strong knowledge of Mexican history.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

522643328.name: Shh-Keep this site a secret
522643328.author: a TripAdvisor user
522643328.reviewBody: This pristine archeological site less than an hour\'s drive from Cuernavaca is a quiet treasure with a good museum before or after you walk thru the site. No food is sold there,\nno crowds are destroying your tranquil visit: this is the anti-Teotihuacan pyramid site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

519144128.name: Much nice atmosphere pyramid
519144128.author: a TripAdvisor user
519144128.reviewBody: I live this pyramid much more than Teotijuacan pyramid because you can really enjoy the ambience much more when there are not so many tourists.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

513804779.name: Xochicalco
513804779.author: a TripAdvisor user
513804779.reviewBody:
Very interesting place to visit!
You can drive - Beware not to miss the exit before the Alpuyeca toll. It is on the right and poorly marked.

Entrance is about $7 (140 pesos for adults)
Children up to 13 are free

I would suggest you park on the right hand car park near the main entrance, buy your tickets, visit the museum and then drive over to the left entrance where there is parking and you can enter the park where the pyramids are.

It's usually hot there, so a hat would be a good idea and bottled water as you walk around.

There is a cave area to visit too inside one of the pyramids.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

512321098.name: Great excavation site
512321098.author: a TripAdvisor user
512321098.reviewBody: The whole site is in an immaculate condition. There is enough to see and explore, to easily spend half or even full day. We stayed there until it was shut down in the evening and enjoyed the wonderful sunset and view into the valley.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

511090660.name: Great place to visit
511090660.author: a TripAdvisor user
511090660.reviewBody: Xochicalco is a very well preserved place telling about the pre-hispanic history of Mexico. All the sights have a barcode which can be scanned with you smartphone and a voice will describe about that specific monument. Don\'t miss the observatory visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

503722260.name: Such history!
503722260.author: a TripAdvisor user
503722260.reviewBody: If you want to see pyramids and pre-Colombian ruins including ball fields, go to Xochicalco, outside of Cuernavaca. Interesting and awesome. There is an observatory with a hole through the rocks that shows the equinox. Spiritual. Look for copal trees.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

502953528.name: Super archaeological tour
502953528.author: a TripAdvisor user
502953528.reviewBody: Be sure to allocate enough time to climb the pyramids and associated grounds of this site.  The museum is impressive and the guided tour is very informative.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

501344889.name: Very intracate and interesting site
501344889.author: a TripAdvisor user
501344889.reviewBody: This site is in a beautiful setting, has a worthwhile museum attached to it, and there is a lot to see, just within the main ruins.  I suggest allowing at least 3 hours on-site if you want to see the museum and not feel too rushed when walking around and climbing the pyramids.  There are often thunderstorms on summer afternoons, so planning to be done by 3pm is probably advisable in the summer.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

490493935.name: Fantastic site
490493935.author: a TripAdvisor user
490493935.reviewBody:
Heard a lot about this site and finally visited it. I live in Cuernavaca and this site is about 40kms from here. I went by my car and It took me approximately 45 minutes(I went really slow). So many people have talked about the good things at the site. I will focus on the logistics when you travel by your own car. 

You can take Route 95D which goes towards Acapulco and take an exit near Xochicalco. The total toll from Cuernavaca was $44 MXN. Once I was off the highway, it was a little confusing as the roads are very narrow. However, you will quickly be able to get the route. Once you reach the site, you will first encounter the Museo on the right side. There is good amount of parking in the museum. We parked our car and went into the museum. The fee for an adult is 70 MXN and entry for kids up to age 13 is free. 

Please take the brochure with the information about the site which is kept in the reception area. It gives you a complete overview of the Museum and the Archeological site. 

By the way, both are away from each other. You will have to first complete the Museum and then proceed to the Archeological site. The ticket you purchased at the Museum is valid for the visit of the archeological site too. By walk, you will take about 7 - 10 minutes depending on how fast you walk. I went ahead and took my car which was kind of foolish as I later realized that I could have actually walked. Well, I did a very fast visit and took about 2Hrs to complete the visit. 

Overall it was a wonderful trip and we had a lot of fun.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

487023083.name: Its a great experience
487023083.author: a TripAdvisor user
487023083.reviewBody: Know the mesoamerican history and follow the prehispanic history is fantastic but read  about the history so you can fallow this very interesting site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

486878959.name: Spectacular hilltop site
486878959.author: a TripAdvisor user
486878959.reviewBody:
Xochicalco is special among the many Mexican ruins we have visited. Most similar to Monte Alban and Atsompa outside Oaxaca in its hilltop location, overlooking surrounding valleys. 
It is more remote from Cuernavaca than it might seem from a map, as the route there is circuitous and takes over half an hour by car, probably 90 minutes by local bus.
We took a taxi, 700 pesos for a round trip- the driver agreed to wait four hours for that price (they wanted 300-350 one way). The place a Pullman bus would drop you is a long, unshaded, fairly steep hike from the ruins, and you'd be pretty lucky to find a taxi. 
The temple of the plumed serpent is worth the trip in itself. Well preserved carvings of eight serpents wind around the base, with lots of other details as well. 
Another highlight was the observatory, a tunnel with a vertical shaft through which the sun comes directly at noon May 14 and some later date. We were there May 22, and it was still a pretty special sight. The room fills with light, and the site guard threw some dust in the air to provide a great photo op.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

486551245.name: One of Mesoamerica\'s Finest
486551245.author: a TripAdvisor user
486551245.reviewBody: We started our visit at the museum at 9:30 am, which provides a fantastic view of the pyramid and structures on the adjacent hilltop. We were the only ones at the museum and for most of our wandering around site. The site would benefit from being better marked (or a printed guide) so each structure was identifiable without a guide and guessing, but it is well worth a visit. While Tikal is much more impressive, Xochicalco provides an important  glimpse into the past of an overlapping time period in a different region of a fortified political, religious, and commercial center. The pyramid of Quetzalcoatl is a stunning sight along with the observatory (an underground chamber that lets in a ray of light to allow study of the movement of the sun) and the pathway with the stone animal tiles embedded in the walkway. We hired a driver who doubled as a guide. A worthwhile day visit from Cuernavaca.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

476978448.name: Fantastic place
476978448.author: a TripAdvisor user
476978448.reviewBody: I don\'t know how come this place, being so close to Mexico City is not so famous. When you get there you will see a sign that says "taquilla unica ", follow the directions and you will get to an outdoor parking lot, enough space, clean and safe. Once there you go to a small museum where you can buy a ticket to access the site for less than 3.50USD. You go back to your car and drive back to the place where you came first and follow the signs to go to a second parking lot at walking distance. You can buy water there, they also have clean rest rooms. There are no restaurants there.  The archeological site is fantastic, with breath taking views. From the many areas to visit, I recommend the Quetzalcoatl temple, the ball game court and of course the observatory. These 3 are a must to visit if you are short of time. I recommend you google for more information and pictures.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

476609021.name: Impressive
476609021.author: a TripAdvisor user
476609021.reviewBody: This is quite an impressive site for a mixed population that did nooccupybthe area for too long. I recommend getting a guide.  They offer a speed tour at can give you the most important highlights in one hour time.  There are really some interesting points such as tour different football fields and an agriculture calendar located inside a cave.\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

474285775.author: a TripAdvisor user

467681458.author: a TripAdvisor user
467681458.reviewBody: While much less impressive than other nearby sites, this one is very accessible as it is right in town.  There are current plans to build additional attractions on this site, which should help increase the popularity of this site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

461524786.name: wonderful afternoon at Xochicalco
461524786.author: a TripAdvisor user
461524786.reviewBody: Everything about this site is amazing.  It is clean, organized, interesting, beautiful, informative and awe inspiring.  A must see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

458712358.name: Great ruins.
458712358.author: a TripAdvisor user
458712358.reviewBody: Worth the extra effort to get there by bus.  We got the bus from the station close to the cathedral.  Our bus came back to the area by the market.  Local bus coming back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

458086392.name: A real jewel in Morelos
458086392.author: a TripAdvisor user
458086392.reviewBody: This archeological site is very interesting and it should be a must whenever you visit Morelos. The main reason for its worth is that a very important congress was held here. Important people from different ethnic groups, zapotecs, mayans and tlahuicans, gathered in 746 A.D. to make some adjustment in their calendar. The site has incredible architecture and the pyramid of the Feathered Snakes is a great example of carved stone with splendid figures all over it. \nIt also has a juego de pelota field and other structures and monoliths which make the site a complete journey to the past. During the equinox, spring and fall, it\'s possible to see the sun as it hits and lights up a cavern that was digged in the mountain. \nDon\'t miss this treasure that Morelos has for you!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

456989754.name: Xochicalco - super interesting
456989754.author: a TripAdvisor user
456989754.reviewBody: We had a private guide, Edgar Partida, who is very knowledgeable about Xochicalco and the cultural aspects of these ancient civilizations.\nI highly recommend both the archeological zone and the guide.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

456055207.name: Awesome
456055207.author: a TripAdvisor user
456055207.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this place.  It\'s truly amazing and worth a visit.  We arranged a private tour through ASLI in Cuernavaca, and were tremendously impressed.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

455463429.name: Worth the short trip
455463429.author: a TripAdvisor user
455463429.reviewBody: This archaeological zone is a very good size and in good shape. Plenty to see, at least 3 hours. I recommend hiring a taxi and having him wait, if you don\'t have a car.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

455017479.name: Amazing Archeological Site
455017479.author: a TripAdvisor user
455017479.reviewBody: We visited Xochicalco during a long weekend in Cuernavaca....it is only about 30-45 minutes outside of the city and well-worth a visit.  Most parts are easily walkable for all...not too many stairs even though it is at the top of a hill overlooking the entire valley.  The city is lovely and the museum of displays about the people who lived here is very interesting.  One word of warning: The Observatory is fascinating, but can be difficult for people suffering from claustrophobia.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

451072682.name: Very nice and impressive place!
451072682.author: a TripAdvisor user
451072682.reviewBody: This place is definitely worth while. It is huge, fantastic and impressive. Very beautiful. Additionally it is only about 1 hour away from Cuernavaca.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

450750577.name: Felt like Indiana Jones
450750577.author: a TripAdvisor user
450750577.reviewBody: We came in the middle off the week and we basically had the place to ourselves. What a great site to explore the museum was spectacular with plenty of amazing artifacts. Because we came in the middle of the week there wasn\'t any transportation from town so we had to wait a while for a scheduled bus to pick us up to take us back to Cuernavaca.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

445556631.name: Amazing place
445556631.author: a TripAdvisor user
445556631.reviewBody: Xochicalco is a kind of secret. Why? Because is not in the regular rutes of the big tourism. So, you can visit an amazing place enjoing at the same time the silence, the sound of nature, and a historic city planty of information about the past of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

442638027.name: You\'ll be there only people there
442638027.author: a TripAdvisor user
442638027.reviewBody: While not the most amazing ruins in Mexico, Xofhicalco is a nice place to visit.  Since it\'s kind of out of the way, you will probably be the only visitors there.  We spent a couple of hours walking around enjoying the place and the beautiful scenery you see from there (it\'s on a hill, so there are nice views).  There is public transportation from Cuernavaca.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

431440216.name: Worthwhile visiting
431440216.author: a TripAdvisor user
431440216.reviewBody: I went there by using public transprot from Tepoztlan (Morelos). Definitely very interesting place. What impressed me the most is the double courtyard of the structure on the main plaza, and also the carving of the temple of Feathered Serpent is quite something, as is the fact that there is no entrance door to inside of this temple, yet you can see that the inside exist by looking it from a higher grounds. Also, make sure to find the astrological observatory, quite something too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

430704540.name: 5* attraction
430704540.author: a TripAdvisor user
430704540.reviewBody: One of my highlights on my trip to Mexico. This site is so beautiful and picturesque. So many different things to see. Cannot recommend this attraction enough. Definite must-do!!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

422459773.name: Awestruck by the place
422459773.author: a TripAdvisor user
422459773.reviewBody: It took 2 and half hours from Mexico city to reach Zona de archaeology of Xochicalco. The ruins of thousand years back are preserved so well. Astronomical observatory is amazing,it was used to study the movement of sun. The main ceremonial center of the city has constructions built pointing  the perfect directions on compass.When we clapped here, we heard the echo as the sound of a bird. There is a museum near to the archeology site . Plan a day to visit this place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

412026140.name: Absolutely worth your time!
412026140.author: a TripAdvisor user
412026140.reviewBody: I\'ve been to many archaeological sites throughout South And Central America.  If you find yourself near Xochicalo you should check it out!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

409689585.name: Don\'t Deny Yourself this Adventure
409689585.author: a TripAdvisor user
409689585.reviewBody: Xochicalco is the ideal archaeological site to learn and experience what Pre-Hispanic life was about. This is the place where several tribe leaders met to perfect the calendar. Hire an English speaking guide if possible. Guides are available on site but not always bilingual, so ask your hotel staff. The museum is well worth the visit and all facilities are clean. The views from the top are well worth the visit. In May or during bright sunny days, there is a light phenomenon that shows how advanced these cultures of Mexico were in 600- 1,200 AC. .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

407242604.name: #1 for a reason!
407242604.author: a TripAdvisor user
407242604.reviewBody:
Breath taking would be words I would describe the Xochicalco ruins. I went in mid January of this year and it was perfect weather! I went with my mother and cousin and there were very few people (which made the experience feel even more intimate and magical!)

You will need at LEAST 4+ hours to fully explore the area calmly. We were there for only four hours and there was still about 25% we didn't get to explore. 

Honestly, it is so difficult to not just stay put a top of one of these beautiful ruins and feel amazing. The views are beautiful and I teared up a bit because I couldn't believe my ancestors built such magnificent things! 

Whether you travel alone or with company this is a MUST see place!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

406693527.name: Beautiful historic ruins
406693527.author: a TripAdvisor user
406693527.reviewBody: I had been leaving for many years in Cuernavaca and I did not visited Xochicalco, but this month my wife convicted us to go. I was astonished to see this extraordinary ruins. The place is very nice and clean.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

401870083.name: Visiting the Archeological Site XOCHICALCO
401870083.author: a TripAdvisor user
401870083.reviewBody: This is one of the most well known Prehispanic buildings in Mesoamerica.  The museum is environmental friendly  using mostly solar energy as well as rainwater collection for use in restrooms. \nThe site it is very impressive in size, the observatory it is very cool.  I learned a lot today and would like to invite you to come an visit XOCHICALCO.  Make sure you bring sun block, sun glasses and or a hat. Don\'t be afraid of asking questions to the staff they are very friendly

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

397077417.name: Nothing like it in all of Mesoamerica
397077417.author: a TripAdvisor user
397077417.reviewBody: It\'s not as huge as some sites, but the history of Xochicalco and the engravings on the pyramids are phenomenal. Get a guide, though, because just wandering around on your own is great, but you learn so much more when someone is pointing out and explaining things like the calendar and the symbols.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

395994807.name: Incredible!
395994807.author: a TripAdvisor user
395994807.reviewBody: A must see! We visited the site on a Saturday. We arrived around 11h and  we were surprised to see that there was almost nobody, perhaps 35 persons on the site. Perfect to take pictures. The ruins are well preserved. Definitely worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

390353106.name: Beautiful site
390353106.author: a TripAdvisor user
390353106.reviewBody: Beautiful, extensive with many relief carvings still preserved. It\'s quite a walk around the whole site, but well-worth it. You\'d need a car both to get there and move between the museum grounds and the archaeological zone itself.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

384102807.name: Worth seeing it specially in June
384102807.author: a TripAdvisor user
384102807.reviewBody: Very nice clean organized archeological site. The pyramids are beautiful, please don\'t expect it to be like Chichenitza, however the views are impressive, if you visit in June you will see the observatory light right straight into the caves.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

382583916.name: amazing place if you like archeology
382583916.author: a TripAdvisor user
382583916.reviewBody: visited with friends.  great ruins, lots to see.  you can climb the ruins which is great cause you cant in some sites.  very little detail provided but do some research first and you will enjoy more.  amazing bowls carved from basalt used in rituals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

382041115.name: the observatory is unique, especially in June when the sun is shining and that a beam goes through the ceiling and reach
382041115.author: a TripAdvisor user
382041115.reviewBody: to visit the place takes about 4 hours. Xochicalco is the 3rd best archaeological zone in Mexico. Everything is to be seen. Try to visit the astr. observatory at noon in June. Exceptional.\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

374990357.name: Beautiful Ruins!
374990357.author: a TripAdvisor user
374990357.reviewBody: This was a great experience and I would highly recommend!  \n\nThe ruins were breathtaking and in very good condition.  There is a museum with more wonderful artifacts and education about the site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

368957817.author: a TripAdvisor user
368957817.reviewBody: Went with a guide back to this amazing place to again see the ball court.  Story told a few times, but still resonates a good use for your enemy\'s head.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

360731089.name: A breathtaking historical  experience
360731089.author: a TripAdvisor user
360731089.reviewBody: An out of the way location but well worth it .No crowds to contend with .A beautiful Museum to get you stared and fantastic views everywhere .A MUST see .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

359034617.name: One of the best archeological sites in Mexico
359034617.author: a TripAdvisor user
359034617.reviewBody: I\'ve been to a number of archaeological sites in Mexico including Teoteochucan, Mitla, Uxmal, Tulum, Koba, Chichenitza.  Xochicalco ranks as my favorite.  While the pyramids aren\'t as majestic, the layout enables you to envision life there.  The museum is exquisite and informative.  Be sure to hire a guide to get the most out of the experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

358884091.name: Simply Breathtaking
358884091.author: a TripAdvisor user
358884091.reviewBody: Beautiful place! So interesting. Just be prepared for the long walk. Go the the bathroom before starting this walk. My kids enjoyed it

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

352182003.name: Walking in the ancestorial steps
352182003.author: a TripAdvisor user
352182003.reviewBody: The museum had great artifacts but what I liked most about this place was there were not many tourists.  We spent quite a bit of time just "being" in this ancient place.  The observatory under the temple was magical.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

351706600.name: Especially liked the musuem at the ruins
351706600.author: a TripAdvisor user
351706600.reviewBody:
I have visited a number of ruins in Latin America.  It was about 45 minutes outside of Cuernavaca by taxi.  If you go by taxi, it is a must to have that taxi wait for you because there is no place to catch a return taxi since the ruins are off the main road.  
We planned to spend 2.5 hours at the site.  Our driver let us out at the entrance to the ruins, but you then have to walk down the hill about 1000 feet to the museum to buy your tickets.  So, have your taxi let you out at the museum first!.  
Once you buy your tickets, you should spend time at the museum.  I would estimate almost 1 hour.  It is really good.

After you buy your tickets, you then can take the path up the hill to the ruins entrance.  We spent around 1 hr. 15 minutes walking around the ruins.  They are relatively small, but interesting.  Once place you definitely want to go in the ruins in the cave of the light which is a cave with a hole in the top that the indigenous people used to plot the sun and structure the calendar.  We found that to be very interesting.  It is a little hard to find on the back side of the ruins, but there are signs.  

When you leave the ruins and if you exit on the back side, there is a little snack place and clean restrooms.  That is where we had our taxi wait for us.  We paid a total of 600 pesos for our driver to take us out there, wait 2.5 hours, and drive us back for a total time of about 4 hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

349838364.name: Lovely Ruins of Xochicalco
349838364.author: a TripAdvisor user
349838364.reviewBody:
I loved my visit to Xochicalco.  It is a beautiful spot with great views of the countryside--this city was constructed for defensive purposes and they certainly would have seen their enemies coming.  

Even on a Saturday, there were not too many tourists visiting, so no worries about crowds.  Be sure to bring water and a sunhat/sunscreen.  That area is very, very dry in the winter, no humidity at all.  

The observario was spectacular!  Do not miss it, just wait until the attendant comes to unlock the gate and give you the tour and explanation (all in Spanish).  The museum, where you pay for your ticket and receive a pamphlet map with suggested walking route, is excellent.  Such a beautiful spot.

Allow about 3 hours, more or less, for the museum and ruins.  We took the 11:04 Pullman Morelos bus from Cuernavaca, it drops you on the road and you can get a taxi for 30 pesos up to the museum entrance.  Coming back we did the same thing, but caught a local bus back to Cuernavaca at the crossroads and had to change to a bus that went into the town centre, dropping us near the Zocalo.  Just ask someone for help if need be.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

349503064.name: Out of the Way & Worth the Trip
349503064.author: a TripAdvisor user
349503064.reviewBody:
Two ways to visit Xochicalco by public transit.
Via a TripAdvisor review we were alerted to the Pullman de Morelos direct bus service from Cuernavaca to the ruins and apparently it runs daily now or not.  When it does run, there is one trip per day at 10:04.  To return, you will wait for the milk run bus back to the Centro Mercado.  We booked a oneway ticket the day before for Saturday - $40 Pesos each.  A bonus was the Pullman bus station is at the corner down the street from our hotel  Villas Bonita in Centro (same street as the Robert Brady Museum - at the corner of  Netzahualcoytl & Mariano Abasolo).

Second means is by bus to and from from the bus station (jumbled transit exchange) at the central market.  To get to the market from Centro on foot (about a 15 minute walk) follow the oneway road (Gutenberg - the one that runs between the kitty-corner of the two Zocalo halves), walk opposite to the vehicle travel down hill until you cross the river.  Turn left (on Adolfo Lopez Mateos) at this busy intersection and in about 300 metres the central market and bus station will be on the right.  Make your way through the maze of vendors, up a few flights of steps and you will emerge at the transit hub.  Ask one of the many drivers where to catch the Xochicalco bus.  It will make several stops along the way so not as quick as the Pullman option.  90 minutes as opposed to 45 for Pullman.  However the price is only 15 Pesos.

The Pullman bus dropped us off at the park entrance, however you must go to the Museum on the other side of the valley (about 1 km on a pathway) to purchase the entry ticket ($65 Pesos).  A visit to the museum is a must see.  Well done, gorgeous building and it offers a fine view of the ruins across the valley.  The main drawback for us, its all in Spanish.  But when you get to the ruins, the markers have English translation.

The site:
We have been to other ruins in Mexico, (Teotihuacan, Monte Alban, Mitla, Izapa) all are different.  We rate Xochicalco as one of the better ones for the amount and diversity of preserved structures.  It is not as large a site as Teotihuacan or Monte Alban but exceptional on its own.  Parts of it have some resemblance to Monte Alban.

The"Observatario" is open from 10 to 5, the same hours as the park.  However it is only accessible with a park guide.  If you are not in a tour group it is perfectly acceptable to enter with a guided group or if its a quiet day, the attendant may be waiting for you at the cave entrance.  Make the effort to check it out, you will be rewarded.  Overall its obvious why Xochicalco received UNESCO World Heritage listing in 1999.

After our visit, we waited the 10 Mexico minutes  (35 actually) for the 90 minute return ride to the Cuernavaca Centro Mercado.
We departed at 10 AM and we back at our hotel at 3:30 PM.

If you do not have time our do not want the public transit experience, you can hire a taxi - price unknown to us.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

336526494.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

336395031.name: Hard to get to but lovely to visit and awesome views
336395031.author: a TripAdvisor user
336395031.reviewBody: Quiet uncrowded city with spectacular carved stonework in place my partner says the best he has seen and he\'s seen a lot. No vendors no real services so come prepared w your own food and drink. On a hill top s amazing views. Very unspoilt. Good small museum. Very recommended. If you travel from Cuernavaca the local bus runs from the main food market and takes 1.5-2 hours as I stops everywhere but does take you to main gate. Consider it part of the experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

331505159.name: Impressive
331505159.author: a TripAdvisor user
331505159.reviewBody: Virtually as impressive as the Mayan ruins. I say "virtually" only because the excavation work was not as extensively done. But the volume, height and breadth of the structures were quite monumental. I will always wonder what these American civilizations would have been like if the encounter with the Spanish had been collaborative rather than one of conquest, subjugation, enslavement and forced conversion.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

328052291.name: Visit now, before it becomes \'too\' famous
328052291.author: a TripAdvisor user
328052291.reviewBody:
Only this year did this pyramid site join the list of world heritage sites.  There aren't yet a horde of people, and the mountain setting is truly lovely, so enjoy this before it becomes too popular!  It's not in Cuernavaca, but you can take local buses to it.  The Pullman buses in the historic downtown run direct service, but only Sat/Sun.  Otherwise you're dropped off a cab ride away (my driver charged 30 pesos, though I suspect that was high.) Other local buses go directly to it, but are harder to 'find' in busy Cuernavaca.  I took a local bus back directly from the site, and luckily met some friendly Spanish-speaking tourists, who figured out where to get off and how to get back to the historic center of Cuernavaca.  

The site has been well-reconstructed, and is not difficult for older people to navigate, though no handicapped accessibility.  The museum is splendid - and is unfortunately not that close. It's about a 15-20 minute walk down and then up a hill, but don't miss the museum.  (And do come well-fed or with snacks. I went in the afternoon and by 1 pm, their restaurant was closed. Go figure.)

The archaology site is easy to navigate to see the main points, and thankfully, has good English translations. THE MUSEUM HAS NONE - go figure. As archaeology sites go, it's not the most elaborate, but is quite beautiful and definitely worth the trip.

Again, the mountain setting is lovely and peaceful. And if you're lucky, maybe you'll even see some wildlife. I found a handsome little ground squirrel munching away on roots as I strolled through. 

 To do justice to Xochicalco, allow a full half-day - that's enough for the museum and the site itself. Time to and from Cuernavaca is 45 minutes to 1 1/2 hours (took Pullman bus down and local bus back). If you leave Cuernavaca just before noon, you'll be OK. The site closes at either 5 or 5:30, as I recall.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

314404526.name: Large archeological area with a lot of former buildings and courtyards - almost undiscovered by tourists
314404526.author: a TripAdvisor user
314404526.reviewBody: I have visited this site three or four times now, and noticed that in all the hours spent there, we we on opur own for 80% of the time. In comparison with other archeological sites this is strange and rare. There is also a nice museum attached to the site, which  is also almost empty. Both the site and the museum are really worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

311714233.name: Travel back on time, gorgeous pyramids
311714233.author: a TripAdvisor user
311714233.reviewBody: Beautiful archeological site, is a must see if you are in the area, the views of the pyramids are breathtaking, the museum is very rich in culture, you are definitely up for a cultural treat.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

304772563.name: Guiding Scotland 2013
304772563.author: a TripAdvisor user
304772563.reviewBody: Amazing place! The views and the history make for a fascinating visit!! We were there in July during the rainy season, but all that meant for us was that it was beautifully green and lush under foot as we visited. Stunning place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

300429176.name: One of the best archaelogical sites in Mexico
300429176.author: a TripAdvisor user
300429176.reviewBody:
This is a grand site.  It is off the beaten track, but worth the effort of driving 20 minutes off the  highway to Acapulco  on a good paved road.  Once there, make sure you visit the museum.  It is lovely, and from inside you can see through a large glass window all the way up the hillside to the ruins.  

Walk through all the ruins.  And I would say it is worth it to hire one of the guides.  This is a majestic site, and they will be able to take you inside one of the large structures to see where the sun shines directly in on the summer and winter solstices.  

After leaving the site to return to the highway, there are many small restaurants where you can experience some very good food.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

299658595.name: Beautiful
299658595.author: a TripAdvisor user
299658595.reviewBody: It is well-maintained and beautiful. It is also an easy trip from Cuernavaca (around 90 minutes or so). Go during the week when school is is session, and you will have the place to your self. Be sure to have a tour guide though otherwise you won\'t fully appreciate it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

299458592.name: My husband loves Xochicalco!
299458592.author: a TripAdvisor user
299458592.reviewBody: Xochicalco has ruins that are unique and different from the architecture of Teotihuacan.  If you\'re interested in prehispanic culture and architecture, you will love it as my husband does!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

291824330.name: Wow

And higher one of the frendly local specialist to take you an a tour cheap 400 pesos and so worth it. Stay till dark to view beautiful stars from atop the pyramid but bring a sleeping bag because its hard to find a ride back to town after dark

288838390.author: a TripAdvisor user
288838390.reviewBody: We loved this pyramid complex. Walking among the buildings was serene and mystical. And there were much less crowds than Teotihuacan.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

287625815.reviewBody:
It's an amazing place to visit,I recommend to use a pair of tenis to walk confotable around the place.
The weather on summer is nice, better than Spring, keep sunglases and a bottle of water to stay hydrated. 
The view from this place is wonderful.
The fisrt step is the museum, after the piramids.
On sundays the visit is free to all the Mexicans.

273389827.reviewBody:
Wonderful archeological site.
The pyramid with two serpents is exquisite. Also, the astronomic observatory is a testament to the knowledge of these ancient people.
The area is very peaceful with good views of the valley below.
Good stopover en route to Taxco from Mexico City.
Take a hat, sunscreen and water. Wear good walking shoes, and your camera .

270457402.author: a TripAdvisor user
270457402.reviewBody: The museum of archaelogical findings were amazing! The archaeological site itself was facinating! We had a guide who was able to explain the details of the excavations.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

263347755.name: One of those hidden treasures
263347755.author: a TripAdvisor user
263347755.reviewBody: Smaller and less famous than other archeological sites Xochicalco has it\'s own charm. Is famous because of their astronomic studies.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

262190160.name: Nice half-day trip
262190160.author: a TripAdvisor user
262190160.reviewBody: The scene was breath-taking from the mountain tops. The soccer field and the observatory is a must-see. It is said that during two seasons every year, for two days each season, as the sun passes through its zenith, on May 14th and 15th and again on July 28th and 29th, a very strong ray of sunlight passes through a narrow shaft in the ceiling of the observatory to the floor.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

260253445.name: A multi-cultural arquelogical jewel
260253445.author: a TripAdvisor user
260253445.reviewBody: Well set-up.  Influenced by many ancient Mexican cultures.  Fantastic location, with a great regional view.  Don\'t expect jungle.  This is a semi-dry area.  1.5 hours from Mexico City and 45 minutes from Cuernavaca.  Don\'t miss it if you have the time and like archeology or anthropology.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

258777950.name: Wonderful ruins
258777950.author: a TripAdvisor user
258777950.reviewBody: Visited the ruins by local bus, took an hour and a half to get there so leave time for the travel if going via bus. We left Cuernavaca at 12.30 and had just enough time to see the Museo and the site before closing time at 5pm. The Museo is well put together but all in Spanish, it would have taken us all day to piece together all the information in our limited knowledge so we mainly browsed the displays. The actual site is a short, easy walk up the hill from the Museo. The ruins are a lot bigger when you start walking around them than they appear on the maps so come prepared with sensible shoes, sunscreen and water. All in all the site is well restored with access to a majority of areas. La pir\u00e0mide de las Serpientes Emplumadas for us was the showpiece with the beautiful carved stone frieze around the sides. Don\'t miss the observatory it\'s a little hidden past the northern ball court but really interesting. Definitely the number one attraction in Cuernavaca!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

256058949.name: Best sight in Cuernavaca area
256058949.author: a TripAdvisor user
256058949.reviewBody: Xochicalco is the best sight near Cuernavaca. It\'s about a 35 minute taxi ride from Cuernavaca. Site has two large pyramid, one with the rulers palace on top, many large open plazas, and the main sight, the temple of the feathered serpent, is well worth admission. I wouldn\'t choose this sight over Teotihuacan, but if you have the time Xochicalco and Taxco make for a great day trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

255442273.name: Nicely Preserved and Presented
255442273.author: a TripAdvisor user
255442273.reviewBody: It is a little ways out of town, so if you don\'t feel like driving, take a tour bus from Cuernavaca.  The grounds are nicely maintained with wonderful displays in the museum with explanations in English and Spanish and guides available.  Well worth the trip.  I\'ve been here twice.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

247486749.name: Stunning archaeological zone
247486749.author: a TripAdvisor user
247486749.reviewBody: How things have changed since I first visited in 1981. This is now a major archaeological site with tons of cool stuff to see. You park at the museum and walk up to the site. The museum itself is very well done for a regional museum, very nicely executed. The site itself is chock full of pyramids, carvings, 2 ball courts, and an observatory. So so so very cool. Pro tip - prepare as if hiking, dress appropriately and bring water. I love this place and I think you will too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

243830240.name: Don\'t Miss Xochicalco!
243830240.author: a TripAdvisor user
243830240.reviewBody: This site was once home to over 35,000 people.  These ruins have been well-restored and offer a glimpse of native life centuries ago.  There are guides available, which I would recommend if you will only go once.  The walking is not strenuous. Less than an hour from Cuernavaca.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

242456706.reviewBody: I liked the spot, the surrounding, the views, but I disliked the lack of informations and You know that they do nor held any more the Sound and Lights only when You arrive at the gate !

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

242402757.name: Xochicalco is a must!
242402757.author: a TripAdvisor user
242402757.reviewBody: One of my favorite archaeological treasures. It is close to Cuernavaca and easily visited. There is a great museum with an incredible view of the site. It is well worth a visit of two to three hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

241984214.name: Amazing site!
241984214.author: a TripAdvisor user
241984214.reviewBody: You gotta make it here! Fully renovated roads for a safe trip and a place that I will never forget.\n\nMake sure you travel in the morning, but not that early so you can have a safe way back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

239997462.name: Amazing experience
239997462.author: a TripAdvisor user
239997462.reviewBody: The views are as incredible as the ruins. Lovely museum with friendly staff and very interesting artifacts. Would definitely recommend a trip out to these ruins if you have the time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

229529797.name: Constantly Amazed
229529797.author: a TripAdvisor user
229529797.reviewBody: Its like looking at the way a civilization lived 1000s of years ago. There is one ruin that apparently many Japanese come to look at because they found the same writings on the ruin as on a ruin in the Sea of Japan! Beautifuk view of the sky from here too, no buildings and you are on top of a mountain - its a great day trip!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

227932225.name: Another Must See in Cuernavaca
227932225.author: a TripAdvisor user
227932225.reviewBody: If you relish in the old pyramids and Aztec culture as I do, then you will delight in your visit to Cuernavaca.  After visiting the shopping mall with all the amenities and shops we have in the States, you\'ll ride around the corner, not far, and there you are in the Archaeological Zone of Zochicalco!  You literally will enjoy the best of all worlds in this fascinating city of Eternal Spring!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

225981150.name: Archeological treasure
225981150.author: a TripAdvisor user
225981150.reviewBody: Xochicalo is a beautiful site just south of Cuernavaca. The ball courts, the pyramid of the plumed serpent, the underground observatory are all worth seeing. It is also recognized as a World Heritage Site. You can spend a lot of time browsing on your own, but be sure to have a guide who can explain the meeting of the Zapotec, Maya and Aztec astronomers who met here in 743 A.D. to adjust the calendar. \nThe Museum at the site is a good place to start your visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

224333837.name: Hidden Secret
224333837.author: a TripAdvisor user
224333837.reviewBody: I love pyramids and research ancient Mexico for a living. Teotihuacan is fun, amazing but often overwhelmed with tourists. Head to Xochicaclo instead for a quiet, beautiful experience taking in pyramids built atop a mountain amidst butterflies and iguana and then return to Cuernavaca (about 1 hr away) and stay, as I did, in Casa Chocolate for an amazing night\'s sleep and divine breakfast. Arturo Galindo, galgodigital@gmail.com, can help you arrange taxi service from Mexico City or Cuernavaca to the pyramids. His English is impeccable and knowledge of Mexico unending.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

219464843.name: a major attraction with few tourists around
219464843.author: a TripAdvisor user
219464843.reviewBody: This is a huge archeological area which requires about 3 hours to visit. The most memorable is the visit to the cave of the Observatorio, where they explain and demonstrate some things relevant to the astronomical observations done by the original inhabitants. The most memorable building is the Plumed Serpent Pyramid, an astonishing and truly unforgettable site, not found in any other pre-columbian ruins. The museum is worth visiting AFTER the visit to the site, which makes it a little complicated considering that the museum (where you first need to buy your ticket) is about half  a mile from the ruins. \nThe best thing about Xochicalco is the relative absence of tourists which allows for slow undisturbed exploration.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

219092032.name: An excellent day trip from Cuernavaca
219092032.author: a TripAdvisor user
219092032.reviewBody: Wonderful museum, very recently designed. Lables are unfortunately only in Spanish, and this is relatively obscure subject matter so hard to translate.\nThe site is magnificent, with a temple platform completely covered by original sculpted stone work. If you are there in summer, make sure you see the working "observatory."

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

217521784.name: Great trip for a group
217521784.author: a TripAdvisor user
217521784.reviewBody: We had a group of teachers in Cuernevaca staying at CCID to learn about social justice and cultural issues.  As part of our trip we did get to visit Xochicalco which is expansive ruins.  Our tour guide (I forget his name as it was a few years ago) was a fantastic story teller and knew his facts but was able to represent them in a fluid manner, and for us with poor Spanish his English was fantastic!  \n\nGo off the beaten path and visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

217216677.name: Worth the stop over
217216677.author: a TripAdvisor user
217216677.reviewBody:
Xochicalco archeological site is impressive by its size ( total above  700 hectares , but only a small part already searched) and it's location at the top of three hills with a gorgeous view on the valley and nearby lakes . We were there in rainy season so evrything was green , the water was running and the birds were all around singing .
The guide who took us around the site was reasonably informed , although some hypothesis on the way of life on this site more than one thousand years ago sounded far fetched ; in the end they were only hypothesis . 
We went fast through the museum to be on the site before it got really hot , so we did not get a good view of the collections inside .
The site itself is just impressive by its sheer size , it quantity of buildings , it's view and it's calm .
We were told it is the third most visited archeological site in Mexico but it did not look like it ,as it was  very quiet and peaceful .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

214877788.name: interesting place!
214877788.author: a TripAdvisor user
214877788.reviewBody: such a great place with a lot of history! i wish we could have had a guide in english to understand more. here there is a ton of original art. dont miss this, its very close to cuernavaca! and its super hot, bring water

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

214233493.name: Where to find the colectivo to go to Xochicalco
214233493.author: a TripAdvisor user
214233493.reviewBody:
If you ask where to find the colectivo to get to Xochicalco, you will be told "At the market". The area at the market where the colectivos leave from is huge, buses everywhere, but your bus does not leave from here. (When I asked locals - I speak reasonable Spanish - and even some bus drivers, they sent me all over the place, rather than admit they did not know where the colectivo left from. They weren't being nasty, they just didn't know.)

Follow the road that leads out of the colectivo area, (follow the buses). It goes up a rise, turning gently to the right, with a very high stone wall on the right hand side. At the top is an intersection, with a roundabout. Go to the right, and continue about 50 - 100 metres, when you will see, on the other side of the road the Lasser bus station. Their buses to Xochicalco (and beyond) leave about every 30 minutes and cost just a very few pesos to Xochicalco. The bus drops you off at the road to the site (about 200 or so metres from the entrance) and you catch the bus to go back at the same place, on the other side of the road. It is advisable to check what time the last colectivo goes past to go back to Cuernavaca, as you wouldn't want to be stranded there! When I was there, (Jan 2014) the last bus was about 5.30 pm.

Hopefully this will save you half an hour or more finding your colectivo!

Unfortunately I can't properly rate Xochicalco, as when we arrived, the whole site was unexplainedly closed, even the staff hanging round the locked gate didn't know what was going on. I'll try again next trip!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

211754589.name: Must visit
211754589.author: a TripAdvisor user
211754589.reviewBody:
Near Cuernavaca, (18°48′14″N 99°17′45.3″W) there is a Maya city that has many interesting sights. 
1-It has 3 juegos de pelota (ball games). Those were used for many different things depending on the civilisation, the situation and the occasion. For example, many scholars think they were used to resolve disputes between cities, a proxy for warfare. In the Aztec civilisation, they were used to provide sacrificial victims. In one city, the victors were sacrificed while in another, the losers were. (Don’t ask me, I wasn’t there)
2-It has an observatory. This was probably used to verify the movements of the moon which were essential to predict eclipses or to supply dates for planting etc.
3-It has one  of the most interesting building in all cities, the Temple of the feathered serpent, Quetzalcoatl  for the Aztecs, Kukulcan for the Mayas. (amongst other names). 
The 8 serpents covered with feathers, shells and perls represent the old deity of the water, waving through the mountains, similar to the Feathered Serpent in Teotihuacan. Among the undulations, a seated figure and a date are alternatively depicted. There are also places, animals and fragments of human figures in different postures. It is possible that the decoration of the temple was dedicated to the warrior's caste and that the presence of animals, like pumas and eagles referred to different ranks or groups. (Universes in universe)
The Temple of the Feathered Serpent has fine stylized depictions of that deity in a style which includes apparent influences of Teotihuacan and Maya art. (Wikipedia)
This is a major late-classic period city and is a must for anyone wanting to understand the culture of Mexico. This is one of the “World Heritage sites” .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

207734073.name: Archaeological zone
207734073.author: a TripAdvisor user
207734073.reviewBody: Xochicalco is an impressive destination that has the ability to make people travel into the past and imagine how this culture lived. Amazing visit, definitely worth to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

207613749.name: Impressive ruins near Cuernavaca
207613749.author: a TripAdvisor user
207613749.reviewBody:
This site is very close to Cuernavaca and to Tequesquitengo.  It is located on a mountain top, which makes it all the more impressive. The views all over the place are beautiful. 

The pyramids are very well kept and have amazing carvings.  Also the observatory is outstanding and very different from the ones on other sites in Mexico. It is definitely worth a visit.  

To see everything at a leasurely pace, you need about 3 hours in the site. There are NO vendors, so be sure to bring water, a hat and lots of  sunscreen. The museum of the site is very interesting, too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

207524469.name: Beautiful Archaeological site
207524469.author: a TripAdvisor user
207524469.reviewBody: If you are on the area DON\'T MISS IT, good walk, Nice small museum next to it...read about the area before you go so you can understand the importance of the Xochicalco area on the pre-spanic era.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

205725231.name: Gem of an archaeological site
205725231.author: a TripAdvisor user
205725231.reviewBody: I\'ve visited Xochicalco many times; it never disappoints and guests I take are astounded at this amazing site - little discussed, close to Cuernavaca.  It\'s museum is excellent .Though small, it is very well done.  It is also a fascinating free building.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

203847278.name: Amazing!
203847278.author: a TripAdvisor user
203847278.reviewBody: The place is really close to Cuernavaca. If you consider visiting this all-natural attraction, make sure you also visit the museum right next to the pyramids. During spring and summer the weather is amazingly hot, make sure you bring water, there\'s nowhere near to get some once you have entered.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

201226785.name: Beautiful archealogical site very close to Cuernavaca
201226785.author: a TripAdvisor user
201226785.reviewBody: The place is very close to Cuernavaca and it is well kept. Don\'t miss the museum, one of the first ecological museums in America and it is very well organized. On the down-side they don\'t offer a bookstore in the premises to accompany your visit. Also, they don\'t have a cafeteria, so go well nourished for a good walk and bring plenty of water along.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

201205437.name: Site of the first documented scientific meeting in the americas
201205437.author: a TripAdvisor user
201205437.reviewBody: This is the best archeological site in the region; I reserve five points to the very great ones like Theotihuacan, Tikal, Uxmal, Chicenitza, Tajin and Palenque,,\nXochicalco is particularly interesting because of the sculptured pyramid that represents the documented scientific meeting in the Americas. Note Mayan and highland priests and left of the staircase the Mayan calendar glyph from which two hans stretch out, one to touch a highland calendar symbol and the other to hold another highland calendar symbol with a string.\nGreat excursion that can  be combined with the grutas de cachuamilpa and/or with Taxco.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

199679337.name: Piramid of The snake
199679337.author: a TripAdvisor user
199679337.reviewBody:
Nice piramids you can visit On About 3/4 hour drive from cuernavaca. Not very Well known and therefore not that busy.

There is a nice little museum you can visit. You can buy tickets For The actual piramids there. A little Walk or ride up The road to The entrance of The piramids. 

The Piramid of the snake is The main attraction.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

198675406.name: Xochicalco - Closed due to Dispute
198675406.author: a TripAdvisor user
198675406.reviewBody: One of my all-time favorite archaeological destinations I have been told by locals while here in Curena Vaca, has been temporarily closed. The community land owners of the sacred site have not received any due compensation from the Mexico Federal Government for use of the land as a revenue stream. At the same time, I am told, that the Mexican Government is loosing money because so many locals cannot afford the entrance fees. So sad...\n\nCall before you go.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

195117648.name: Beautiful Ruins
195117648.author: a TripAdvisor user
195117648.reviewBody: Xochicalco (so-chi-kal-ko) is a ancient Mayan complex in the Mexican state of Morelos. It is a beautiful set of ruins. They provide scenic views of the mountains, as well as spectacular rock pyramids and monuments. Take the time to properly see these ruins. They are worth the time to see. A great side trip from either Cuernavaca or Mexico City to learn more about the Mayans.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

194636422.name: Beautiful place!
194636422.author: a TripAdvisor user
194636422.reviewBody: Gorgeous & amazing place! A perfect place to go for knowing the Mayan Culture. Beautiful views of Morelos\'s mountains! It\'s amazing seeing up there a sunset. Better time of the year visiting there is on March (spring) or on October-November (just after rains).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Xochicalco Tetlama, sin numero Xochicalco, Municipio de Miacatlan, Morelos

193004701.name: Ancient, Beautiful and So Serene
193004701.author: a TripAdvisor user
193004701.reviewBody: Xochicalco is such an amazing site. The area is very large and even if there are several tour buses visiting you can always find a quiet place to sit and contemplate the wonders of this ancient marvel. Pay attention and don\'t miss visiting the observatory where a masterfully crafted opening in the rock ceiling denotes the optimal time for planting and harvesting crops. The view from the heights of Xochicalco is outstanding as you witness the beauty of a large lake that glitters like blue diamonds in the distance and the hillsides and mountains on the horizon create some glorious photos. This location has one of the nicest rock carvings I have seen in all my Mexican pyramid visits. The details are clear and easy to photograph.
