Along the way, we asked directons of people on the street and it was, as the bus driver had instructed, todo derecho, through a moderately pleasant Mexican bario.

   When we got there, what we saw, through the chain link fence, was a couple tiny pyramids in the center of a large dusty field.Not only that, but te authorities were going to charge us yanquis admission.  The deforestation around the pyramids makes the site unappealing.  Those rocks didn't speak to me at all.  We took pictures throught eh chain link fence which are essentially the same as those seen here.  If you have nothing else to do and you want to explore Cuernavaca, this could be a spot on your ramble.  

    We took a taxi back to our hotel for just a bit less than they wanted for a ticket to this mediocre site.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

345050946.name: Get your archaeology fix here
345050946.author: a TripAdvisor user
345050946.reviewBody: Perfect small site, easy access in the middle of Cuernavaca. Definitely check it out if you are in town, but i wouldn\'t bother to make a special trip to Cuernavaca for it. I spent 30 minutes wandering the shady grounds and climbing to the top. I was the only person there during my visit. Keep children or unbalanced people well in hand, there are steep drops. Easy to climb up, down is more challenging, safer in a seated position. Only 50pesos ($3 USD). No gift shop. Enter from Rio Balsas (not the south like google maps told me). 1 block away from a Starbucks.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

341017740.name: Funny
341017740.author: a TripAdvisor user
341017740.reviewBody: Funny how nobody knew about this place until a few decades ago I\'m glad we can visit but there isn\'t much to learn about this place

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

331320863.name: Nice quiet outing, but hardly spectacular
331320863.author: a TripAdvisor user
331320863.reviewBody: This small ruin left in Cuernavaca is worth the trip if you have extra time and want a pleasant, low-key outing. It\'s also close to museums. I was not charged admission apparently as a \'senior\' (nice!)  You can traverse it easily in 10 minutes - it was \'unifhished\' because guess who showed up before the pyramids could be completed - the Spanish!  It is a quiet place - I was the only person, which was nice, and you can see some squirrels and other wildlife scurrying around, which I enjoyed.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

289004047.name: Fun (easy access) ruins near Vista Hermosa
289004047.author: a TripAdvisor user
289004047.reviewBody: I like that these ruins are in the center or near north of town and are compact and beautiful. Parklike green grass and small enough you can bring small children and let them explore on there own.  Interesting history from about 500 years ago.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

286970248.name: The only pyramid you will find in the middle of a modern residential place
286970248.author: a TripAdvisor user
286970248.reviewBody: this is a small but complete pyramid just in the middle of a residential area. It has one of the very few examples of a circular precolombian buildings, the place is well kept but small. Worthy of a short visit. There is a nice modern tiny museum in front don\'t miss it .\nDislike. To discover that all the houses in the area were built with rocks from this place, shame on Cuernavaca! For not preserving this place that contains our heritage and history.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

273420693.name: Nice little place!
273420693.author: a TripAdvisor user
273420693.reviewBody: A small archaeological site right in the middle of Cuernavaca.  Nice place to visit! Small fee to get in, probably a bit expensive for what is there, but it was very quiet the day I was there so you can really see everything.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

268069556.name: Very interesting site
268069556.author: a TripAdvisor user
268069556.reviewBody: When I visited the site was empty.  I was the only one there.  Very interesting seeing a pyramid built "around" an existing pyramid.  Worth the trip

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

263348687.name: Not much to see
263348687.author: a TripAdvisor user
263348687.reviewBody: It\'s only one small pyramid, you can finish your visit to this site in 10-15 minutes. It\'s in the middle of the city of Cuernavaca, if you don\'t have time to visit any other archeological site in Mexico, you should go. If you are going to others skip it.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

260052730.name: An important landmark of Cuernavaca
260052730.author: a TripAdvisor user
260052730.reviewBody: To know the prehispanic history of Cuernavaca, is necessary to visit the pyramids of Teopanzolco, the capital city of the Tlahiuca culture in the valley of Cuauhnahuac (the name of Cuernavaca in that time). Visiting this place you will know Aztec influenced pyramids. To complete the knowledge of Tllahuicas visit the Cortes Palace not far from Teopanzolco. \nIt is open 9 to 5, Tuesday to Sunday.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

258779881.name: Nice and quiet archeological site in the city
258779881.author: a TripAdvisor user
258779881.reviewBody: We walked here from centro, it\'s an easy flat walk that took around 30 minutes, very achievable. The site is small and was quiet the day we visited (Monday) we were the only people there most of the time. If you have already seen Xochicalco or Teotihuacan you probably won\'t think much of this small set of ruins so try visit first if possible. There are signboards around to tell you what each area was, both in Spanish and English. The large pyramid is really interesting with the excavation showing the process of expansion. Nice for a wander but if you only have time to visit one archeological site in Cuernavaca we would recommend Xochicalco.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

256060516.name: pleasant little site
256060516.author: a TripAdvisor user
256060516.reviewBody: Only takes about half an hour to see, very compact, but offers a great view in to how the ancient tribes of the new world constructed their pyramids in stages

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

247583223.name: Nice pyramid in urban zone
247583223.author: a TripAdvisor user
247583223.reviewBody: This pyramid is smack dab in Cuernavaca surrounded by the urban sprawl. The zone itself is fairly small but well maintained. An enjoyable place if you are a pyramid buff like myself, but don\'t expect Xochicalco or Teotihuacan.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

241985722.name: Love it here!
241985722.author: a TripAdvisor user
241985722.reviewBody: It has its trick to come here because the schedule is tricky and staff is dull but the place is great and the vibration of the pyramids are present.\n\nI love it here!

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

236736089.name: Pyramid Right in Town
236736089.author: a TripAdvisor user
236736089.reviewBody: The Teopanzolco pyramid has been surrounded by Cuernavaca. Close to Starbucks, Chili\'s and lots of other restaurants near Rio Mayo street. It was \'discovered\' during the Mexican Revolution of 1910 during one of the artillery maneuvers. It is lovely during the rainy season (summer) when the grounds are a lush green. There is a small entrance fee to pay and there is always an anthropologist there who will give a guided tour. There are also signs on the different structures that explain the history of the site. It is of Tlahuica origin.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

212883844.name: Surprising location
212883844.author: a TripAdvisor user
212883844.reviewBody: These ruins are in the middle of a lovely neighborhood not far from downtown. Not an awe-inspiring ruin but well preserved and well run. The story surrounding it involves the old stonework being revealed during firing from cannons on this hilltop during the Revolution. The shaking loosened dirt, and there they were! From here one can easily walk to the shops on Rio Mayo.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

196406416.name: Nice break from city
196406416.author: a TripAdvisor user
196406416.reviewBody: As per others reviews this isn\'t going to be the largest or grandest pyramid/temples you find in Mexico but the are well worth exploring. The site is well maintained and signs are in Spanish, the local dialect and English.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

176601643.name: Get ready to climb!
176601643.author: a TripAdvisor user
176601643.reviewBody: Never thought I would make it to the top but was so thankful when i did! Well worth it, beautiful, peaceful view!  Make sure you are wearing good shoes, and have plenty of water.  And when you see the vendors running up and down the path with 50 pounds of stuff strapped their backs not even breathing hard you realize just how out of shape you are ;) YOLO! Do it!

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

165338954.name: Worth the hike
165338954.author: a TripAdvisor user
165338954.reviewBody: The ruins themselves are small but the view is incredible.  The hike up is up and up and more up for about an hour.  It is shady all of the way.  Be sure to take money with you as there is a charge (42 pesos) to enter the ruins once you get to the top.

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

154713573.name: Get ready for the climb of your life !
154713573.author: a TripAdvisor user
154713573.reviewBody: Arduous, breathtaking, a remarkable journey, all these words and more describe your hike up the mountain to the Tepo. ruin. Remember, it is the journey ! The ruin, seriously, isn\'t much to see but the great exercise and the great view along the way and at the top, make it all worth the trip ! Bring water and a great camera and know it is quite a climb and not for the faint of heart or knees !  You will have bragging rights after this one ! Wow ! Skippyfrizz

address.streetAddress: Rio Balsas s/n, Teopanzolco Vista Hermosa Colonia Vista Hermosa

669674147.name: Pleasant gardens near to cathedral
669674147.author: a TripAdvisor user
669674147.reviewBody: The Jardin Borda was laid out by the emperor Maximilian I and his wife, when Cuernavaca was used as a retreat \u2013 it is known as the \u201ccity of eternal spring\u201d.  This small but peaceful park didn\'t really justify the entrance charge, and was no more or no less than many small public parks.  It\'s a place of relative quietness and cool on hot days, but the fountains were all switched off, and it felt rather poorly maintained.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

655902990.name: Ok - seen better days
655902990.author: a TripAdvisor user
655902990.reviewBody:
More like a mini park than gardens. Very little colour and not particularly well maintained. There are lots of fountains but none of them operate even at the weekend. Feels as if it has definitely seen better days.

The several art exhibitions were a bit more interesting, although nothing stood out. There are also a few exhibits and some information from the time it was the emperor's palace but only in Spanish.

As entrance is only 30 pesos it is worth a short visit if passing but you won't miss out if you skip it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

649030649.name: An Interesting Garden Steeped in History
649030649.author: a TripAdvisor user
649030649.reviewBody: But . . . we could not find a guide so did not get as much out of our visit as we might have.  Borda was a wealthy silver miner who came out to Mexico from Spain in the 1500s I believe. Amongst other things he built the cathedral in Taxco and these gardens.  I believe the site of the gardens and house were also lived in by the Emperor for a couple of years.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

643873967.name: Worth a short visit
643873967.author: a TripAdvisor user
643873967.reviewBody: It\'s worth 30 minutes to walk around the historic gardens and see some of the art on display. Not one individual aspect stood out as much as the seeing the grounds and the architecture together were interesting. Little to no signage explaining the significance of the place.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

639792607.name: Grand Gardens
639792607.author: a TripAdvisor user
639792607.reviewBody: These gardens are quite beautiful and expansive.  There is history here as well.  It is a pleasant visit but a guide may not be necessary.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

634469639.name: Beautiful Gardens
634469639.author: a TripAdvisor user
634469639.reviewBody: After visiting Taxco, it was lovely to see where Borda spent his last years in this beautiful garden.  Emperor Maximilian and Carlota also used this as a summer retreat.  The building had an exhibit of contemporary art we enjoyed breezing through.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

633786059.name: A garden fit for an Emperor
633786059.author: a TripAdvisor user
633786059.reviewBody: The ghosts of an amazing past were felt throughout our walk through the gardens and fountains.  The current condition was a bit tired, but still a lovely respite from the hustle and bustle of the city around it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

632513020.name: Beautiful grounds, recommend touring on your own
632513020.author: a TripAdvisor user
632513020.reviewBody: We stopped by here at the recommendation of our hotel.  It was walking distance from the main plaza.  The grounds are beautiful and history of the place interesting. We also really enjoyed both art exhibits--we normally do not appreciate modern art but the current exhibit is really interesting.  We took a tour guide up on his offer for a tour in English but he was boring and dragged the tour on for longer than we would have liked.  We would have enjoyed the site much more had we been able to explore on our own using the paper guide provided by the site.  Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

613868924.name: In Disrepair
613868924.author: a TripAdvisor user
613868924.reviewBody: I rarely write a negative review, but this jard\u00edn is not worth the 30 peso entrance fee. It is overgrown and in much need of repair. The fountains do not work,\n and honestly there is nothing attractive about this park at all. It is not a garden. The city should just open this park to the public as a much-needed shady area. \n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

586275526.name: casa borda
586275526.author: a TripAdvisor user
586275526.reviewBody: Interesting place. Most of it in renovation so there is a feeling of it being half done. However there is lots of local cultural activity.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

580005858.name: Wasn\u2019t as great as advertised
580005858.author: a TripAdvisor user
580005858.reviewBody: It was 30 peso to enter. I was kinda disappointed but having said that I still enjoy it anyway. The water fountain wasn\u2019t turn on. The pond was dirty. It needs a lot of renovations to make it looks nicer. The good thing is it was well maintained and the garden overall was clean. It has plenty of plants and trees to see. I think it\u2019ll be a nice place to go as a couple and a family or with friends. It\u2019s nice but could use some repainting and fixing.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

554105192.name: Nice place
554105192.author: a TripAdvisor user
554105192.reviewBody: Lovely languid park in some disrepair...some nice art exhibits in the side mansion which was the summer home of Carlotta

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

551350019.name: Nice location and exhibits.
551350019.author: a TripAdvisor user
551350019.reviewBody: I looked forward to visiting the gardens and enjoyed the special exhibits on view, however, the gardens have not been well maintained. It has obviously seen better times.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

549592488.name: Beautiful enjoyable!
549592488.author: a TripAdvisor user
549592488.reviewBody: Jardin Borda was the summer residence of emperor Maximiliano of Hapsburg and his wife Carlota. Now is a beautifully maintain cultural center with fantastic art exhibitions of very talented local artist, beautiful gardens and a bookshop. I always enjoy visiting this space it is a must in Cuernavaca

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

542642756.name: Exhibits outshined the gardens
542642756.author: a TripAdvisor user
542642756.reviewBody:
The house and the exhibit halls were great. There were 2-3 exhibits on when I was there and they were both good and worth the time. 

The gardens and fountains are run down. The lake looks run down too but the Day of Dead arrangement on the stage showed its potential. 

I wouldn’t plan to spend much time in the gardens but the exhibits are worth it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

515032537.name: Pretty sad
515032537.author: a TripAdvisor user
515032537.reviewBody: For all the promotion  of the place as grand (and clearly it once was) it\'s just a tired run down old garden with little to recommend it. It\'s too bad that there is no money to make it gray again but there is nothing now for my money to recommend a visit\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

505059164.name: A quiet oasis middle in the city of Cuernavaca!
505059164.author: a TripAdvisor user
505059164.reviewBody: Jard\u00edn Borda is a beautiful place to step out of the crowdy streets in downtowns Cuernavaca. Go there and have a walk through the gardens or visit some of the cultural activities

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

486565492.name: Disappointing Gardens
486565492.author: a TripAdvisor user
486565492.reviewBody: We read about the gardens and expected a small oasis, instead it was a garden with potential. The exhibits were mostly of contemporary art that were ok. Until a renovation is completed, my recommendation is to skip Garden Borda.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

476258461.name: Beautiful place for saint week
476258461.author: a TripAdvisor user
476258461.reviewBody: I visited three days  in a row with my family the park . We found a marked during the weekend, it was big and we found Mexican crafts at very good price (compared with the markets in Mexico City), food, and after 5:00 pm local music,  theater, and different shows during the saint week. I really liked to spend my time in there, bathrooms are clean and it was a very good experience.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

471986050.name: A Nice Break for the City
471986050.author: a TripAdvisor user
471986050.reviewBody: This was a good place to spend about an hour. It was quiet and nice for a good stroll. There wasn\'t much for flowers / vegetation possibly because we visited in the wrong season. None of the fountains were on which took away from the peacefulness.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

467681695.name: Borda gardens, downtown Cuernavaca
467681695.author: a TripAdvisor user
467681695.reviewBody: In my opinion this site should be much prettier than it is.  While it is worth a visit, you can see it all in half an hour.  There are current plans to upgrade this site, which is certainly a good idea.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

461537473.name: Nice afternoon under trees
461537473.author: a TripAdvisor user
461537473.reviewBody: It was nice to be under shade during the hot time of day.  The pools  need attention, as well as some of the gardens.  Nice look at old architecture.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

454963457.name: Elegant Gardens
454963457.author: a TripAdvisor user
454963457.reviewBody: These are beautiful gardens that always have a couple of interesting art exhibits going on. Often there are excellent concerts by the water.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

452897827.name: Needs a lot of work
452897827.author: a TripAdvisor user
452897827.reviewBody: A historic place, but it has been neglected for a long time. The gardens and lake should be beautiful places, but it doesnt look beatiful any more, just old and dirty..and nothing tells you about his history at all.\nThe Salas Portugal photo exhibit and the book store are the only things that really means something

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

436701933.name: Stumbled upon an amazing Photo Exhibit byArmando Salas Portugal
436701933.author: a TripAdvisor user
436701933.reviewBody: Very nice gardens, but what was a surprise is that we stumbled upon the opening of a photo exhibit of Armando Salas Portugal. His photos were taken in the late 1940s and were black and whites of the Mexican Indian ruins and contemporary idiginous Mexicans in the 1940s.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

435141866.name: Historical gardens in downtown Cuernavaca
435141866.author: a TripAdvisor user
435141866.reviewBody: The Jardin Borda has a fascinating history. It would be nicer if the garden areas and lake were kept up better. Still, if you are looking for a break from the noise and traffic of downtown Cuernavaca, this is a peaceful natural area. In addition, there are interesting exhibits on special occasions. Their Day of the Dead exhibits in particular are well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

430760245.name: A beautiful oasis where one\'s mind may wander back...
430760245.author: a TripAdvisor user
430760245.reviewBody: Now lovely restored gardens, the grounds lead one to imagine the days when mule teams, laden with wagons of silver, securely sat behind the walls of this compound, a wonderful break from the crowed sidewalks, nofrom tise, and traffic-laden streets just steps away.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

430380839.name: Borda Gardens
430380839.author: a TripAdvisor user
430380839.reviewBody:
This old estate has extensive gardens with fountains and a pond they call a lake. A gallery features local artists from time to time. 

At the moment the gardens are being spruced up. 

Entrance is 30$ and 15$ for seniors (tercera edad).

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

397080040.name: Interesting but not wonderful
397080040.author: a TripAdvisor user
397080040.reviewBody: You know how everyone said "Brokeback Mountain" was the best movie ever, and then when you saw it you expected it to knock your socks off, and it was good but not great? That\'s what the Jardin Borda was. If no one had told me anything about it, I\'d have loved it, but since so many raved about it, I expected more. The history included was the most helpful thing-showing a timeline of an artist\'s career and the concomitant events in Mexican history. Pretty, but not incredible.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

387928560.name: Renovation Happening
387928560.author: a TripAdvisor user
387928560.reviewBody: I visited this place twice once in 2013 and again in 2016. The garden is a nice place to get out of the sun and relax in the middle of the busy city. When I was there last they were renovating the gardens so a large area was closed off and all the plants were gone. Still a nice place to check out tough.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

382808132.name: good display of art works, grounds are being renavated.
382808132.author: a TripAdvisor user
382808132.reviewBody: A nice place to visit and have a quite time in the city.  Gardens are being rebuilt.  Worth the cost of entrance.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

349270472.name: Currently closed, but not Entirely
349270472.author: a TripAdvisor user
349270472.reviewBody:
Upon reading about these gardens and the accompanying mansion, I was really enthusiastic.  I believe it was Lonely Planet that compared it to Versailles.  so imagine my disappointment when the police officer told me the garden would be closed for months for renovation.  

    The good news is that much of the mansion is available for tour, as it serves as an art gallery.  Just walk through the gap in the scaffolding and you are there.  The art is so so, but the spaces were once occupied by Maximillian and Borda.  The garden is indeed closed, but you can use the walkway that serves as the upper border of the garden, hence seeing much of it.  

    The not so good news is that the garden and mansion are not exactly Versailles.  This accounts for a lower tripadvisor rating than one might expect.  It is still wourth a visit and there wasa nocharge as the gardens are theoretically closed.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

341016929.name: Terrible under remodeling
341016929.author: a TripAdvisor user
341016929.reviewBody: It\'s a museum with rich history. Underfunded. Horrible gardens.but they are remodelling hoping for the best I\'ll write a new review then

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

324766610.name: The Gardens are under construction and closed most of the time
324766610.author: a TripAdvisor user
324766610.reviewBody: Fortunately for me... the gardens opened for two days to celebrate Dia De Los Muertos. There were wonderful native crafts and food.... as well as folk dancing. \n\nBe aware that the gardens are under construction and closed most of the time. You can get a sense of the beauty that was and will be. Right now they are unavailable to be seen The government is doing the restoration. I believe it will be a while.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

312080932.name: Majestic
312080932.author: a TripAdvisor user
312080932.reviewBody: Just like I remember it when I grew up playing in and around the Jardin Borda. My grandparents spent their wedding day in these gardens, just to sit where they sat and kissed was amazing. The gardens need your help to return them to their original splendor, be sure to visit and donate if you can. We loved the Jardin Borda and look forward to our next visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

300496788.name: He knew how to live
300496788.author: a TripAdvisor user
300496788.reviewBody: History, beautiful gardens going back in time to visit the wealthy of the wealthy\nof his time period. Many other attraction near by within walking distance.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

292993467.name: It\'s a place to visit
292993467.author: a TripAdvisor user
292993467.reviewBody: Base of the state\'s department of culture, You can expect expositions, performances, etc. The garden area is nice to walk around in the afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

273383216.name: Lovely gardens
273383216.author: a TripAdvisor user
273383216.reviewBody: These gardens were lovely and well kept.  Spent a bit of time wandering around with a group I was chaperoning. Visited in 2013, it was so nice.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

272856362.name: ***CLOSED***
272856362.author: a TripAdvisor user
272856362.reviewBody: The gardens are closed! No problem. It gave us more time to explore and we found a cool market behind the walls across from the park. There sure are a lot of Telcel stores in Cuernavaca!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

271755591.name: Cuernavaca Gem of a Park
271755591.author: a TripAdvisor user
271755591.reviewBody: Wonderful park. During the Day of the Dead celebrations in early November, one can see a lot of flower decked altars. Many vendors sell snacks and drinks near the large fountain.It was very crowded when we visited because of these celebrations.Perhaps it is more peaceful, during non holiday days.\nDefinitely worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

270458354.name: Visit with my Mexican family
270458354.author: a TripAdvisor user
270458354.reviewBody: Great place! Worth visiting and learning learing some history. There were lots of vendors who sold local fare. I bought some mole paste. Lovely environment.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

268116748.name: Pleasant cool spot for relaxing
268116748.author: a TripAdvisor user
268116748.reviewBody: These gardens are right downtown across from the Cathedral, so when it gets too hot and noisy in the streets, it makes a quiet, peaceful and cool retreat for an hour or so to stroll around the gardens and sit on a bench under some shade trees. The garden consists mostly of trees and walkways with some fountains, and a small artificial lake, where occasionally you\'ll see locals riding around in small boats. On Sundays, it\'s free for Mexicans to come here, so it\'s a place to see families and young couples enjoying a day in the park. Other days, it tends to be fairly empty. Don\'t expect to see fabulous displays of flowers or manicured lawns. It\'s got a more natural feel to it. It\'s not pretentious in any way. But it has a romantic past - the emperor Maximilian used to visit here - and it has a 19th century feel to it, like stepping back in time. A nice place to walk around and experience some peace and quiet. Check out the art exhibits. They aren\'t always well publicized but can be very interesting, and they\'re included in the cost of admission to the gardens. Nice small bookshop on the premises (books mostly in Spanish).

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

267925828.name: Not worth the time
267925828.author: a TripAdvisor user
267925828.reviewBody: We went. The end of April and there were only a few flowering shrubs. No planted flowers. The rose garden had no rose plants in it. Only the front fountain was working. The streets in Cuernavaca had more flowers than this garden!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

265365658.name: Lovely gardens - take the time to explore.
265365658.author: a TripAdvisor user
265365658.reviewBody: The Borda Gardens are a lovely place to walk around and enjoy the natural beauty of Cuernavaca.  Lots of pools and fountains and many different flowers, plants and trees.  It\'s a lovely calm Oasis in the city.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

264650987.name: Nice place to visit
264650987.author: a TripAdvisor user
264650987.reviewBody: Enjoyed the Borda Gardens and the chance to row off some calories from our trip.  You can rent a row boat and use it on a pond that contains some colorful ducks and many turtles.  I think I would have enjoyed this much more if there were more flowers.  Since my visit was in April, there should have been lots more to see.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

256060100.name: Best site in Cuernavaca proper
256060100.author: a TripAdvisor user
256060100.reviewBody: Very much enjoyed the gardens and fountains. Takes about an hour to see, a great place for a stroll.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

255442898.name: Great cultural center
255442898.author: a TripAdvisor user
255442898.reviewBody: This beautiful site that formerly belonged to Emperor Maxmillian and Empress Carlota is very near the Zocalo.  Tall white walls surround it to protect the lush gardens within and historic display rooms.  Concerts and exhibits are regularly available for the price of a ticket.  This is a grand spot to explore and learn about real Mexican culture and the arts.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

254155121.name: Not one of Cuernavaca\'s finest cultural attractions
254155121.author: a TripAdvisor user
254155121.reviewBody: Jardin Borda always makes the list of cultural attractions in Cuernavaca, but our experience was disappointing at best.  Fortunately the entry fee was only $30 MX - about $2 U.S. at today\'s exchange rate.  The gardens and buildings were not well kept.  During our stroll around we surprised a couple who were not making much of an attempt to hide their "afternoon delight."  For a city known as the "city of the eternal spring" the groundskeepers don\'t seem to know how to include and care for plants and flowers that bloom - as do other places in the area.  We were planing to bring special guests there in a month.  We are now making other plans.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

247213465.name: Large botanical gardens
247213465.author: a TripAdvisor user
247213465.reviewBody: The Borda Gardens is a large botanical garden near the zocalo in Cuernavaca. It\'s a little shabby chic but that\'s part of the charm really. In addition to the many and varied gardens, they have cultural events. For example, the used book fair was taking place while we visited. A very nice oasis to visit while in the area.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

246379698.name: Nothing special at all
246379698.author: a TripAdvisor user
246379698.reviewBody: Unkept and looks like it could have been nice a long time ago.  Needs a real uplift to make it worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

241985455.name: Whatever cultural thing you will have it here.
241985455.author: a TripAdvisor user
241985455.reviewBody: Jardin Borda is a must in the intellectual scene here in Cuerna: book signing, wine taste, plays, orchestra nights, all arts are welcome here.\n\nMake sure to attend by day, by night, you have to be aware of the time because parking lots close around 10ish.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

238077090.name: Gardens with History
238077090.author: a TripAdvisor user
238077090.reviewBody: There is a lot of history in these gardens in the house built by the silver baron Jose de la Borda. His son Manuel built the gardens in 1778 with plants brought on the Manila Galleons from Asia and others from Europe. Throughout the years it was an inn, a stage coach stop, government offices, a weekend residence for Maximillian and Carlotta in the mid 1800\'s and now a wonderful cultural center.\nThere are art exhibits, conferences, recitals, concerts, programs for children on Sundays, workshops, and special observances, such as the Day of the Dead (Miquixtli) which just finished on November 2. There is an outdoor auditorium by the little lake, on which you can take a little boat ride or feed the ducks.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

233549122.name: Exquisite Gardens
233549122.author: a TripAdvisor user
233549122.reviewBody: Walking through the gardens was peaceful and we spent time admiring the plants and trees. Going with family made it special since we had time to converse as we enjoyed our slow walk through the beautiful gardens.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

227932891.name: Domingo al jard\u00edn
227932891.author: a TripAdvisor user
227932891.reviewBody: Imagine if you will, following a tired week of sightseeing and walking up and down rough terrain of different types, you\'re ready for a little rest and relaxation.  Take the short walk or taxi to Jardin Borda!  Your eyes will feast on the eternal springtime beauty of this heavenly location!  You\'ll forever share this memory with family and friends, and you will forever have a tug at heart to return!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

227005589.name: Enjoyed strolling through the gardens.
227005589.author: a TripAdvisor user
227005589.reviewBody: Went Tuesday morning. Read a few reviews afterwards, and was surprised by people who felt they were deglected. The paths are old, the gardens are old, you walk through history. They aren\'t a modern building. Everything was lush and green, everything was clean. The art exhibits were interesting. And walking through the house and along the paths, you can imagine life in Colonial Mexico 150 years ago.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

226721229.name: Excellent maintenance of gardens
226721229.author: a TripAdvisor user
226721229.reviewBody: Jardin Borda is spectacular! it is well mantained and easy to get to.\nThe lush gardens provide peacefulness and shade. I have never attended to a concert on the lake side but I must imagine it is spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

226145341.name: Relaxing place center of Cuerna
226145341.author: a TripAdvisor user
226145341.reviewBody: Semi-tropical garden with many fountains and a little lake. If somebody want to hide from the crazy crouded city, perfect choice o chill and hang out a little.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

225985582.name: once upon a time
225985582.author: a TripAdvisor user
225985582.reviewBody: the Borda Gardens must have been most beautiful, even emperor Maximilian of Mexico spent many a time there. The gardens are still an oasis in the noisy city, they are still lush in a way, but they are sadly neglected. It seems gardens like this one needs a sponsor willing to keep it up no matter how much it costs. The city of Cuernavaca certainly has more important uses for its money, roads would be a good investment (I think).\nAnyway, I expected more glory but I am still happy that we went - we saw a quite interesting exhibition of a Mexican painter.\nSometimes you need to close your eyes an dream about how it was once upon a time ......

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

221278616.name: not worthed and abandoned
221278616.author: a TripAdvisor user
221278616.reviewBody: we paid the fee for entering but there was nothing interesting to see or nothing impressive so if you dont want to wate time dont go

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

212876763.name: Historic and a little sad
212876763.author: a TripAdvisor user
212876763.reviewBody: These formal gardens were established by the Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota next to their retreat in Cuernavaca. However, they are sadly neglected. Worth a visit because of their proximity to the Cathedral and the Zocalo.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

207741018.name: Blissfull oasis
207741018.author: a TripAdvisor user
207741018.reviewBody: Just steps from the main town square, this garden is an oasis. Not perfectly trimmed, but human scaled and lush. As it happened, I struck up a conversation with one of Cuernevaca\'s poets (74 years old, 12 books to his name), swapped songs and heard the history of the gardens. Be open to what and who is around you!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

206226115.name: Interesting
206226115.author: a TripAdvisor user
206226115.reviewBody: This is a good place for a stroll, there are also some exhibitions; the place could use more maintenance but simply imagining it in its prime takes your breath away, particularly the auditorium with the small canal. There\'s a good variety of trees although flowers were scarce when we went, we still managed some great photos. It\'s also interesting to see it\'s a live venue, used by regular people for group activities (theatre?), particularly given Cuernavaca\'s current situation with respect to violence.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

201273122.name: Needs up keep in gardens
201273122.author: a TripAdvisor user
201273122.reviewBody: The gardens are lacking up keep and not as nice as most gardens in Cuernavaca, it\'s a shame it\'s gone down hill so much.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

200863857.name: Well worth a visit
200863857.author: a TripAdvisor user
200863857.reviewBody: Very large historic gardens with water features and a large pond.  Also an art display in several rooms.  Very worth seeing.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

194201508.name: So much potential, needs lots of work
194201508.author: a TripAdvisor user
194201508.reviewBody: We visited  Jardin Borda  three times while in Cuernavaca.  The park has so much potential, the old growth trees, the fountains, the history and the original architecture all could make this a wonderful spot to visit and relax.  The current renovations and archeological work in progress do add to the interest but the main feature of the site, the garden, remains a shamble.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

193479463.name: Very nice sanctuary for relaxation.
193479463.author: a TripAdvisor user
193479463.reviewBody: Spent the afternoon at Borda Gardens. It is a very quiet place with a lot to see. Unfortunately as several other reviewers pointed out, it is in need of repair. But if you are in Cuernavaca and want to see a pretty place, this is a must see.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

193205340.name: Must have been lovely in its day
193205340.author: a TripAdvisor user
193205340.reviewBody: This is a quiet tranquil place in a busy city.  It was probably gorgeous in its day but while they try to keep it up, the fountains don\'t fount and there are not a lot of flowers.  It is worth visiting for the art galleries which are nice and to just walk around.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

193005249.name: A Cool Oasis in The Summer Heat
193005249.author: a TripAdvisor user
193005249.reviewBody: This garden is a nice sanctuary from the heat and noise of a busy urban area. There are fountains, flowers, wandering pathways and a small man-made pond for row-boating with your sweetheart. The air is noticeably cooler and as you walk deeper into the garden and find a nice quiet bench to relax near a fountain. Bring a good book and plan to spend an hour of calm serene enjoyment.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

189550961.name: Pretty but virtual lack of maintenance
189550961.author: a TripAdvisor user
189550961.reviewBody: Once upon a time, this garden was undoubtedly gorgeous.  Unfortunately, the maintenance is virtually nil and apparently has been for some time.  Not only have the plants been neglected but the hard surfaces are crumbling and cracking.  For those who love historical nostalgia, this will be a hit.   Or if you like getting into things for free (if they charged for admission, maybe they could do at least a little maintenance).  Otherwise...

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

188014914.name: Waste of time
188014914.author: a TripAdvisor user
188014914.reviewBody: OK if you\'re looking to escape from the constant noise of Mexico for a few minutes.  Poorly maintained.  Lots of green trees and plants but didn\'t see any flowers.  Not worth paying for.  Where\'s the garden?

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

186205047.name: One day this will be GLORIOUS again.
186205047.author: a TripAdvisor user
186205047.reviewBody: Currently under renovation, the Borda Gardens, look like at one point in time were GORGEOUS but unfortunately, like so many things in Mexico, their magnificent buildings have been allowed to deteriorate and some to be destroyed.  This place still has hints of its beauty but the small man made lake has "green" looking water filled with algae and although the gardens are impeccably clean, the whole place is screaming to be beautified.  The restrooms are an embarrassment although clean.  Wait a year to go, perhaps by then the renovations that are taking place now will make the place more appealing.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

184631228.name: Day of the dead weekend
184631228.author: a TripAdvisor user
184631228.reviewBody: We were visiting Cuernavaca during the weekend of the day of the dead celebrations and the gardens were decorated with colorful shrines. There were many vendors setting up their wares whichj included a lot of skeleton items and handcrafts. It was fun to wander the gardens and enjoy a beautiful day.We didnt\' spend that much time there and probably saw all we needed to but I\'m glad we checked it out. A couple of large fountains too. It could use a few repairs but it still was interesting.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

183675992.name: Not a must-do, but something different to enjoy
183675992.author: a TripAdvisor user
183675992.reviewBody: We made the most of our visit to the gardens on a beautiful day in early July 2013, strolling all over the grounds and renting a row boat for 15 minutes (which is probably plenty of time to navigate the small waterway and long enough to bear the loud clanging of the metal oars).   The condition of the gardens is not of the highest standards - perhaps it looks more lush, and has plants that are actually flowering, especially the rose garden, in a different season? - but it\'s a decent pit stop for a quiet walk and distraction from typical sightseeing.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

182822229.name: Nice historic garden
182822229.author: a TripAdvisor user
182822229.reviewBody:
The Borda Garden is a historical museum located in the city of Cuernavaca and is located in what was once the summer mansion of the wealthy miner José de la Borda Taxco. During the Second Mexican Empire, Emperor of Mexico, Maximilian of Habsburg-Austria and his wife Carlota Amalia chose this place as his summer residence and because of this, it improved the way from Mexico City to Cuernavaca(Ferdinand Maximilian von Habsburg (1832-67)
and his wife Carlotta of Belgium)
Every sunday the entrance is free,having around the gardens and fountains a big flea market even with so tasty Mexican food...Often they have life shows and concerts.
At the artificial pond you can hire a rowing little boat 30-50 pesos so you can hang around with ducks.
Jardin Borda also offers very Special Performances like "The Swan lake" ballet composed by Tchaikovsky. on his open theater-stage in front of the lake.
you can catch a taxi on Av Morelos or park your car in front of Antiguo Cine Morelos.
Love my hometown  :)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

176248683.name: Peaceful walk to relax in Cuernavaca
176248683.author: a TripAdvisor user
176248683.reviewBody: Totally safe to walk, relax and let you think about your deepest thoughts while admiring the downtown gardens, that finish in a pond with an open forum where commonly there are concerts, ballet performances or plays.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

162307943.name: Good to visit if you have time, sunday\'s free entrance
162307943.author: a TripAdvisor user
162307943.reviewBody:
I was expecting more color in here, but the visit is ok when you have the time. there is a small lagoon where you can rent a rowing boat for 10 pesos 15 mins or 15 pesos 30 mins very cheap.

there are some ducks around and several fountains not that awesome. the trees are beautiful some are hundreds of years old it seems. there is a roses garden area but i didn't see any.

well in may probably there are no flowers in this garden or more colors than green, so in my experience it is a good walk.
the garden is a 30 mins walk and keep moving.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

160016025.name: Haciendas have better grounds....
160016025.author: a TripAdvisor user
160016025.reviewBody: The Borda Gardens were fairly disappointing.  Skip them and have lunch at Las Mananitas, Hacienda de Cortez, or Hosteria Las Quintas - all have better gardens than Borda!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

155995796.name: Very nice garden and cultural center
155995796.author: a TripAdvisor user
155995796.reviewBody: The garden is very big and exuberant. It has many fountains and a little lake where you can rent small rowing boats. There\'s also rooms for art expositions and a very nice concert hall.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

153157512.name: Pretty gardens, nothing spectacular
153157512.author: a TripAdvisor user
153157512.reviewBody: Nice botanical gardens, fun to walk around for a little while. There is a man made lake where it is possible to rent boats. It seems to be a popular place for teenage couples to be alone.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

152675604.name: Nice escape
152675604.author: a TripAdvisor user
152675604.reviewBody: Nice to wander through gardens and escape the intensity of the city, go with a bit of time and read a book on a bench or hire a boat and take a row on  the pond with a giant alebrije.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

148762587.name: A sucky garden
148762587.author: a TripAdvisor user
148762587.reviewBody: I felt like i was in a garden that hasn\'t been taking care since the revolution, its a shame the way the state doesn\'t care for a garden that could be awesome.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

144397319.name: Los Dias de Los Muertos event at the garden
144397319.author: a TripAdvisor user
144397319.reviewBody: The Catrinas on display were colorful and creative, a reflection of Freida Kahlo, the skeletons symbolize her inability to have children and how dead she felt inside because of it. The shopping was incredible, artists from Pueblas of Mexico, amazing and delicious.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

142986400.name: A welcome resting place in the city
142986400.author: a TripAdvisor user
142986400.reviewBody: We enjoyed the shade and tranquility. And there was an art exhibit on view. Some of the plants have identifying signs, which is useful. But if you are on a short schedule, you can miss the Borda Gardens without losing any sleep.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

138840240.name: Faded elegance
138840240.author: a TripAdvisor user
138840240.reviewBody: Jardin Borda is not particularly well-kept, but it\'s a charming garden criss-crossed with tree-arched walkways, worth a visit. The art galleries feature some of Cuernavaca\'s finest exhibitions.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

136847428.name: Nice
136847428.author: a TripAdvisor user
136847428.reviewBody: It was nice, but the walls needed a bit of paint and a bit of an \'updo\'. It is how it is supposed to look, I know, it just wasn\'t my cup of tea but would be to other people I think.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

133385358.name: Pretty but not a must (unless you love gardens & art)
133385358.author: a TripAdvisor user
133385358.reviewBody: If you love art and gardens then you should go! but if it\'s not your favorite thing it\'s not a must in Cuernava although it\'s pretty

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

133316154.name: Nice, relaxing.
133316154.author: a TripAdvisor user
133316154.reviewBody: Nice, relaxing gardens but not a big deal. However if you go, take a book or a snack, there are very pretty corners to sit in peace and read or even tables and chairs to make a small picnic.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

133130659.name: Slightly dishevelled and cracking up at the seams
133130659.author: a TripAdvisor user
133130659.reviewBody: Slightly dishevelled and cracking up at the seams, A lot more work needs to be done, although it is quaint and a feels like a forgotten garden

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

129127293.name: must see of Cuernavaca
129127293.author: a TripAdvisor user
129127293.reviewBody: pros: historical place where the second empereur of mexico and his wife Charlotte used to stay. wonderfull plants flowers, nice fountains when they are clean (;. \nbest on week end with a lot  of handycrafts ans artists. free on sunday\n cons: maintenance. bathrooms could be better.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

127639796.name: Mediocre gardens, maybe better on a Sunday
127639796.author: a TripAdvisor user
127639796.reviewBody: The gardens were not very impressive. Although they were large, they seemed rather run-down. However, we visited on a weekday and the park was nearly empty--I believe it\'s free on Sundays and it may be a more interesting scene when it\'s crowded. There also seemed to be a nice stage in the back for concerts--seems like it would be a good venue for a show.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

126504427.name: Could be really spectacular if . . .
126504427.author: a TripAdvisor user
126504427.reviewBody: The former gardens of Emperor Maximillian and Empress Carlotta and various other owners over the years could be truly lovely but as we viewed it is sadly neglected.   The fountains are not operational, the pavement was uneven, there was little description, the large pool in front of a stage used for musical and other productions at times was full of algae.  The bathrooms were marginal and there was no drink or food service available.  In the centre of town opposite the Cathedral.  This large garden has potential but really needs attention.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

125458985.name: Borda Gardens
125458985.author: a TripAdvisor user
125458985.reviewBody: I think it was out of season for this gardens, as the fountains were not operational but the concept was good. Each path lead to a new fountain and type of garden.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

124175622.name: pretty place for a stroll...
124175622.author: a TripAdvisor user
124175622.reviewBody: This is a lovely park in the middle of the city.  We strolled through it in the evening and returned for a daytime visit.  Very pretty.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

123742282.name: Relaxing
123742282.author: a TripAdvisor user
123742282.reviewBody: We like the garden desing, There was a very good non permanent exhibition. There are hand craft very cheap and well finished. You can rest under shadow\'s trees. It\'s a very good place to be. Sundays is free.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

123457697.name: Cuernavaca\u00b4s famous garden!
123457697.author: a TripAdvisor user
123457697.reviewBody:
The Borda Garden, once Emperor Maximilian´s summer house in Cuernavaca is today a public park, where the gardens and beautiful fountains and artificial lake have been maintained, and the house itself has been converted into a museum.

Read more: http://www.answers.com/topic/jose-de-la-borda#ixzz1kGqzzNGF

Simple and harmonious garden!!! I loved

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

123297743.name: just trees and some fountains
123297743.author: a TripAdvisor user
123297743.reviewBody: I was a bit disappointed with this place.  It is certainly peaceful, a nice respite from the noisy streets outside, but it was just like a park.  I guess I was hoping for some flowers.\nThe museum in the main house is undergoing some renovation, and the most interesting painting (to me) was not available.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

122540982.name: Reminiscent of Madrid\'s Parque de Retiro
122540982.author: a TripAdvisor user
122540982.reviewBody: Reminiscent of Madrid\'s Parque de Retiro these gardens are beautifully maintained, even in winter and boating on the man made lake is available. Don\'t miss the art exhibit either!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

122438534.name: Nothing to see here
122438534.author: a TripAdvisor user
122438534.reviewBody: Wish Cuernavaca would start fixing things up a bit. So sad

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

121804531.name: still nice but now full of vendors
121804531.author: a TripAdvisor user
121804531.reviewBody: I remember coming here every visit to Cuernavaca and enjoying the quiet lake and gardens in addition to art exhibits. Now is a little busier due to events every week end and a few vendors selling food and souvenirs.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

121137665.name: OK as a diversion downtown
121137665.author: a TripAdvisor user
121137665.reviewBody: The Borda Gardens are fairly large and OK as a diversion near downtown, but the actual displays of plans inside are not very detailed or exotic relative to what you will find anywhere else in the countryside.  There are, however, occasional extra exhibits such as paintings.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

121106448.name: good for a sunday stroll
121106448.author: a TripAdvisor user
121106448.reviewBody: toilet was difficult to spot.\nif you want to rent a boat then don\'t forget to buy a ticket at the main entrance.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

120740188.name: La Catrina visits El Jardin
120740188.author: a TripAdvisor user
120740188.reviewBody: Visited during the Dia de Muertos.  The display of over-life sized Catrinas was fabulous.  Artistic and amazing, along with the craft market and Day of the Dead altars.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

119558172.name: flowers in Mexico
119558172.author: a TripAdvisor user
119558172.reviewBody: Flowers in Mexico and the Cuernavaca region of Morelos can be quite different from anywhere else. I think the temperate climate in the \'city of eternal spring\' support the greenery.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

114748978.name: A peaceful spot in the city, but not what it must have once been...
114748978.author: a TripAdvisor user
114748978.reviewBody:
I've stopped here a couple of times while visiting Cuernavaca over the years.  It is a very peaceful spot in the middle of a busy (but not crazy) city.  The most impressive thing for me I think was the sheer size of the facility.  It must have once been quite majestic and beautiful.  The maintenance that would be necessary to truly keep such a place beautiful just isn't happening.  I agree with another review that said the "lake" is just green a scummy.  Very true.  There are some friendly ducks there, great for taking photos and there are MANY places in the gardens to stop and take group pictures with family/friends, if you have someone who can take the picture for you.

The air is moist and cool in the gardens.  A nice refreshing change from the hot, sunny street outside.  If you are looking to escape the heat and aren't staying in an air conditioned house or hotel, then that alone is a great excuse to spend some time at Jardin Borda.

I would budget 2-3 hours to casually enjoy this facility, freely roaming.  Be sure to visit the gift shops for very reasonably priced items.  I recall there being a book sale when I was there.  

It is also important to note that as of the last time I was there, admission to Jardin Borda is free on Sundays.  Please confirm this locally before going if that's an important factor for you.  Nonetheless, free is free.  Enjoy!

P.S. -- the shoe shop just outside, across the street, has some great shoes for low prices.  My wife still wears a pair of leather sandals she purchased there 4 years ago.  Always remember -- in Mexico, prices are negotiable, carry cash (pesos... this isn't Cancun).

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

22531439.name: OK for a break from touring
22531439.author: a TripAdvisor user
22531439.reviewBody: After I read the last two reviews of the Borda Gardens I have to agree with both somewhat. Give it a skip if you are pressed for time. As gardens go this is not all that terrific. It must have  looked much nicer decades ago. But if you are in Cuernavaca for days or in need of a relaxing place to visit for a break this is worthwhile. Use your imagination to think what this area must have looked like in the 19th century when important people of that age were there. There are some museum rooms attached to the gardens too that are included in the price of your ticket and worth a look plus a nice little gift shop. A fair price artisan\'s shop is right next door with things made by indigenous people. The garden is almost right across the street from the entrance to the cathedral and on Morelos which is a major street. All this is perhaps a ten minute walk to the very center of town.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

17264915.name: Skippable
17264915.author: a TripAdvisor user
17264915.reviewBody: An eminently skippable site especially if you don\'t have much time to waste.  The gardens themselves were nothing special: typical local plants laid out in a grid of raised concrete beds, and the "lake" was a small scummy green pond.  The place screamed for more maintenance.  The house though contained two recently refurbished art galleries showing exhibitions of contemporary photographs and paintings.  Nice. A small but good selection of books and arts and crafts in the gift shop.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

951700.name: a quiet haven in a busy city
951700.author: a TripAdvisor user
951700.reviewBody: I visited the Borda Gardens in October 2001 - it was a very quiet spot after walking in and around Cuernavaca. Our group enjoyed the serenity of the gardens and wandered throuhgout & relaxed for about an hour. My favourite part of the visit was chancing upon a wedding party with the bride and her brother heading to the ceremony & they even posed for a photo...TW

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 271

672559734.name: a must see in Cuernavaca if you like history and arts
672559734.author: a TripAdvisor user
672559734.reviewBody: A must see: a unique collection of different type of arts: carving, painting, carpets, drawings, designs and more plus a fantastic adventure throughout the relations between Brady and famous friends of him, famous characters from the 30\'s to the 80\'s. Ask for a tour to understand all the impressives details of the house.  2 hours tours, about $40 pesos entry per person.  Do it alone or with groups less than  8 persons

669719030.name: A feast for the eyes
669719030.author: a TripAdvisor user
669719030.reviewBody: All areas open when I visited today. It was amazing and almost overloaded my senses. Such vibrant colour and a huge eclectic collection of paintings, sculptures, ceramics, textiles and artifacts. Beautiful gardens. Everything meticulously kept. Well worth the visit and the highlight of my stay in Cuernavaca.

661664298.name: Disappointing-Most of House Closed Off
661664298.author: a TripAdvisor user
661664298.reviewBody:
I greatly enjoyed my last visit to Brady Museum two years ago and looked forward to showing my son the beautiful space yesterday. Unfortunately only the first floor, backyard pool area, and loggia were accessible. The entire upstairs was closed off by padlocked door. 

I was so disappointed. We ended up spending mere minutes there. For the 50 pesos per person entry, I found this a RIP OFF. There was also no explanation as to why most of the museum was closed. The woman at reception was cold and rude when we purchased our tickets and she was occupied with other people when we exited, so I did not stop to ask her. 

If you decide to go, it may still be worthwhile even with more than half the exhibit closed, but make sure to inquire whether all rooms are accessible because on 3/26/2019 they were not.

656087769.name: You should visit it if u are in Cuerna!
656087769.author: a TripAdvisor user
656087769.reviewBody: Definetely one of my favorite museums in Cuernavaca, full of color and with a great collection of pieces from all the world. The house is very special and full of history.

655903872.name: Worth a visit for the hacienda itself
655903872.author: a TripAdvisor user
655903872.reviewBody:
Enjoyable visit, more for the hacienda, which is fully furnished, than for Brady's electic collection of objet d'art and paintings from around the globe, much of which were not to my taste. The collection does include  howevèr, the famous painting of Frieda Kahlo with a monkey and also some sketches by Diego Rivera. There is also some interesting art relating to Josephine Baker.

The lack of information about Robert Brady and the history of the house was disappointing.

Only 50 pesos entrance fee so well worth a visit for the architecture alone.

654113412.name: An unexpected gem !
654113412.author: a TripAdvisor user
654113412.reviewBody: Robert Brady\'s house is an absolute MUST if you are in Cuernavaca . It was an unexpected delight and a fantastic eclectic collection of his treasures beautifully and colourfully displayed. Each room is a delight and a surprise  and there are  excellent notes in English in every room explaining the paintings and collection.

654013651.name: Nice Structure Average Collection
654013651.author: a TripAdvisor user
654013651.reviewBody: The reason I see for attending this museum. Is to see the structure and landscape. The collection of art is ok.\n\nDon\u2019t miss the pond out back to the right.

649030363.name: A Unique and Wonderful Glimpse Into Another Life
649030363.author: a TripAdvisor user
649030363.reviewBody: The Robert Brady Museum is not to be missed.  Robert Brady was an American artist who lived in Cuernavaca and travelled the world collecting furniture and objects d\'art.  When he died he left the house as a museum.  When you walk in you feel like he is still there, down to the black and white photos of himself and others on the front hall table.  He was a very interesting man with eclectic taste.  The gardens are magnificent, the kitchen amazing (there is a portrait of his cook which he painted hanging in the kitchen) and the bedrooms and bathrooms spectacular.  It was impossible for me to take it all in in one visit.  I will be back.

647666740.name: Pesadilla Argentina
647666740.author: a TripAdvisor user
647666740.reviewBody: Great place, you should not miss it, if you happen to be in Cuernavaca. Brady was a rich american, that loved Cuernavaca. He also was a traveller around the world. This enabled him to collect things from Cuernavaca and other parts of the world where he traveled. See fotos. Is a must!!

644106138.name: Don\u2019t miss
644106138.author: a TripAdvisor user
644106138.reviewBody: This is a really interesting museum, as you get a real insight into how Robert Brady lived. When you pass it in the street you can have no idea what is behind the walls. His art collection is fascinating and so very varied. The house it self you can walk around in the bathrooms are all tiled and the kitchen. The garden with its pool, gives you a sense of being in a house.

642290799.name: The Gem of Cuernavaca
642290799.author: a TripAdvisor user
642290799.reviewBody: Wonderful place with an interesting history. Of the local sites, this one is well preserved. The audio guide was a great way to enjoy the visit at our own pace.

641342880.name: Art for artists.
641342880.author: a TripAdvisor user
641342880.reviewBody: Amazing home probably has equally important work as most major museums.  The history of Robert Brady and his friendships and parties with the Guggenheim\u2019s, Diego and Frida are too fun to miss.  Wonderful spot.

639793255.name: Artistically Amazing
639793255.author: a TripAdvisor user
639793255.reviewBody: The actual house is magnificent in its design and gardens.  What\'s inside the house is truly fantastic.  The collections fill room after room, some themed, and each one seems better than the next.  Be sure to see this gem.

636575047.name: What a treat
636575047.author: a TripAdvisor user
636575047.reviewBody: We had an excellent English speaking guide Sergio who was a wealth of knowledge. The collection is vast and very personal. I felt like I knew Brady by the end of our visit. My main fear is for the art - with the exposure to the elements and to the handling by visitors. \n\n

634708590.name: Fantastic collection of eclectic art
634708590.author: a TripAdvisor user
634708590.reviewBody: A great place to spend an hour in Cuernavaca. Mr Brady left his home to the City of Cuernavaca with all of his furnishings and art. A+++

634469164.name: Great collection
634469164.author: a TripAdvisor user
634469164.reviewBody: Brady has a great collection of folk art from around the world, plus some excellent paintings.  It is fun to see how it is all arranged.  This playboy/artist left a nice legacy in this museum.

633785457.name: If you love art, whimsey, passion, unique architecture, DON\u2019T miss.
633785457.author: a TripAdvisor user
633785457.reviewBody: I feel like I know Robert Brady and his friends after spending a morning taking time to view his amazing collections and living spaces.  The echoes of his entertaining, travels, curiosities, and artistic sensabilities ring loud throughout the unique environment he created.

626770524.name: Fascinating museum
626770524.author: a TripAdvisor user
626770524.reviewBody:
I was in Cuernavaca yesterday for the day with the intention of seeing the Cathedral and the Palacio Cortes. Unfortunately both were closed for restoration, the latter because of damage in the recent earthquake.Walking with my host, a resident of the city, we came across the Robert Brady Museum which he had never visited.We were charmed by it.
The furnishings and decor give a real feel for traditional Mexican. Additionally Brady was a collector of Mexican artefacts, as well as objects from Africa and the East. These are spread throughout the house. 
The building itself is compact, set around a courtyard.One can visit all the rooms including kitchen and bedrroms.
We were charmed.Well worth a visit.

617241896.name: An excellent museum
617241896.author: a TripAdvisor user
617241896.reviewBody: Robert Brady travelled all over the world collecting a myriad of very interesting ethnic and art pieces for his private use, which he donated to a foundation when he died to establish this very interesting museum, it is said he threw great parties for his many friends at this beautiful colonial mansion.

594677250.name: Highly recommended visit to a beautiful home & art collection in downtown Cuernavaca!
594677250.author: a TripAdvisor user
594677250.reviewBody: Robert Brady\'s mansion/museum is not to be missed in a visit to Cuernavaca.  Located in the downtown area, just behind the 16th century cathedral, on perhaps the most colorful street in town.  Reminiscent of a gone-by era of celebrity guests, Brady lived here for twenty some years and formed a large art collection of primarily Mexican paintings and fine crafts, that also includes items brought back from distant trips to Africa and India. The house is a pleasure to visit, done in excellent taste, with open spaces that give out to the pool area and garden.  The visit in an hour\'s time allows one to take in the architecture & d\u00e9cor, as well as the art collection, and is worth every penny of the approximately $2.50 U.S. Cy. to get in, that goes to the maintenance of the property and art collection.  You\'re allowed to take all the photos you want without flash.

594554825.name: Magnificent architecture, very nice venue for all the artistic work displayed. You can find very nice sculptures.
594554825.author: a TripAdvisor user
594554825.reviewBody: Worth visiting both for the place and for the art in exhibition. The place is one of the most beautiful houses. The collection is a reference, a must for art history students.

590002786.name: Beautiful space downtown Cuernavaca
590002786.author: a TripAdvisor user
590002786.reviewBody: I found this beautiful house almost by accident and it was quite a lovely surprise. Of course the impressive art collection is in itself worthy of attention, but the space as a place passionately decorated by the collector creates a connection with the past of this magnificent house. The pool terrace is a dream.

578691026.name: Nice Art Gallery
578691026.author: a TripAdvisor user
578691026.reviewBody: It was 50 pesos to get into Robert Brady Museum. You can take as many pictures as you want but you can\u2019t use your flash. There\u2019s so much art collection to see. Every room was fill with many different kind of art. The house was pretty big and pretty cool. It\u2019s pretty cool to see how a nice house looks like and how it is setup back in the day. The arts and the house is well kept and very nice and clean. I spent about 40 minutes here but usually 1 hour could easily be spent here. I think it\u2019s worth coming here and preferably not kid friendly place.

573282283.name: Wonderful and eclectic art collection
573282283.author: a TripAdvisor user
573282283.reviewBody:
This is our second visit to the Robert Brady museum in Cuernavaca- last visit was five years ago and definitely worth a return visit.

Brady collected art from Europe and Latin America with a really varied collection of sculpture, artefacts and paintings. The art is well displayed with his house and you can get really close to some wonderful exhibits, Including Diego Riviera, Frida Kahlo, pre Hispanic artefacts, a gruesome collection of Christ sculptures and much more.

All laid out in his house which is very traditional Mexican style. It doesn’t take too long to view and at 50 pesos entry it is very good value. Good for a  rainy day - rare in Cuernavaca!

565891961.name: What a collection of ART !
565891961.author: a TripAdvisor user
565891961.reviewBody: The museum (50 MXP) is housed in a private mansion. Full of collectables all over the world. Very interesting to see how all these artifacts mingle. Good for an hour.

563185288.name: Artistic flavor
563185288.author: a TripAdvisor user
563185288.reviewBody: With the earthquake many places were limited in access.  Thishome and museum was a great choice. Beautiful and close to the town square

560539979.name: Most interesting
560539979.author: a TripAdvisor user
560539979.reviewBody: Simply the most interesting museum in Cuernavaca and you felt like you knew the man after the tour.  Would love to rent for a month.

558396701.name: should visit there
558396701.author: a TripAdvisor user
558396701.reviewBody: its amazing~  very calm and peaceful. furthermore, you can enjoy many collections like drawings, statues and masks.

558001098.name: amazing art, so peaceful
558001098.author: a TripAdvisor user
558001098.reviewBody: really beautiful place. imagine the debauchery that happened here! so peaceful. had a lovely time didn\'t really want to leave.

551349541.name: Beautifully appointed museum
551349541.author: a TripAdvisor user
551349541.reviewBody: A wonderful glimpse into the life of Robert Brady and the treasure he left Cuernavaca. Centrally located downtown. Absolutely worth a visit especially if you love Mexican decor and masks.

550758478.name: Interesting museum
550758478.author: a TripAdvisor user
550758478.reviewBody:
In a lovely old house that used to be part of the Cuernavaca Cathedral, lived a wealthy american man, that traveled the world and acquired art pieces. You could stay there contemplating the paintings or figures shown in this house.
 
Interesting museum, for people that likes art.

546454201.name: A must visit site
546454201.author: a TripAdvisor user
546454201.reviewBody: This is a must visit site, Robert Brady traveled the world, and brought back many wonderful pieces of art, and they are on display in the house. Well worth a visit to see the artwork and the interior of this beautiful house. Plan about 1 hour for the visit, it was $45 Pesos per person.

545791356.name: Lovely Setting
545791356.author: a TripAdvisor user
545791356.reviewBody: What a lovey setting in Cuernavaca. The beautiful garden is blissful and enjoyable to sit and relax. Definitely worth a visit!

542719147.name: Really amazing house and decor!
542719147.author: a TripAdvisor user
542719147.reviewBody: Never had heard of Robert Brady before, very impressive, beautiful little oasis!! Amazing collection of artefacts, he must have been a big character!

532456951.name: Very enjoyable
532456951.author: a TripAdvisor user
532456951.reviewBody: I enjoyed my visit to the Robert Brady Museum. The interior of the building was very unique.. totally different styles within the same house. The collection was impressive and interesting.

529422354.name: A most incredible place
529422354.author: a TripAdvisor user
529422354.reviewBody: This is a must see.  Something for everyone.  He was a very eclectic collector with an eye for beauty. There is something spectacular with every turn of your head.

528800148.name: Worth the trip to Cuernavaca
528800148.author: a TripAdvisor user
528800148.reviewBody: We really loved the design and interior of this mansion. Nice views from the different rooms, great art work, nice inner yard with pool. We were almost alone in there, which made us forget that were there as tourists. In my view, this was the major highlight in Cuernavaca.

523295388.name: Unique Museum
523295388.author: a TripAdvisor user
523295388.reviewBody: Loved being able to walk through Robert Brady\'s home and see his unbelievable art collection.  The rooms have the art listed in both Spanish and English.  Just amazing - do not miss this museum.

519627956.name: Precious
519627956.author: a TripAdvisor user
519627956.reviewBody: Splendid mansion with an ecclectic collection of known and unknown artists. You can only admire and be slightly jealous of his taste (and money)

519156309.name: Colorful Mexican House
519156309.author: a TripAdvisor user
519156309.reviewBody: I like this museum. You can see all the craziness and creative and all the colors you can imagine in this house. Very fun experience to see an old Mexican house and garden deco.

515032108.name: Great place to visit
515032108.author: a TripAdvisor user
515032108.reviewBody: This was for us the best place to visit in the Centro  Historico. Even better than the Palio de Cortez\n\n

498948010.name: An insightful and inspiring space
498948010.author: a TripAdvisor user
498948010.reviewBody: The Brady Museum is a thoughtful homage to the man who lived therein- and the breadth of the collection he acquired. The artworks that Brady lived with attest to the depth and creativity of the company he kept. His own tapestries are inspired in their color and graphic elements. I love being in the world of Robert Brady, and i hope to go back again and again.

497668088.name: Lovely
497668088.author: a TripAdvisor user
