497668088.reviewBody: I had no idea this was here until I started doing research on Cuernavaca! Wow Robert Brady was a billionaire American art collector and artist who sold his home in Venice to come to Cuernavaca. The mansion was part of the monastery. It is full of art and his personal belongings as though he has just run to the market! Awesome absolutely loved it!

497202929.name: Interesting to visit
497202929.author: a TripAdvisor user
497202929.reviewBody: It was interesting to walk around the house with it art and religious artifacts, but I could have used a little more explanation about it. As far as I could see it was just the house of a rich gay art collector. I would have liked a bit more history.

497029651.name: Very interesting house and grounds.
497029651.author: a TripAdvisor user
497029651.reviewBody: Visit an ex-pat\'s house near the zocalo that is expansive and very artfully furnished and decorated with famous Mexican artists\' paintings.  Brady lived very well in Cuernavaca.  Very well worth the visit.

496990794.name: Perfection!
496990794.author: a TripAdvisor user
496990794.reviewBody: This is the dream home I never knew existed.  You feel like you are the first guests to arrive at a party, not a museum.  The decor is incredible.  What a gem in this amazing city!

490724719.name: Amazing home! Beautiful collection....
490724719.author: a TripAdvisor user
490724719.reviewBody: My personal favorite place to see in Cuernavaca.  The kitchen and bathroom tile work is incredible as are his many possessions. If you are a person who loves art, architecture, and the colors and designs of Mexico, you will really enjoy visiting his home.

488483899.name: A hidden gem
488483899.author: a TripAdvisor user
488483899.reviewBody: Something that you can rarely find in this state, it is totally worthy. It has a vast art collection that full its rooms.

487504915.name: A must see in Cuerna
487504915.author: a TripAdvisor user
487504915.reviewBody: This is a collection you don\u00b4t want to miss.  Firstly is beautiful, secondly you will find more than you bargain for.  All of us living in Cuerna know this museum...you gotta go!

486895393.name: Brady Museum
486895393.author: a TripAdvisor user
486895393.reviewBody: A marvelous look at the past through the eyes of an eccentric and eclectic American who came and fell in love with Cuernavaca. Peaceful and beautiful, it\'s one of a kind and you shouldn\'t miss it! If he\'s there, Sergio can give you a wonderful inside look of the museum as well as of a Cuernavaca of the past.

486557651.name: Visual Perfection
486557651.author: a TripAdvisor user
486557651.reviewBody: Visiting the Robert Brady Museum provided an intimate glimpse into one man\'s colorful and vibrant life. Robert Brady\'s eye for collecting is a gift to those who visit. The collections provides an impression of Brady\'s style of living and his view of the world. I would like to have been one of Brady\'s friends!

486271060.name: Excellent museum
486271060.author: a TripAdvisor user
486271060.reviewBody: We lived this jewel of a museum!  It is the beautiful home of Robert Brady and filled with stunning art and enchanting artifacts. It is close to the cathedral and you don\'t want to miss it!

475951039.name: What a collection!
475951039.author: a TripAdvisor user
475951039.reviewBody: What a beautiful house, but the artwork is really what is amazing! This is a don\'t miss if you are in Cuernavaca!

474283413.name: Amazing
474283413.author: a TripAdvisor user
474283413.reviewBody: A must in Cuernavaca. It is a huge collection of art, handcrafts and everything to have a nice life. Tom Brady was a lover of the world.

470406633.name: Unexpected highlight of visit to Cuernavaca
470406633.author: a TripAdvisor user
470406633.reviewBody: We spent much of the visit arguing which room we would want to claim as our own, as this still feels very much like a home, albeit highly eccentric and stylised.  Fabulous art, both "real" and native from around the world, furnishings, and garden.  A real must if you like design and aesthetics.

467635100.name: Exceptionally well-curated museum in former home
467635100.author: a TripAdvisor user
467635100.reviewBody: The Brady Museum is absolutely beautiful. It\'s a home I would enjoy living it, actually. The colors and design are delightful and the collection is diverse, beautiful, and amazing. I took more photos here than in any other single attraction during my visit to Cuernavaca and the surrounding area. It\'s a must-see!

467611064.name: A long time favorite
467611064.author: a TripAdvisor user
467611064.reviewBody: I generally avoid the "M" word but have been here several times and enjoyed every visit.  It is in his former home & has been restored exactly as when he lived there, with the addition of electricity and windows.  Each time, I learn something new about him.  It is positively gorgeous!

466984578.name: Unbelievable number of artifacts
466984578.author: a TripAdvisor user
466984578.reviewBody: The interior of the multi-level home is unique in itself. But the quantity of artifacts and memorabilia is overwhelming. I was unaware of Robert Brady, but now I have an appreciation of his life experiences.

465409989.name: Unique!
465409989.author: a TripAdvisor user
465409989.reviewBody: What a wonderful surprise to see such a unique collection of art is such a well curated and preserved home.. This is a must see if you enjoy local art and decor! It\'s amazing to think of someone actually owning all of these things and living among them!

461536535.name: Museum trip
461536535.author: a TripAdvisor user
461536535.reviewBody: We left feeling that we should have seen this house before designing and building our own.  Wonderful way to bring the outdoors inside, and create beauty for any day.

458887613.name: Do not miss
458887613.author: a TripAdvisor user
458887613.reviewBody: The home of Robert Brady, extraordinarily decorated with the art he travelled the world to collect, spending his inheritance to do so. Very tranquil and beautiful, of a manageable scale for a museum.

458712029.name: This is a must!
458712029.author: a TripAdvisor user
458712029.reviewBody: We are world travelers and this is my favorite of the houses, castles, etc. that I\'ve been in.  One of a kind and very colorful.

457154697.name: Brady Museum
457154697.author: a TripAdvisor user
457154697.reviewBody: It is a must see if you are in Cuernavaca, it has a very eclectic collection of art and artifacts, located in downtown Cuernavaca, you have to visit!

454963023.name: Hidden Gem
454963023.author: a TripAdvisor user
454963023.reviewBody: Wonderful collection in super interesting lay out. House is beautiful.\nYou will learn about Brady as well as his friends and acquaintances.

454392977.name: Best site in town
454392977.author: a TripAdvisor user
454392977.reviewBody: Weird, interesting, campy. Great collection of art and artifacts from around the world. And statues of Josephine Baker. Loved it.

452896649.name: very interesting
452896649.author: a TripAdvisor user
452896649.reviewBody: Just in the heart of Cuernavaca, you can miss visiting this house/museum. The house is amazing and the art collection is quite interesting.Its history is very interesting.

452439329.name: A bizarre place worth a visit if you are in town
452439329.author: a TripAdvisor user
452439329.reviewBody: Robert Brady was an artist an collectionner.  And what an eclectic collection. As you go from room to room you will find a succession of colourfull rooms with so many interesting pieces of art.  Very original

451074330.name: Interesting house with Interesting stuff
451074330.author: a TripAdvisor user
451074330.reviewBody: This house/museum has very interesting stuff that Brady collected from different cultures all around the world. Additionally, the design is very pretty. It is also in the city center, so it is something you can do while visiting Cuernavaca city Center.

450565043.name: Visit today
450565043.author: a TripAdvisor user
450565043.reviewBody: A delightful home with lots of nice art. Definitely worth a visit.  It gives one an ideas of the homes of that period here in Cuernavaca.

450509509.name: Most amazing!
450509509.author: a TripAdvisor user
450509509.reviewBody: As a folk art collector and lover of the arts, I found this museum pretty really thrilling. The fine art and folk art collections are truly wonderful! Although the main focus is Mexico, there are fabulous examples from around the world, both ancient and modern. The incredible house and grounds are a true feast for the eyes, and a nice respite from Cuernavaca\'s busy streets. It is not to be missed.\n

448391442.name: A Not-to-Miss Museum
448391442.author: a TripAdvisor user
448391442.reviewBody: This "rectory" turned into a house then into a museum is a wonderful view into the life of the rich and famous of the mid-20th century.  Every piece of furniture art and artifacts are as they were when Brady lived there.  As a contemporary and friend of many of the world\'s famous artists (painters and performers) and an extensive traveler, this museum astounds senses.

445693121.name: One of Cuernavaca\'s treasures.
445693121.author: a TripAdvisor user
445693121.reviewBody: An artist\'s home, just as he lived in it, turned into a museum. Excellent pieces collected from all over the world. Tapestries designed by Robert Brady himself. Funny and quaint details showing the host\'s sense of humor, and appreciation for his friends who visited, among them celebrities of the time like Josephine Baker, for example.

445429357.name: a full hour entertainment
445429357.author: a TripAdvisor user
445429357.reviewBody: This is the Cuernavaca museum to visit as a must.\nThe artifacts are extraordinary selected to show what explorers can discover around the world! Abnd the house is deliciously decorated.

440488327.name: A must see by all
440488327.author: a TripAdvisor user
440488327.reviewBody: If you had only one place to visit in Cuernavaca - this would be the place. An excellent architectural structure, which was originally the home of the priest of the adjacent Cathedral. Filled with original art that is seldom seen outside of the museum. The gardens are beautiful and well tended as is the reminder of the property.

439045303.name: Beautiful artifacts and house
439045303.author: a TripAdvisor user
439045303.reviewBody: You won\'t know where to look first Or second. Or... well, you get the idea.\n\nLots of artifacts, art, and a fabulous (former) home in which to see them. Architecture, art, a calm place in the city.

435104358.name: Very intriguing
435104358.author: a TripAdvisor user
435104358.reviewBody: I did not know what to expect but I was overwhelmed by the number of pictures and items collected.  It was worth the minimal amount paid to enter.

432479037.name: Must see
432479037.author: a TripAdvisor user
432479037.reviewBody: An extraordinary home-turned museum by a fabulous collector...fine art to folk art...exquisite collection, gorgeous home...

430759684.name: Must see in the center of town, behind the Cathedral
430759684.author: a TripAdvisor user
430759684.reviewBody: The collection is as delightful as the architecture of a space that is a work of art in itself.\nBeautifully landscaped, one imagines the life of Brady and his amazing collection arranged by subject matter.  A wonderful collection of masks, tile works, and curious objects that delight, made this a wonderful place with a background as interesting as the works it houses.  I think it has appeal to a broad spectrum of visitors to Cuernavaca. There are guides cards provided in English and Spanish to point out the highlights and details of the collection.  There are many levels to the house and no lifts observed for wheel chair or impared visitors.  I believe the entry fee was 45 pesos.

427690794.name: Under renovation
427690794.author: a TripAdvisor user
427690794.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and historic setting. There is s gallery which was in the process of changing artists so I didn\'t get to see it. There are beautiful fountains, but none were functioning. Entrance is $30 pesos, or $15 for seniors (tercera edad).

420294629.name: A feast for the eyes
420294629.author: a TripAdvisor user
420294629.reviewBody: The Museum director Alberto gave us a wonderful insight into the treasures held at this first class museum.  I highly recommend it to anyone spending time in Cuernavaca.

414287816.name: A Tranquil Place place for Art in a Bustling Downtown with Contemporary History
414287816.author: a TripAdvisor user
414287816.reviewBody: I had only a limited time in Cuernavaca for Spanish study. A trip to the Brady Museum in the heart of downtown should be on everyone\'s short list.  The entrance fee is not high, but you should opt to pay the extra $15 U.S. for a guided tour to explain all of the art and history that are here or it will go right by you as you stroll through on your own.  My guide was Sergio and he was able to offer the tour in any of several languages.  Brady was a resident of this city in recent times.  He collected art from all over the world.  If he liked it, he bought it, and brought it to his home.  When he died, he left his home and art as a gift to the City.  His friends who visited and stayed here were sports and entertainment icons from the 60\'s, 70\'s and 80\'s that most of us knew.  He has an eclectic collection, from tribal masks and fertility gods to paintings and statuary from around the world.  For me the highlight was viewing an original painting by Frida Kahlo:  an amusing self-portrait of her with her pet monkey, which Mr. Brady acquired before she became famous to the world.  His ashes are also buried here in the garden next to those of his two beloved dogs.  Without a guide, you would miss this shady spot completely. Enjoy an hour or two respite from the busy City in this quiet relaxed place.  Then go back outside around the corner and tour the main cathedral that is hundreds of years old.

405835750.name: This was the best place we visited in Cuernavaca.
405835750.author: a TripAdvisor user
405835750.reviewBody: The art and decor of this are extraordinary.  The curator stopped by to give us great additional information about the history and art work.

401089203.name: Fabulous
401089203.author: a TripAdvisor user
401089203.reviewBody: Great museum of a fascinating expat. Must see. A tribute to a fascinating man. Artesian art not only from Mexico but also around world.

397721805.name: Not only an eclectic art collection, a beautiful downtown Cuernavaca house.
397721805.author: a TripAdvisor user
397721805.reviewBody: For many art lovers, this house has an interesting eclectic collection. For me, the architecture, colors and decoration of the house are awesome. This is a typical downtown house in Cuernavaca, from the outside, it doesn\u00b4t say much, once you\'re inside, the architecture is amazing, the patios, the perfectly well preserved kitchen and Brady\'s particular decoration are worth visiting.

397572239.name: you must visit it
397572239.author: a TripAdvisor user
397572239.reviewBody: IS a very interesting place where you can realize the  intellectual environment that took place in Cuernavaca the last quarter of the XXth century. In Cuernavaca were living important personallities from the intellectual, arttistic and philosohical world.\nThe collection is quite unique and is "must" if you visit this city.

397078269.name: Dude was weird
397078269.author: a TripAdvisor user
397078269.reviewBody: Such an eclectic collection-miniature sculptures of the Last Supper where they\'re all eating slices of watermelon, posters of Josephine Baker in the amazingly-tiled bathroom, and it\'s right up against the cathedral. A great place to spend a couple of hours.

396432925.name: Folk Art Fantasy
396432925.author: a TripAdvisor user
396432925.reviewBody: A sweet home, left like it was when Robert Brady lived there.  Magical setting and art.  I can only imagine the parties he threw!

396017895.name: Eclectic as the man who lived there
396017895.author: a TripAdvisor user
396017895.reviewBody: Interesting guy . . . I don\'t know much about him but he seemed to know everyone in the art world and they all gave him art. Diego Rivera, Frida Kahlo, and more.\nI recommend hiring a guide to explain all the stuff. Otherwise you\'ll be walking through someone\'s house which is filled to the brim with stuff and wonder, what the heck is this all doing here? And where are there windows only on one side of the house?\nRegardless, worth a visit if you\'re in Cuernavaca; wouldn\'t come to the city just for this though.

392944989.name: Fantastic
392944989.author: a TripAdvisor user
392944989.reviewBody: From the big wood doors that face the street, to the sitting area at the terrace, everything about this was enchanting.. it was old true Mexican architecture.  It was like being in a time warp. The extensive art collection, paintings, sculptures,  from Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia, South America, North America,  all very tastefully displayed, my kids ages 12 and 9 found it interesting. They were not bored at all. Really enjoyable.

392159997.name: Stunning house and art collection
392159997.author: a TripAdvisor user
392159997.reviewBody: What a great museum!!!  We spent well over an hour going through each room and admiring all of the art pieces.  It\'s a world wide collection of eclectic pieces.  The house itself is a worthwhile visit but the art, including Frida Kahlo originals, is definitely a top destination in Cuernavaca.

389397430.name: Eclectic & Surprising
389397430.author: a TripAdvisor user
389397430.reviewBody: One mans house, collection, passion, hobby, life? A place to be savoured and enjoyed, peaceful and tranquil and packed with art works from around the world.\nA true bohemian

387927309.name: Hidden Gem in the Middle of the Centro
387927309.author: a TripAdvisor user
387927309.reviewBody: I really love this museum. I have been here twice. It is the perfect size and a great spot to check out if you are on a day trip in Cuernavaca. I love how the museum is set up. It is a great way to compare many different styles of art. Nice midday break from the hot sun.

387635738.name: Amazing unique place and a MUST to do
387635738.author: a TripAdvisor user
387635738.reviewBody: I was very tired of seeing the same kind of museums, however I decided to take a look. Once you are inside the house you would be amaze to see the incredible decoration with all the art that he collected. Each piece is assigned in a particular spot, each room of the house has a peculiar decoration that its different from another ones. A place to see!

387601094.name: a thrilling surprise
387601094.author: a TripAdvisor user
387601094.reviewBody: on a visit to Cuernavaca I came upon this jewel of a museum. The private home of painter and world traveler ,Robert Brady, has been converted into a museum and the results are magnificent. Beautifully appointed rooms,laden with art works from izquierdo,Kahlo,and other Latin and South American artists.  the museum is inexperience to access, about $2 US dollars and can be viewed in an hour ,so no reason not to go and be exposed to some unique culture and visually exciting art and architecture. congratulations to curator,Sergio Gonzalez, on a job well done.

386808348.name: The Brady House Museum
386808348.author: a TripAdvisor user
386808348.reviewBody: Robert Brady lived in Cuernavaca during the 60\'s and 70\'s.  His house was formerly part of the local cathedral, in downtown Cuernavaca.  He was an artist and art collector.  He had previously lived in Venice, and was friends with Peggy Guggenheim, Josephine Baker, Helen Hayes, and many other famous people, many of whom visited him in Cuernavaca.  His lover was Geoffrey Hines.  His house is now a museum and his wonderful art collection is on display, including his own work, Dr. Atl, Frida Kahlo, and many others.  His remains and those of his dogs are buried in his garden.

382817531.name: Worth the time to look
382817531.author: a TripAdvisor user
382817531.reviewBody: I spent about an hour visiting and found it worth every minute.  I suggest this is worth seeing and appreciating.

381745195.name: Loved this place
381745195.author: a TripAdvisor user
381745195.reviewBody:
Loved the theme rooms and all the colors of walls, tile, furnishings all of it.    Normally I would think the rooms too busy but in this case it was all so tastefully done.  Lovely is the built in furniture with the cushions. 

I went to the theater in the back of the property to see one of the movies they offer for 25 pesos.  But the sound quality wasn't great plus my Spanish not that great.   

I can only wonder what grand parties were held at this house.

380823356.name: Insight into a wonderful man and his Mexican home
380823356.author: a TripAdvisor user
380823356.reviewBody: This is a must in Cuernavaca. The home is beautiful  and beyond. The man was caring and thoughtful and had a large impact on his community. Go and Enjoy...  Take a guide... it is worth it.

377763372.name: "A must see "
377763372.author: a TripAdvisor user
377763372.reviewBody: Make time for this museum and see how social lights live and entertained.  This world travelers collection of religious art is spectacular and jaw  dropping. The architectural detail in this home mixed with all the customized colors on the walls. Makes this place visual masterpiece.

370162318.name: Fantastic museum..Increadible home
370162318.author: a TripAdvisor user
370162318.reviewBody: New very little of Robert Brady, but came out totally inspired by his artistic collection and accomplishments.\nAnd yes, Freddie Mercury looks a lot like Robert Brady!!

360513247.name: Best thing in Cuernavaca!
360513247.author: a TripAdvisor user
360513247.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this gorgeous museum in center of town. Got a feeling for Sr. Brady and his lifestyle. Would definitely recommend and would return.

359927080.name: Really interesting attraction.
359927080.author: a TripAdvisor user
359927080.reviewBody: This was a very nice visit. The house is amazing and the art collection varied and beautiful. A very tranquil experience unlike the crowded visit to the Frida Kahlo museum in Mexico City. Worth it for 35 pesos.

359567780.name: What a gem
359567780.author: a TripAdvisor user
359567780.reviewBody: The Brady is an incredible, albeit small, museum of significant artistic and cultural significance. The art is outstanding but the venue (home) in which it is displayed is beyond outstanding.  This is a must visit in Cuernavaca - nearby is the cathedral and some excellent restaurants and bars. This area deserves a full afternoon.

357929209.name: A Very Worthwhile Place to Visit
357929209.author: a TripAdvisor user
357929209.reviewBody: I just completed a tour of the Robert Brady House/Museum.  It was well worth the $40Peso entry fee.   It just amazes me that such a lovely place even exists.  Not just the art and antiquities throughout the home, but the home itself.  Imagine living in a place like this.

356686633.name: Lovely Place
356686633.author: a TripAdvisor user
356686633.reviewBody: Was pleased to spend an hour wandering the rooms and grounds of this lovely oasis in an otherwise unappealing city. It\'s clear that Cuernavaca was once an alluring draw for creative folks such as Brady and his circle of friends. All details of the house and gardens have been maintained just as they were when Brady passed away. This place is like Xanadu, just the diversion one needs after trudging the dirty, polluted streets of Cuernavaca.

355662150.name: Love this place!
355662150.author: a TripAdvisor user
355662150.reviewBody: In Cuernavaca\'s center... a precious private house made museum. I love this place for the peace you feel there, for its style,its colors, for the former owner\'s art collections you can enjoy there!

354891068.name: Stunningly Beautiful House
354891068.author: a TripAdvisor user
354891068.reviewBody: Left in same condition as when Robert Brady passed.  Colors are amazing as is all the Mexican folk art.  Same block as the Cathedral in the Centro Historico. \n

351706920.name: If you are in Cuernavaca, don\'t miss this place
351706920.author: a TripAdvisor user
351706920.reviewBody: I first visited this museum 12 years ago so was anxious to go back and see it again.  It is really something.  Don\'t try to rush through it, take your time.  In each room there are placards that illustrate each piece of art and tells you what it is.  That was very helpful.  \n\nIf you are in Cuernavaca this is a must see.  We took about 45 minutes to get through.  While small, there is a lot of stuff to see.

349838865.name: Very Enjoyable
349838865.author: a TripAdvisor user
349838865.reviewBody:
I very much enjoyed the tour around this interesting house.  How wonderful that it has been kept as a museum for others to enjoy, as the owner once did.  

I like to decorate my own home in colours, so it was nice to see how he did it all--what a great eye for detail and arrangements.  

Don't miss this one.

349723393.name: A unique museum
349723393.author: a TripAdvisor user
349723393.reviewBody: There are over 1300 pieces of primitive art in this building of 14 rooms. It was originally the astronomical observatory of Cuernavaca\'s second bishop. Robert Brady, a wealthy Northamerican, bought it in 1959. The kitchen is done in traditional Mexican style, and there are paintings by artists such as Rufino Tamayo and Frida Khalo. Brady died in 1986.

349273157.name: A Truly Great Little Collection
349273157.author: a TripAdvisor user
349273157.reviewBody: This museum was not so very long ago, the home of an American artist, world traveler and bon vivant, Robert Brady.  Se\u00f1or Brady filled this property, which literally backs onto the catedral, with art from his travels in Latin America and around the world.  Not only does the arrangement reflects his unique artistic sense, but he modified certain spaces to emphasize the provenance of the art there in.  Hence, The Oriental Room, etc.  The rooms are enchanting,  Kitchens and bathrooms are colorful and equally amusing.  In a way, the personal and whimsical nature of this collection, mixed together with the art of the collector, reminds me of the Salvador Dali Museum in Figueres.  If you enjoy art, color and whimsy, the Robert Brady Museum is not to be missed.

348566422.name: Very unique museum
348566422.author: a TripAdvisor user
348566422.reviewBody: The house where Robert Brady lived and left to the city to be used as a museum is quite fascinating. It is filled with art, including a Frida Kahlo self portrait, and hundreds of other interesting objects.

346670294.name: Cultural treasure
346670294.author: a TripAdvisor user
346670294.reviewBody: Robert Brady traveled all over the world and brought back artistic treasures that he left for people to enjoy.  This museum is next to the cathedral.

346370598.name: Eye Candy
346370598.author: a TripAdvisor user
346370598.reviewBody: Beautiful home and grounds, loved all of the artwork and artifacts from all over the world.  Makes you wish you had met Mr. Brady to hear his stories of entertaining in this grand home.

345083148.name: tastefully eclectic
345083148.author: a TripAdvisor user
345083148.reviewBody: this private house contains a very well arranged ensemble of cultural artefacts from all over the world.All has been done in great taste. Reminded us of like collections in Boston and Ca\u00efro. Well worth the visit.

343190751.name: Amazing!
343190751.author: a TripAdvisor user
343190751.reviewBody: The art work, the decor of the home, the upkeep given it---all are top notch.  Again, why didn\'t I read up before I went???

342690934.name: Eclectic and Old World
342690934.author: a TripAdvisor user
342690934.reviewBody: Beautiful museum, well maintained with self guided tours.  You won\'t want to miss this if you are in the area.

342626058.name: Fascinating place
342626058.author: a TripAdvisor user
342626058.reviewBody: Well worth visiting and experiencing the domestic collection of Robert Brady a fascinating character himself.

341448761.name: Incredible variety of treasures!
341448761.author: a TripAdvisor user
341448761.reviewBody: Every step leads you through an incredible array of items collected through the years by Robert Brady.  The colors shimmer in the warm sun, and awaken your senses and appreciation for the displays.

341015708.name: Awesome
341015708.author: a TripAdvisor user
341015708.reviewBody: The guy who owned this places reminds me of Freddy mercury he has an interesting art collection. He had a great eye for art. Must really visit this place. It feels like its haunted though the guy and his dog are buried in the garden.

340680910.name: Beautiful house and lovely collection
340680910.author: a TripAdvisor user
340680910.reviewBody: This museum and the grounds are beautiful. The wall and any table space is covered with artifacts, but it does not look crowded or too much at all. It all goes together very well. And the artifacts were from all over the works and beautiful and many from famous artists. Enjoyed visiting this museum.

336395745.name: Small eccentric private collection but very well run and Spanish/ English info for everything
336395745.author: a TripAdvisor user
336395745.reviewBody: Eccentric house of English artist. Very well managed and quite delightful. Huge amount of artwork. Similar to sir john soames museum in London.

334806699.name: Original Frida!
334806699.author: a TripAdvisor user
334806699.reviewBody: This hidden gem in Cuernavaca is filled with a most peculiar and eclectic array of artwork, including original Tamayo and Frida paintings! Definitely a must-see for any art aficionado.

332143106.name: A real gem!
332143106.author: a TripAdvisor user
332143106.reviewBody: Thank you Robert Brady for opening your exquisite home to the public. The art and artifacts are first class! Great size. Can take all in as fast or slow as you wish. It was not crowded when we were there. That and the friendly staff made for an enjoyable visit!

331504302.name: My inspiration
331504302.author: a TripAdvisor user
331504302.reviewBody: The sheer number of objects he\'d collected in his life was overwhelming enough but the source and origins and the variety!!!  One can tell he loved life and it rubs off on the visitors to this wonderful home.

327706328.name: A must-see ... worth a special trip to city if you love art
327706328.author: a TripAdvisor user
327706328.reviewBody: The US painter Robert Brady loved both Cuernavaca and art from around the world.  This was his home for more than a decade, and he left it \'to the world\' to see.  Come see it!  It\'s an amazingly eclectic collection - obviously a lot from Mexico, but also Europe, Asia and Africa, modern and \'old\' pieces arranged in a way that he liked best. His own work is sprinkled throughout, along with other artists who were his contemporaries. The religious art, especially, is very beautiful. The building itself is a work of art, and you\'ll see his kitchen, bedroom, etc., along with the lovely gardens and his swimming pool.  Unusual for Mexico, there\'s a bit more English in this art museum (hint for anyone in Mexico\'s tourism industry reading this: you need WAY more English if you want to attract international travelers!)  But this is one museum worth going out of the way for... a true gem, with a lot of individual \'character,\' thanks to Brady\'s taste.

325119553.name: Grogeous and a Must See
325119553.author: a TripAdvisor user
325119553.reviewBody: Perhaps the most beautiful home I have ever seen. Filled with pre-columbian art, this home is not to be missed.

323463776.name: Amazing home and history in downtown cuernavaca
323463776.author: a TripAdvisor user
323463776.reviewBody:
Not knowing robert brady i went into this home now turned museum.  The spectacle is just breathtaking.   A man who had no kin, his home beatifully preserved is a must while in cuernavaca.

Brady had no windows into his house, there are literally no glass windows, and it´s all open space.  The house was a monastery which is why it features the tower.

Youll find his room, and all his general areas as well as an indian room in the house built for a friend.

A must while in cuerna.

314405839.name: A nice view into a private art collection and how its owner lived
314405839.author: a TripAdvisor user
314405839.reviewBody: A very nice place, the former house of Robert Brady, where you can encounter not only Mexican art, but also objects from other parts of the world.

314350655.name: GO HERE.
314350655.author: a TripAdvisor user
314350655.reviewBody: Totally amazing.  Largely left as it was when he lived there, as Mr. Brady (Heinz fortune inheritor and art world maven) willed it.  Great space, knowledgeable and awesome staff and a really eclectic collection.

311040522.name: Inmersion into an intelelectual\'s habitat of the sixties in Cuernavaca
311040522.author: a TripAdvisor user
311040522.reviewBody: It is a great place to understand how upscale artists use to leave in Cuernavaca. It is also a great place to get ideas about interior design, as well as to check some pieces from important Mexican painters.   It is a Museum every visitor should check out.

307358331.name: The place you would like to live forever. A dream.
307358331.author: a TripAdvisor user
307358331.reviewBody: Small, unique and special. Never seen anything similar. You feel in another world. Every piece of art is in the perfect place. The former house and now museum is a dream.

301557656.name: Amazing private collection in a 16th century mansion in the heart of the Historical Colonial Center of Cuernavaca.
301557656.author: a TripAdvisor user
301557656.reviewBody: This beautiful 16th century building which is a part of the 16th Century Cathedral complex contains the exquisite collection of Robert Brady, including famous 20th century art of Freida Kahlo, Diego Rivera,Paul Klee, Miguel Covarrubias, Francisco Toledo, and others.  The eclectic collection also includes bizanntine mosaics, Mexican masks, Persian tapestries, Pre-colombian and Colonial artifacts and folkart from Latin America and African, African artifacts and other collections from his many world-wide travels.

301228254.name: What a collection
301228254.author: a TripAdvisor user
301228254.reviewBody: If you are in Cuernavaca do not miss the Brady Museum.  Robert Brady over his lifetime accumulated an impressive art collection, not just of Mexico.  The house is kept as he left it upon his death.  (he is buried in the garden with his favorite dogs).  The art is amazing but the ambiance set by him is magical. As a museum is small, as a house is large.  Particularly important a Frida Kahlo portrait.\n\nThe house itself is also impressive.  It within the grounds of Cuernavaca\'s cathedral, one of the earliest Spanish buildings in America mainland.

295118765.name: Unexpectedly nice
295118765.author: a TripAdvisor user
295118765.reviewBody: We arrived here by chance and decided to go in since we didn\'t have much to do. It was worth it. It\'s a nice house with some history, some spaces (common areas and bathrooms) reminded me of the style of Dali\'s house in Spain.

287953974.name: Incredible Musuem
287953974.author: a TripAdvisor user
287953974.reviewBody: The house itself is a work of art.  Then it is filled with over 1300 pieces of art from around the world.  Brady\'s own paintings are remarkable.  This is as fine a museum (big or small) as you will find anywhere in the world.  It\'s not just a place where art is collected and displayed, but where each piece has a meaning and a purpose and lives exactly where it was destined to be.  In a city full of history and monumental architecture The Robert Brady Museum is the crown jewel.  It is worth the trip to Cuernavaca just to see this amazing place.

285894719.name: Don\'t miss!
285894719.author: a TripAdvisor user
285894719.reviewBody: A very interesting museum and so well organized with great informational cards in both Spanish and English. A must when visiting Cuernavaca!

285142022.name: Interesting decorative arts museum
285142022.author: a TripAdvisor user
285142022.reviewBody: I just went yesterday. Mr. Brady\'s house is gorgeous. The house is kept as if he were still living there and the collection is impressive. Figures, statuettes, utenlsils, paintings and furniture from so many places and times decorate all the walls, and there \'s even an original Kahlo  (on loan now). The house is so well located and the premises are kept in pristine condition. We talked to the curator, who was very informative about the origing of the construction and the museums conservation efforts. BTW, forgot to say every room has a card that explains most of the pieces....Admission is so cheap you can\u00b4t miss this place...and they even have a movie club....

283463880.name: Rainbow house!
283463880.author: a TripAdvisor user
283463880.reviewBody: Nice art, nice colors all over, very eccentric reflecting the former owner. Nice staff--they give you space to walk around and take pictures. NO flash. Do not expect a souvenir store, but the place is nice.

280499219.name: Imagine the parties!
280499219.author: a TripAdvisor user
280499219.reviewBody: Is it primarily an art museum that shows us how art from all around the globe represents the similarities of our humanity? Or is it a glimpse into a lifestyle of the 60\' - 70\'s jet set?\n\nEither way, it is a wonderful way to spend some time in Cuernavaca!

277819292.name: Excellent display of art
277819292.author: a TripAdvisor user
277819292.reviewBody:
If you happen to be in Cuernavaca, Mexico, visit the Robert Brady Museum, located in the city next to the beautiful 16th century Cathedral.

This museum is a real house with 14 different rooms. It was the home of Mr. Brady, American artist and house decorator that died in1986. It takes time to admire each little tapestry, painting, ceramic, etc from different parts of the world. The whole house has a strong Mexican character due to the architecture and colors on the walls and ornaments. It is a great place to visit if you appreciate ART. 
Beatrice Giannandrea

274243121.name: The best in town.
274243121.author: a TripAdvisor user
274243121.reviewBody: This a small museum, but it is not to measure it for its length, but its contents. It contains an important private collecton of paintings and artifacts, tons of museums would die for. The location as well will give you the typicall environment of a downtown old house,

272854455.name: Love, love, love it!
272854455.author: a TripAdvisor user
272854455.reviewBody: The museum is very unique and colorful. Ahhh, the parties that must have been thrown there! There are a ton of artworks from paintings to masks and the interior design is amazing. Favorite tourist site in Cuernavaca!

271770787.name: Outstanding Cuernavaca museum
271770787.author: a TripAdvisor user
271770787.reviewBody: Absolutely worth a visit. Excellent art collection, very eclectic. Some Frieda Kahlo art.\nThe gardens are done so tastefully and are lovely. I felt so relaxed in this space. Nice little cafe, for a cup of tea .\nHappy, soothing space, a gem.

268114061.name: fabulous small museum
268114061.author: a TripAdvisor user
268114061.reviewBody: This was once the private home of a wealthy American art patron. The house itself is gorgeous, right behind the Cathedral, with a small but beautifully landscaped garden. Each room is like a jewel box filled with exquisite works of art, many of them prime examples of Mexican "folk art," rugs, masks, pottery, religious art, mixed with paintings and drawings by famous artists like Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo. Even the bathrooms are filled with art and beautiful tile work. The kitchen is fabulous, with displays of beautiful pottery and tile work. There\'s a small coffee shop in the garden, and once a week there is a movie in the evenings, usually something foreign, art cinema classics.  The people who work here are helpful and knowledgeable, always willing to explain or answer questions. Well worth a visit.

268073953.name: One of the best private collections in Mexico
268073953.author: a TripAdvisor user
268073953.reviewBody: Loved the Robert Brady Museum.  The Museum gives a very personal view of the collection of Robert Brady.\n\nThe collection is shown with Mr. Brady\'s home and gardens.  Worth a visit just to see his home and gardens.  The collection is very personal of his travels and life.

267918208.name: Worth the hassle of getting here
267918208.author: a TripAdvisor user
267918208.reviewBody: Words cannot do justice to the surreal beauty of the place. It is pure pleasure to visit this eccentric american\'s home and appreciate his sense of art, humor, and subversion. I wish there was more information on him.

267562457.name: A Surprise Gem in the Heart of Mexico
267562457.author: a TripAdvisor user
267562457.reviewBody: Superb collection of art and artifacts from a wide variety of sources. A great place to spend an afternoon.

265454130.name: This museum/villa is worth a drive from wherever you are in Mexico City
265454130.author: a TripAdvisor user
265454130.reviewBody:
A tour guide recommended the Brady villa as an excellent art museum and he was correct.

This villa or as Brady called it - Casa de la Torre - was Brady's home while he lived in Cuernavaca. Brady died in the 1980s and (I think) he is buried in the back yard of the villa. 

The 10 room home is filled with a.) Brady's memorabilia - lot of photos with Brady's friends such as Geoff Holder, Josephine Baker, Peggy Guggenheim and so on and b.) Brady's own art as well as the art that he collected. There are too many major pieces to mention, but I sure liked the Frida Kahlo and Brady's portrait of Peggy Guggenheim, his friend. The art is hard to follow as there may well be 20 or more pieces on one small wall so - a suggestion - take your time and follow the artwork guide charts in each room.

Strong recommendation: I would engage the curator of the museum to provide the hidden back story on Brady, Brady's friends and the artwork. A pleasant young man who is proud of the villa and brought much of it to life for me.

In summary, do not miss this hidden gem.

265365373.name: Amazing Museum! Worth the trip to Cuernavaca!
265365373.author: a TripAdvisor user
265365373.reviewBody: I don\'t know why this Museum doesn\'t have more/better P.R.  It is such an amazing place.  A beautiful house with an amazing art collection. This should be the first stop on any visit to Cuernavaca. Robert Brady created an amazing home and you get to see all of it: the living rooms, bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchens - it\'s like a window into the private world of an amazing collector and artist.  You will love it and wonder - "how it this not more talked about."

264650104.name: Excellent museum
264650104.author: a TripAdvisor user
264650104.reviewBody: I love this place.  It\'s Robert Brady\'s home and it is filled with treasures from all over the world.  It is impossible to describe, but it must contain several million dollars worth of artifacts.  Most museums are boring to me.  This one is not!

262283885.name: If you like art...
262283885.author: a TripAdvisor user
262283885.reviewBody: If you are looking for interesting things to do in Cuernavaca\'s downtown be sure to include the Robert Brady Museum.  It is a fascinating collection of art, sculptures, and antiques all set in a most architectural setting.  You spend hours there, or just a few minutes depending on your schedule.

260253787.name: A fine eclectic art collection
260253787.author: a TripAdvisor user
260253787.reviewBody: If you like art and handicrafts, this is one of the most diverse collections you can find.  Mexico, Latin America, Africa, Asia, etc.  All in a fine old house in Cuernavaca.  A superb job in conservation of the site.  Your eyes pop....  Great job....

255441239.name: Wonderful eclectic display of international art
255441239.author: a TripAdvisor user
255441239.reviewBody: Liked it all and recommend it to everyone.  If you have children, be sure they respect the displays and keep their hands off.  You are walking up close to very available objects and paintings, including Frieda Kahlo.

253873902.name: A must see !
253873902.author: a TripAdvisor user
253873902.reviewBody: Def a must on the to do list. A very lovely home on a quiet street in\nThe center of town... Do not miss !

251013209.name: A must see museum.
251013209.author: a TripAdvisor user
251013209.reviewBody: It was wonderful, don\'t miss this museum.  I liked that the write ups about the art were in both Spanish and English.

248175998.name: incredible collection
248175998.author: a TripAdvisor user
248175998.reviewBody: I was really happy to see this house and the amazing collection that they have. the multi level house is great with beautiful touches all over.

246869626.name: Quirky and interesting
246869626.author: a TripAdvisor user
246869626.reviewBody: The private residence of Robert Brady that has been converted into a museum allowing the public to enjoy the architecture of his house and his private art collection. Both the house and art are quirky and interesting and fascinating. It\'s not a large home but it\'s chock full of great art. A must visit for Cuernavaca, my family always enjoys visiting this museum.

246379394.name: One of best attractions
246379394.author: a TripAdvisor user
246379394.reviewBody: Not much to see in Cuernavaca, but this restored house has it all.  Once you\'re inside, you\'ll find great architecture and details, wonderful paintings and sculpture.

245028695.name: A must see in Cuernavaca.
245028695.author: a TripAdvisor user
245028695.reviewBody: The house and its wide collection represent the characteristics of the spring town Currnavaca. Warm, colorful, wonderful surprises and tradition. Inside the garden it\'s easy to spot the Cathedral a couple of blocks away, and the combination of the various colors outstands. The host of the house is wonderful, knowledgable and of a good sense of humor. The cappuccino is simply great, an excuse to stay around for a longer while! Just 3 min walk from the terminal centro de Pullman de los Morelos. You must go!

244801785.name: A nice mix of stuff
244801785.author: a TripAdvisor user
244801785.reviewBody: If you want a museum with personality then this is it: the guy\'s eclectic taste runs all the way through the house so you can go there and just soak it in.

242402149.name: One of the must see places in Cuernavaca
242402149.author: a TripAdvisor user
242402149.reviewBody: Cuernavaca is so blessed with The Robert Brady Museum. In the almost ten years I have lived here I visit the Brady at least twice a year. Every time I think I see something new, the  docents always laugh when they tell me, "No it has always been there". After all these visits I am still seeing things I have missed on previous visits. The collection is incredible and beautifully displayed. What an interesting life Robert Brady had, traveling the world and collecting such fine examples of indigenous art. One of my favorite things is the portrait of his cook which hangs in the kitchen. The Brady is one of the gems of this beautiful city and is a very pleasant place to visit.

240153176.name: Gay Perfection
240153176.author: a TripAdvisor user
240153176.reviewBody: This is what being rich and gay and in love with Mexico will get you: a gorgeous house, decorated with the art of one\'s fabulous friends, and filled with collections of lovely antiquities.  A must-see.

232681132.name: Extraordinary Art Collection
232681132.author: a TripAdvisor user
232681132.reviewBody: Robert Brady lived in this house and decorated it with the art he had collected from around the world and Mexico. The grounds are spectacular as it used to be part of the Cathedral complex.\nYou are accompanied through the museum by a guide who will explain the pieces on display. \nIt is part of the cultural corridor of downtown Cuernavaca which goes from the Jardin Borda to the Palacio de Cort\u00e9s. Be sure to visit during your stay in Cuernavaca.

227005856.name: Beautiful Home, Eclectic Art Collection
227005856.author: a TripAdvisor user
227005856.reviewBody: Loved the art and architecture. Lovely garden setting. Wish it had taken more time to walk through, as there are several areas in the house where you cannot go.

225344995.name: A jewel!
225344995.author: a TripAdvisor user
225344995.reviewBody: I have been visiting the Brady for decades, and will go again in October! I keep returning because the guides are so good, and because there are so many incredible things to see there. In addition to the incredible art, architecture, and furniture, I have enjoyed the movies which are shown some evenings. The director is a wonderful person, and very respected. This is a great way to get to know a fascinating part of Cuernavaca.

221101710.name: Amazing
221101710.author: a TripAdvisor user
221101710.reviewBody: Its unusual to find a museum that so successfully maintains a sense of intimacy and so clearly reflects the personality of the owner (and his entourage).  The collection is diverse and charmingly displayed.  The staff is amazing, friendly and around when you need them.

219731992.name: Amazing stuff
219731992.author: a TripAdvisor user
219731992.reviewBody: SO  many wonderful pieces in the Brady museum. From ALL over the world! Kahlo, Rivera, and many others - Many, many great masks from everywhere!  Art from India, China, New Guinea, Europe Africa and Mexico, of course. Really a fantastic museum - a must see if you are in Curnavaca! and Close to the Centro.

219359893.name: a real gem of a museum
219359893.author: a TripAdvisor user
219359893.reviewBody: The museum is located in what previously was the buildings belonging to the cathedral and the franciscan convent. It contains an impressive collection of folk and religious art from all continents, with majority of objects, naturally, of Mexican origin. The house itself (and its decor) is a pure gem and a  rare visual delight. You will need no less than two hours to take it all in and you will want to come back. The collection has also some works of interesting 20th century artists such as Tamara de Lempicka or Miguel Covarrubias. The place is an absolute must-see.

219094270.name: Glimpse of a privileged lifestyle in central Cuernavaca
219094270.author: a TripAdvisor user
219094270.reviewBody: This is a museum, consisting of the private residence of Robert Brady in more or less the exact condition he left it on his demise. It sits next to the cathedral, and we were told was once part of the cathedral property. \nIf you enjoy house museums like the Musee Nissim de Camndo in Paris, you will enjoy this. It\'s a much more relaxed and more personal than the above, but interesting in the same way in that you see a slice of life preserved in the architecture and possessions.

214878987.name: worth the visit
214878987.author: a TripAdvisor user
214878987.reviewBody: museum is worth the visit, it has great paintings and was well restored, may favorite room of the house is the patio, so beautiful and the mexican style kitchens are always great to see. bring your student id for free entry.

213136294.name: A must see in Cuernavaca
213136294.author: a TripAdvisor user
213136294.reviewBody: I have visited the Robert Brady museo many times and each time see something new.  You can walk through the house on your own but going with an on-site guide is worth every pesos.  I doubt you will leave the museo without at least taking one hundred pictures or more.  Very colorful, very interesting and surprising and very worthwhile.

212880007.name: Take the time
212880007.author: a TripAdvisor user
212880007.reviewBody: Brady bought a monastery and remade it into a remarkable home, decorated with art treasures and taste. My wife was ready to move in, and declared the kitchen the one she\'s been dreaming about. Located around the corner from the Cathedral. The bathrooms are incredible. Take the time to visit.

206318269.name: More is always better
206318269.author: a TripAdvisor user
206318269.reviewBody: That must have been Robert Brady\'s opinion because there is hardly an inch between any two items throughout the house.  If that sounds cluttered it couldn\'t be farther from the truth.  Though the house is filled to the brim with interesting and beautiful art, it is all very tastefully appointed.  I always love to visit the Brady House each time we are in Cuernavaca and I always see something I missed before.  I too am a collector of Mexican folk art and fine art in general and appreciate seeing the wonderful things he collected and how they have been organized and arranged.  The house, grounds and collections are fantastic and a visit to Cuernavaca wouldn\'t be complete without seeing it.  Go get inspired!

206225411.name: Interesting
206225411.author: a TripAdvisor user
206225411.reviewBody: This big old mexican house itself is interesting, from the materials to the layout, as is Brady\'s collection of art from the entire world, from China, india, impressionist paintings, to Mexican artists and crafts, colonial paintings... It was quite unexpected to find quite so many things crammed into one place. Brady\'s personal life (whoever he was) also comes through in all its campy 70\'s glory - sideburns here we come! Don\'t let the idea of "some gringo\'s house in Cuernavaca" put you off, it\'s definitely worth a visit. There is a $30-$40 Pesos fee, well worth it.

205536290.name: Don\'t miss this gem of a museum!!!
205536290.author: a TripAdvisor user
205536290.reviewBody: I\'ve visited the Brady dozens of times and always see something new.  It is one of my favorite "museums" in the world.  \nRobert Brady was a wealthy artist in the mid-20th century.  When he died he left money and instructions to maintain his home as a museum\u2026 more or less exactly as it was the day he died.  \nSince he was friends with many of the rich and famous of his time there are original Riveras, Kahlos, Siquieros, Tamayos.  In addition to the art, the house itself is decorated with the best of Mexican textiles and world folk art.  Don\'t miss the wonderful sculpture of Josephine Baker.  Though gay Brady and Baker were married in an unofficial ceremony and she was the great love of his life.

204883411.name: Beautiful artwork in a beautiful home
204883411.author: a TripAdvisor user
204883411.reviewBody: Robert Brady was an incredible collector of art, and his house is beautiful.  The art ranges from religious to very secular, indigenous, Catholic, and cultures from Mexico all the way to Harlem, New York.  There are two very nice works by Diego Rivera.  A very enjoyable museum to see!

202633777.name: In need of interior decoration ideas?
202633777.author: a TripAdvisor user
202633777.reviewBody: You will get plenty when you visit the Brady museum, formerly his private home in Cuernavaca. Unexpected color combinations and tiled-bathrooms that will make you run home and want to remodel!

201278198.name: Makes Cuernavaca worthwhile
201278198.author: a TripAdvisor user
201278198.reviewBody: Definitely the number one attraction in Cuernavaca. The quirky private collection of expat American Robert Brady...he really had a good eye for art and design.

200863710.name: Do stop in here!
200863710.author: a TripAdvisor user
200863710.reviewBody: This museum was a highlight of our recent 3 week trip to Mexico.  Gorgeous collection by Robert Brady (it was his house).  I kept gasping each time we entered a new room.  The colors alone would make it worth seeing. It\'s connected to the old cathedral and was, I believe, a nunnery previously.

195774151.name: I was not prepared for this!
195774151.author: a TripAdvisor user
195774151.reviewBody: I went here as I thought I should after reading a few reviews.  Nothing quite prepares you for the assault on your visual senses!  Every room and space is full to the rafters of colour and kitsch that somehow comes together to make an incredibly tasteful experience. I would have moved in in an instant had I been able to.  Wonderful works of art sit alongside individual and local pieces and photos of Brady with an array of friends most of us would kill for.  Fascinating and mind blowing place

195241902.name: Amazing
195241902.author: a TripAdvisor user
195241902.reviewBody: If you don\'t go anywhere else in Cuernavaca, go here!  It\'s a time warp of wondrous objects and life style.

195234592.name: Magnificant art and gardens
195234592.author: a TripAdvisor user
195234592.reviewBody: Loved the combination of art, collections, and beautiful gardens in a former convent. Art collections are eclectic and varied from many countries.

194210897.name: Worth a visit
194210897.author: a TripAdvisor user
194210897.reviewBody: We spent about two hours in the museum enjoying the furniture and decorations as much as the art work itself. We had never heard of Robert Brady before we arrived in Cuernavaca--what an interesting and eccentric artist he must have been. The collection is quite impressive including Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, African and Native American objets d\'art, etc. We also appreciated Brady\'s own portraits of Peggy Guggenheim and Josephine Baker. This is a museum that is especially well-organized--each room had very helpful guides to identify every single painting, sculpture, mask, etc. The museum is just the right size for a two-hour visit with enough diversity to occupy the attention of a wide-variety of visitors. I should add that the curator was extraordinarily helpful -- he generously answered all of our many questions and offered a few wonderful anecdotes of his own.

193372884.name: What a GEM!!
193372884.author: a TripAdvisor user
193372884.reviewBody: We walked by this place several times and decided today to go in - partly because I read some recommendations on TA.  It was the highlight of our trip.  Brady made this home out of a 16th century convent and furnished it with 1300 works of art from his travels all over the world.  The artwork is amazing and the house itself is a treasure.  Don\'t miss this in Cuernavaca!

190984129.name: Amazing collection. Not to be missed
190984129.author: a TripAdvisor user
190984129.reviewBody: Would highly recommend a visit to the Brady museum. The grounds are beautiful this time of the year, lots of flowers blooming. The folk art collected by Robert Brady is varied, colorful and interesting.  There are written explanations in Spanish and English; the bilingual staff were all helpful and provided additional details about the collection and Mr. Brady.  Only 40 pesos for the fee to enter. Once you are done viewing the museum, you are only a short walk to other interesting sites. Was surprised to learn that Robert Brady was born in central Iowa --- known more for farming than artists.

187290724.name: Little treasure
187290724.author: a TripAdvisor user
187290724.reviewBody: Small place in what used to be Mr. Brady\'s house. All the artwork found there was part of his private collection and is still in it\'s original place. Very modest but rich in its veriety, this place in the city-center is definitely worth a visit for any art enthusiast!

186108074.name: Wow!
186108074.author: a TripAdvisor user
186108074.reviewBody: I\'m not even a huge art fan but this place was absolutely incredible! The architecture of the building was just as amazing as the art within the building. We went mid-week in November and there was only one other group of people there. Highly recommend!

183260581.name: Quirky, colorful, inspiring
183260581.author: a TripAdvisor user
183260581.reviewBody:
It's hard to tell from the street that you're by a world-class art collection in a sprawling complex.This museum experience is like none other.

I wasn't aware of the story and legacy of Robert Brady (who attended one of my alma maters: School of the Art Institute of Chicago). His voracious acquisition of great art from around the world combined with his own powerful paintings provide the visitor with room-after-room of floor-to-ceiling art.

Each room features a laminated guide to what you're seeing, with certain masterpieces in bold. You need this guide since there is so much to see in every single room. There are pieces by Frida Kahlo and Rufino Tamayo, mounted on walls in the bedrooms, kitchens, stairways and vast tiled bathrooms. Masks, weapons, stone sculptures, textiles...this place has every artifact you can imagine.

The house is open-air and light enters from unexpected sources. Outside, you stand in the shadow of the fortress-like Cathedral amid lush shrubbery and flowers. The staff is very helpful. Brady is buried on-site. The entrance fee was about $4 and well worth it.

181068375.name: Colorful museum
181068375.author: a TripAdvisor user
181068375.reviewBody: This museum is a must see!  I have visited it 9 or 10 times and always discover something new and exciting!  Definitely one of my favorite places.

180284498.name: An eclectic divertimento
180284498.author: a TripAdvisor user
180284498.reviewBody: The Brady museum is a house with an amazing collection of beautiful things, curiosities and kitsch. It is not a must but a good way to pass a little time if you have it in the center of Cuernavaca.

173856353.name: treasure house
173856353.author: a TripAdvisor user
173856353.reviewBody: a feast for the eyes. amazing experience! would go again. staff friendly and the artefacts and artworks were stunning.

172687676.name: Beautiful museum
172687676.author: a TripAdvisor user
172687676.reviewBody: It\'s worth paying the entrance. Amazing house great collection of art, not only Mexican, from around the world as well.

171988752.name: Beautiful House
171988752.author: a TripAdvisor user
171988752.reviewBody: I would suggest getting a tour if you really want to know what is in the house and why, but just looking at everything is cool too. The set up is so beautiful!!!  One of my favorite places!!! not for toddlers..

170682757.name: Nice house but rather cluttered and lacking interpretation
170682757.author: a TripAdvisor user
170682757.reviewBody: The collection has the hallmarks of a personal selection. It is eclectic, even miscellaneous. Each room is crammed full of things, above all statues of different sorts. However, there is no attempt to contextualise the exhibits either in relation to Brady\'s life or indeed their own provenance. There are some interesting things in the museum but I left disappointed. An opportunity to tell Brady\'s story and to explain how and why he collected these artefacts has been missed.

169721185.name: Wonderful, quirky museum
169721185.author: a TripAdvisor user
169721185.reviewBody: Robert Brady had a fine eye for detail and the museum, his former home, reflects his often humorous style.  His collection of Mexican folk art is particularly well curated.  I recommend spending enough time to look closely at his collections; the museum is packed with witty vignettes that can be lost in the sheer volume of objects.  A tour is not necessary, however English language tours are available by appointment, priced by group not per person (about $30).

169650293.name: Mexican and Cuernavaca design at its best.
169650293.author: a TripAdvisor user
169650293.reviewBody: This lovely house is full of history from earth colonial times to the 70\'s and 80\'s. It\'s last owner put a great effort on decorating each room with beautiful antiques and paintings brought from every corner in the world. His great style combines perfectly wall colors, with furniture, and african pieces. Making a mix never seen anywhere else in the world.\nIf you like decorative arts and Mexican design, this is a great place to visit. There is also a coffe house and film house showing art films every week.

167681685.name: Beautiful representation of Mexican Art & Style
167681685.author: a TripAdvisor user
167681685.reviewBody: The Robert Brady Museum is the epitome of what Mexican style & art are. It is very well preserved and organised. You can stay longer to enjoy the house and the garden. The flowers, the thick rock walls, the pool, colourful rooms, and antiques give you a good idea Cuernavaca\'s past and present environment.

164284496.name: Don\'t miss this
164284496.author: a TripAdvisor user
164284496.reviewBody: I visit this museum every time I go to Cuernavaca.  It is not to be missed.  Note that they are closed on Mondays.

163950593.name: Art tempel and oasis in the heart of Cuernavaca
163950593.author: a TripAdvisor user
163950593.reviewBody: This charming museum in the heart of Cuernavaca was the home of Robert Brady, an american artist and art collector who lived here for 20 yeras (untill 1986). The museum is located in a part of the former convent of Cuernavaca\'s cathedral and consists of and old building with 2 floors and two nice gardens on each side. The museum outstands for its vast, personal collection of artefacts but also for the stylish, mexican interior and charming setting. It is definately one of the highlights of a Cuernavaca visit!

162298009.name: A gem in Cuernavaca
162298009.author: a TripAdvisor user
162298009.reviewBody: This musem is definitely worth a visit.  Just a block or so from the cathedral in the centro.  Interesting arrangements of artwork of various types and periods, including the famous Frida Kahlo self-portrait.

160016151.name: Favorite Tourist Location in Cuernavaca!
160016151.author: a TripAdvisor user
160016151.reviewBody: We did a tour and visited the Palacio de Cortez, Borda Gardens, Cathedral, a market, and the Robert Brady Museum.  This was my favorite stop!  The home is fascinating - even my 4 & 5 year old enjoyed it.  There is an original Frida self-portrait and wonderful portrait of Peggy Guggenheim.  Ask the on-site expert (forget his name, but he has longer black hair) about the place.  Stories are great.

158817093.name: Rich, amazingly varied art collection, beautifully decorated home
158817093.author: a TripAdvisor user
158817093.reviewBody: I loved, loved, loved this house/museum.  Original  Frida, Diego, Marsden Hartley....fabulous Mexican textiles paired with mid-century furniture.  The tile work is breathtaking....that white and purple tiled bathroom was exquisite.  Precious folk art collection....fabulous small garden, framed by the huge cathedral......a glimpse into the rich, happy life of Robert Brady, artist, art collector and yes, a wonderful gay man who loved Mexico and left a treasure of beautiful Mexican and world art behind for us all to enjoy.....his ashes are buried in the yard with his beloved dogs, Rice and Beans, translated from the Nahuatl, Aztec language.  Less than $3 to enter!  So many thanks, Robert!

157220554.name: nice little museum
157220554.author: a TripAdvisor user
157220554.reviewBody: nice little place in the center of the city. its great to see the art work and the rooms decorated so nicely. if you bring a student isic card entry is free. they also have a little cafe with nice pastrys

157219089.name: eclectic and beautiful
157219089.author: a TripAdvisor user
157219089.reviewBody: Unusual collection of art work and craft from all over the world, including works by Rivera and other notable Mexican artists.  Peaceful and elegant refuge in what was Brady\'s home.

154273298.name: Eclectic and charming collection
154273298.author: a TripAdvisor user
154273298.reviewBody: This house has some wonderful art and is displayed in a wonderful warm way where you can wander through Robert Brady\'s home -- even the bathrooms and kitchens are brimming with his art. Not only do you get to see great pieces of art you get to see this wonderful home and imagine life there. I\'m imaging some pretty fun parties by the pool through the 50s, 60s and 70s!

153633510.name: Good museum
153633510.author: a TripAdvisor user
153633510.reviewBody: Very interesting. Beautiful house and great variety of art. A must see in Cuernavaca. Friendly staff.

153225677.name: Fantastic Art and Gardens
153225677.author: a TripAdvisor user
153225677.reviewBody: Very diverse world wide collection from Africa, Navajo tapestry and several paintings by Brady as well

153157422.name: Worth a visit
153157422.author: a TripAdvisor user
153157422.reviewBody: Former house of a very eclectic man. I came with my mom at the end of a long day so we did not spend a lot of time at the museum, but you could spend a long time in every single room. Very fun and colorful house. Definitely worth a quick visit and not very expensive.

152875859.name: The Museum is a private collection
152875859.author: a TripAdvisor user
152875859.reviewBody:
Not only is the a beautiful house, each room is filled with art, folk art, and photographs from
Mr. Brady’s travels and guest.  A great place to spend an hour or two.  Close to downtown Cuernavaca.
A great place to see what life was like for the rich and Hollywood expats in the 50’s.

152851651.name: Not to be missed
152851651.author: a TripAdvisor user
152851651.reviewBody: One-of-a-kind house of an eccentric American art collector. Good friend of Peggy Guggenheim, Josephine Baker, among many. The house itself is the main "museum piece" and the art collection is outstanding--wide ranging in geography and time. He lived with his art collection and all is left as was when he died in 1986, it is said.

151456658.name: DON\'T MISS THE ROBERT BRADY MUSEUM
151456658.author: a TripAdvisor user
151456658.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning, and we only discovered it accidentally.  Left as the owner had it when he lived there, a world reknown art and artifact collector.  Do not miss this museum!!

151364141.name: Loved every minute of it
151364141.author: a TripAdvisor user
151364141.reviewBody: If you love rare, unusual and eclectic items from around the world, you will love this museum. I am reminded a bit of Gaudi buildings in Barcelona but of course, not much can be as spectacular as what Gaudi did. Well worth your time.

151018366.name: Gorgeous house, rich american
151018366.author: a TripAdvisor user
151018366.reviewBody: Yes, tye house in an old franciscan monastery is packed with art and collectionand paints. A rich american lived here from 1962 till 1986. Worth a visit

148243780.name: Cuernavaca\'s most bright gem !
148243780.author: a TripAdvisor user
148243780.reviewBody: On December  9th, 2012 it was my 15th visit to this unique house-museum/ I went through some reviews and saw that  many people do not understand the difference between the Museum and the House-Museum, one lady even   were dreaming of living there... Dear Lady, don\'t even think of that - you can\'t believe how much you have to work to keep the place clean and in the GOOD museum order. Do you know that after the death of Mr, Brady they needed 4 years to clean everything and put it back into a special order?! This house has almost no glassed windows. And yes, this place is really unique. Only as multytalanted man as R. Brady was could fill his house up with so many masterpieces collected all around the world. This place is great not only for art lovers, but for decor lovers, history lovers, color lovers, human lovers... That\'s why every time I am near Cuernavaca I always viisit this quiet and beautiful place. If you are lucky and during your visit you meet and listen to Serjio, their chief guide and specialist, you get much more reasons to love the place. Interesting - before we, visitors, start loving this place, it was Robert Brady himself who visited Cuernavaca, saw this place and fell in love so much that he decided to buy the mansion. It was a great deal. And now we understand - it was even better for us than for him.\nThank you Mr. Brady for your great taste in everything. Thank you  Cuernavaca for having this gem. I promise to be there  16th time because every visit gives me some new vision and very new mood. Grea one!\nalftul

145902348.name: Now I know who Robert Brady is
145902348.author: a TripAdvisor user
145902348.reviewBody: This was part of a tour while training to become a Certified International Tour Manager through the International Guide Academy in Denver, Co. The home is filled with art collected by Robert Brady and our guide was full of stories, some personal, that helped relive the days of Mr. Brady\'s residence in this home. Art lovers must see.

144567782.name: A home full of treasures
144567782.author: a TripAdvisor user
144567782.reviewBody: This little museum is a real gem, tucked away behind the cathedral and full of the interesting and mostly very colorful art that Robert Brady collected.  You can\'t help wonder what Robert Brady was like as a person.  Is the room full of crucifixes an indication of his religiosity, or is more a question of irony?  What made him do that?  The bathrooms with sunken bathtubs were amazing, the kitchen full of charm, the painting of Peggy Guggenheim spell-binding.  Well worth the visit.

144396852.name: A unique and colorful collection.
144396852.author: a TripAdvisor user
144396852.reviewBody: I love the mix of art, religious artifacts, history, society, culture, and style. What a gorgeous place to visit, our guide Sergio was elegant with his descriptions and knowledge. I will go again, the colors make you blossom!!

144019830.name: What my house would look like if I was rich...
144019830.author: a TripAdvisor user
144019830.reviewBody: Absolutely fabulous collection of MXN folk art. We\'ve lived in MX for five years and this is one of the best small museums we have seen.

142984716.name: I want to live here!
142984716.author: a TripAdvisor user
142984716.reviewBody: Ohmigosh, I exclaimed aloud as I entered each different room. And sometimes, "Oh, Robert, why did you die without making friends with me?" Sr. Brady was not afraid of color, that\'s for sure. His taste was flamboyant. Maybe it verged on gaudy but it never crossed that line. And his brio in assembling his vast collection of art is nothing short of genius. Love, love, love. And on an Oct. 11 visit, only one family was there other than my friend and me. So we pretty much had the place to ourselves. Sr. Brady may have been a rude, insufferable, egotistic gringo (or so they say), but all is forgiven because his home is a true jewel. In every room is a laminated page detailing each piece of art. Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, Rufino Tamayo, Brady himself: all are represented, along with European and African pieces from several centuries.

137828663.name: A hidden gem
137828663.author: a TripAdvisor user
137828663.reviewBody: It is a small museum/house, but it houses some very interesting pieces. Works by artists such as Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, and Rufino Tamayo, as well as pieces from India, Africa and Mexico in a very eclectic setting.

136996482.name: Best house museum I\'ve visited
136996482.author: a TripAdvisor user
136996482.reviewBody: The Robert Brady Museum makes one feel almost like he has met Mr. Brady.  The personal artifacts and photos, even his choice of books are particularly interesting.  It all shows what an aquisitive Iowa boy with lots of money can accomplish.

135477618.name: Museum worth a visit
135477618.author: a TripAdvisor user
135477618.reviewBody: This lovely house was the home of the artist Robert Brady. It is well worth a visit and is like looking around a home that the owner has just stepped out of. Full of paintings and treasures that Brady collected as well as dozens of photographs of the rich, famous and naughty that he befriended during his life. The interior decor is stunning.

133130517.name: An Eclectic collection in excellent taste
133130517.author: a TripAdvisor user
133130517.reviewBody: We knew Bob Brady as he was a freind of our parents, it is a pleasure to re-visit and to be re-inspired with his unfailling great taste.

129863845.name: Wonderful Home
129863845.author: a TripAdvisor user
129863845.reviewBody: This home of Robert Brady is a beautiful place to visit, full of history and splendor.

128077821.name: Best museum in Cuernavaca
128077821.author: a TripAdvisor user
128077821.reviewBody: I\'ve visited this museum twice now and fell in love with it both times. It is right near the central plaza of Cuernavaca and is an absolute gem. Robert Brady was an American artist who loved to travel and who moved to Cuernavaca in the 1960s. This is his house, and it is impeccably decorated with hundreds (thousands?) of crafts, fabrics, paintings, etc. that he collected during his travels. The central courtyard garden is also very nice. A great stop if you are visiting Cuernavaca, especially if you like crafts!

127088529.name: A view into how the other half lives
127088529.author: a TripAdvisor user
127088529.reviewBody: It does not feel like a museum but as the home it was.  Robert Brady was obviously a very wealthy man and as an artist he had wonderful taste, so the home is exquisite.  One room I would have avoided had I known, is the christ room. a bit gory for my taste.\nOne of the staff who works inside, Sergio, has wonderful English and loves to talk about the pieces and answer questions.\nWell worth the cost of admittance and on one of the prettiest streets in Cuernavaca.

126504771.name: A delight
126504771.author: a TripAdvisor user
126504771.reviewBody: This is the magnificently decorated, former private house of a wealthy artist. It includes many beautiful and unusual works of art. It also demonstrates how living a good life is an art too.

126503634.name: Oasis in the middle of downtown Cuernavaca
126503634.author: a TripAdvisor user
126503634.reviewBody: Lovely, well-maintained garden  and authentic home  of American Robert Brady with Mexican finishing in the middle of the busy city, next to  the Cathedral.   An eclectic collection of various  art forms including an original painting of Frida Kahlo.   Well appointed and spotless washroom facilities and a small drink bar are available.   Cards in both Spanish and English are available in each room describing the various works of art.  You will see religious paintings, wooden statues and figurines, Mexican furniture, tiling, clay figures, primitive art and much more.  Like many other places in Cuernavaca, staff does not necessarily speak any English.

126340068.name: Very cool
126340068.author: a TripAdvisor user
126340068.reviewBody: This is such a fun museum, it\'s Robert Brady\'s home as he lived. Great house. He collected religious are, was friends with Josephine Baker, so much more. Check this place out for sure

125828891.name: What beauty lies behind the walls.....
125828891.author: a TripAdvisor user
125828891.reviewBody: What a wonderful place and excellent curator - I am sorry that I didn\'t spend more time learning about all the art - I was overwhelmed.  The grounds are amazing and the house so beautiful.  An excellent experience - don\'t miss it and take it all in....

124842898.name: Boutique museum of gay art collector Brady
124842898.author: a TripAdvisor user
124842898.reviewBody: Crazy to find such a super museum that is virtually the same as the day Brady died.  Like a time capsule.  Strongly recommended

124784112.name: such fun
124784112.author: a TripAdvisor user
124784112.reviewBody: quirky and gorgeous colors. Curious and totally worth it

124175604.name: A gem!
124175604.author: a TripAdvisor user
