124175604.reviewBody: This museum is the former home of artist and art collector Robert Brady.  The home itself would be enough to enjoy as it is absolutely beautiful, but the artwork makes it extra special.  We loved it!

123297624.name: Amazing amount of knick-knacks
123297624.author: a TripAdvisor user
123297624.reviewBody: I was attracted to this museum because it was reviewed as a well-displayed collection of items acquired by Robert Brady over years of traveling around the world.  I wanted to see what another traveler would bring home from his trips.\nI found an interesting house and peaceful garden, first of all. I am sure that the house was an oasis to return to after the rigors of international travel.  Mr. Brady gathered an amazing assortment of treasures over the years.  I found the collection a bit weighted in favor of religious articles, but it was still an interesting visit.

122177024.name: Quirky and high-quality
122177024.author: a TripAdvisor user
122177024.reviewBody: A beautiful house museum of an artist-collector with impeccable taste and enormous decorative flair. Eclectic, eccentric, fascinating.

120740074.name: Unbelievable collection!
120740074.author: a TripAdvisor user
120740074.reviewBody: We enjoyed all the art and collectibles, but maybe the best... the architecture and color of his home.  What a life he must have led!

119829494.name: Beautiful Design & Color - A Great Stop in Cuernavaca
119829494.author: a TripAdvisor user
119829494.reviewBody: After seeing the high ratings on Trip advisor for the Robert Brady Museum we decided to check it out and we were not disappointed at all! The grounds are beautiful and immaculately groomed - the house and furnishings are bright, colorful and simply astounding! My favorite areas were the upstairs bedroom overlooking the pool w/the white bathroom, the kitchen and the pool and garden area. I also enjoyed seeing the private photos and memorabilia from Robert Brady\'s personal life. \nThe price was only 30 pesos and worth every peso - I highly recommend visiting this museum, especially if you like beautiful design and history.

119558061.name: An American in Cuernavaca
119558061.author: a TripAdvisor user
119558061.reviewBody: The kitchen and bathrooms were my favourite part of the tour. The garden and his collections were wonderful.

115255228.name: Never felt more at home in a museum
115255228.author: a TripAdvisor user
115255228.reviewBody: This place is fabulous---whether you like architecture, interior design, folk, modern or religious art, you will be happy you visited. What is so amazing, is that this is a former home and it has been preserved and maintained as it was. You never feel like you are in a museum. You feel like you are in a functioning home and rather than browsing the artwork, you could just as easily be enjoying a pre-dinner cocktail.

100632128.name: Delectable museo
100632128.author: a TripAdvisor user
100632128.reviewBody: In Cuernavaca, the two best things for us were the Mercado and the Museo Robert Brady (http://www.zocalotx.com/MUSEOROBERTBRADY.htm). Brady, an American who had lived in Venice and finally in Cuernavaca, used his wealth to purchase this wonderful building for his home and fill it with his personal art collection. Being in his house and gardens is a sensuous experience, uninterrupted by guards warning you not to go too close or ropes across the furniture.  A stealthy staff-member appears and reappears throughout the rooms, giving you the subtle hint that you would be discovered if you decided to lie down on Brady\'s bed or climb into his tiled bathtub.  Along with works by Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, Marsden Hartley, Maurice Prendergast, Rufino Tamayo, Paul Klee, and zillions of others, are the handsome paintings by Brady himself.  Highly recommended.

93853381.name: Great example of how to live your life!
93853381.author: a TripAdvisor user
93853381.reviewBody: Brady, a young American artist son of an Iowan businessman, discovered Cuernavaca in the 1960s and fell in love with it so he purchased a grand, old 16th century building and fashioned it into a traditional Mexican upper class home.  He then filled it up with his own paintings to which he added a variety of Mexican art including pieces by Mexican greats like Diego Rivera and Rufino Tamayo plus art work which he collected over the twenty or so years that he had left including artistic treasures from pre-Hispanic Mexico, Africa, and India.  Visiting his art-filled home was sheer pleasure for me and my wife for many reasons but mainly because it represented testimony of someone who discovered who he was and how he wanted to spend the rest of his life--surrounded by the things he loved.

33813823.name: Great museum - A must-see if in Cuernavaca
33813823.author: a TripAdvisor user
33813823.reviewBody: The museum is really worth seeing and is hosted in the actual home of Robert Brady. His collection of art pieces is VERY varied and I think there is something for every taste. The house is immaculate and the guides are really helpful. In each room, you will find a page that describes each piece in English. There is a small relaxing coffee place where it might be nice to stop by if you are in the middle of a journey. We had no issues finding the museum, asking around. There is a parking lot almost right in front of the museum (quite small and not very easy to park in if you have a large car). \nThe only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because it remains a small museum (you might spend from 1 to 2 hours and a half there depending on your interest).

27671157.name: Resident of Cuernavaca and I visit this place a lot.
27671157.author: a TripAdvisor user
27671157.reviewBody: I was awed by this house/museum and recommend to all my friends who visit Cuernavaca.  It should not be missed.  Bring your camera.  I bet before you leave that you will take more than 50 photographs.  Enjoy.

22530914.name: An incredibly colorful home that is now a great museum
22530914.author: a TripAdvisor user
22530914.reviewBody: Based on what we had read about the Brady Museum we definitely wanted to see it. It exceeded our expectations by far. Brady was an American expat artist and collector originally from Iowa who settled in Cuernavaca. He bought a home with a great location near the cathedral and decorated it with art and treasures from all over the world. You see his house as it was when he lived there. The colors in the various rooms were so bright. We especially liked the outdoor pool and lounging area plus the bathrooms and kitchen were decorated with the most far out colors of azulejos imaginable. Each room has a written description of most everything in it in both Spanish and English. There is a fee to get inside and you pay extra for using a camera. We decided to forgo the camera fee and regreted it afterwards. However, one can find loads of photos from the Brady Museum on the internet but they are brighter inn person. It is truly a highlight of a visit to Mexico.

17264432.name: Not to be missed
17264432.author: a TripAdvisor user
17264432.reviewBody: Even if you are not an art lover like I am, the Robert Brady Museum is a must-see. You will see some pretty decent artwork (from Asia, Africa and the western world - Frida with monkey!)  which is hung salon-style in every room in the house including the bathrooms, plus get a sense of how lavishly this obviously very rich American lived in Mexico.  Each room in the casa is a designer\'s showcase, and the old casa itself, with its peaceful courtyard and fountain, represents the best of colonial architecture.

8461414.name: Really interesting
8461414.author: a TripAdvisor user
8461414.reviewBody: My friend and I wandered into the museum because it was attached to the house we rented for the week (Casa Mariposa Blanca).  It is worth the visit - very interesting to see his collection, which is pretty eclectic - but the best part is the house, which is very unique and beautiful.\n

7365511.name: Wonderful visit
7365511.author: a TripAdvisor user
7365511.reviewBody: I went back several times during the three weeks I spent in Cuernabaca at language school  It was wonderful, far too much to  take in in a single visit.  Just wonderful.\nGave me a lot to think about.\n

1543837.name: Better than a museum
1543837.author: a TripAdvisor user
1543837.reviewBody: My wife and I visited the Brady Museum simply because it was on a list we had gotten from somewhere. However, once we entered this grand old Mexican home hidden behind the town cathedral, we were transported into the whimsical, soulful and creatively inspired world created by Robert Brady, an artist neither of us had ever heard of. His ecclectic collections of other major artists and folk art are displayed in the bathrooms, the hallways, the bedrooms, the kitchen and the pool house. \nIn addition to the art, you get the sense of how Mr. Brady lived and cannot help but to image his lifestyle. In this way, a visit to the Brady Museum also includes an introduction to the "ghost" of Mr. Brady. \nI couldn\'t help but notice that in the beautifully landscaped, restful central courtyard---off to the side, is a head stone. Here lies Robert Brady. R.I.P. And thank you.

1151027.name: A Pleasant Surprise
1151027.author: a TripAdvisor user
1151027.reviewBody:
Just down the street from the most wonderful Casa Colonial Hotel where we stayed, is this gem of a museum.

We had never heard of Robert Brady but were curious at the site of the exterior of this seemingly well-kept museum. Upon entering, we were pleasantly surprised. This was quite a find with some amazing art. This is certainly worth a visit.

It was obvious to us that Mr. Brady was an American who loved Mexico.

1137078.name: A must-see!
1137078.author: a TripAdvisor user
1137078.reviewBody: We visited museo robert brady on 18/4/03, and loved the artist\'s collection of works. he delighted in preserving the ancient nunnery while gathering his personal photos, mexican artifacts, and his own work in an updated, lavish, home.

1025962.name: Awfull gay camp!!!
1025962.author: a TripAdvisor user
1025962.reviewBody: The house is not 16 century, but very 1970\u00b4s. Its all very gay camp. On display are the owner\u00b4s awfull kaftans, belts and other items including some Avon perfume containers. A couple of good paintings and trashy furniture frames the worst painting ever made by a self proclaimed artist. Avoid it at any rate!!!

926678.name: A Home To Die For!
926678.author: a TripAdvisor user
926678.reviewBody: I visited the Robert Brady Museum on March 19th, 2003.  It was the highlight of sights to see that day.  The house in the historical district of Cuernavaca.  A wonderful street to walk down, just at the corner of the Cathedral.  Each room was a museum of art and artifacts from all over the world.  In the time we had, I toured the home for the ornate themes of each room and especially the bathrooms were to die for.  I want to go back to just view the art.  It was too much to take in to view the rooms and the walls of art.  After the tour I wanted to know more about the man.  In Mexico, you never know what is behind the walled gate.  Behind this gate is a delight.

280171.name: a must-see
280171.author: a TripAdvisor user
280171.reviewBody: the robert brady museum is a jewel not to be missed. the collection is fabulous and eclectic, but the house itself is the star--a riot of colors and textures housed in an older-than-God Franciscan convent. Don\u00b4t miss this!\n

557413717.name: Would need to raise their game!
557413717.author: a TripAdvisor user
557413717.reviewBody: Ate in Italianis in Galer\u00edas, Cuernavaca with friends at around 15:30 on a weekday. To be fair my friends enjoyed their main courses. I had ordered a large Ceasar Salad with chicken. There was far too little chicken for the amount of lettuce. The Parmesan was all grated - not a particular problem but shards add to the dish. The lettuce seemed to be dressed in vinaigrette. When I dug down there was some white dressing. I asked for more but the overall taste was of vinaigrette and not Ceaser dressing... Service was sloppy. The small carafe of white wine arrived in a very cute ice bucket but some ice and water spilled out. No effort was made to clear that up and the ice began to melt and dripped onto my handbag. My impression was that customers are too easily got here and that the staff don\'t have to try. Service became so slow after main courses that my two friends took their coffee and Tiramisu to go. Worth saying that the restaurant was virtually empty!

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

511590503.name: "Nice Shopping Center"
511590503.author: a TripAdvisor user
511590503.reviewBody: You can find almost everything you need in this mall without having to go to the center of Cuernavaca city. You will find a nice store and restaurant directory.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

492891191.name: Nice place to visit
492891191.author: a TripAdvisor user
492891191.reviewBody: We visited Cuernavaca in June 2017. We went to gallerias Cuernavaca and we had a lot of fun. They have clothing stores, coffee shops, ice cream places and a nice area to sit and relax.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

455549629.name: Liverpools Restaurant Buffet
455549629.author: a TripAdvisor user
455549629.reviewBody: We had a lovely birthday lunch at the restaurant in Liverpools.  The Buffet offered such a variety of snacks, main dishes and desserts.    The fish was wrapped in foil and so delicious   Our waitress was so sweet.   And the coffee was wonderful they served with the lunch.  \n\nThey had a woman making tacos, roasted peppers and other things fresh too.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

259661595.name: Huge mall
259661595.author: a TripAdvisor user
259661595.reviewBody:
The Gallerias is the perfect place to get everything. This is on the opposite end of town from the downtown area, so you'll need a taxi to go to both places.

The mall has all the big stores, with lots of options for kids, women's shoes, etc. I liked having the Clinique counter, which is otherwise impossible to find in town.

There is parking available. Enjoy the air conditioning and the people-watching. Fast food options in the food court. Otherwise there are sit-down restaurants like PF Changs.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

250428387.name: Watch out: packed on weekends
250428387.author: a TripAdvisor user
250428387.reviewBody:
This place is packed around the clock! I'd rather going on weekdays so I can get better parking and less people.  Nice restaurants, I have tried them all and all have ups and downs.  Bathrooms are taken care of and staff is friendly and helpful.  Security staff is friendly and helpful too and do not hesitate to assist you with any requests even if it's not related to their profile.

The a/c runs all day long but if you make it quite early you are not going to feel the chill until a couple of hours later.

I go often with either friends and/or family!

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

245682304.name: Shopping Mall in Cuernavaca
245682304.author: a TripAdvisor user
245682304.reviewBody: Actually the mall is on the outskirts of Cuernavaca by the highway that circles around town. It is easily accessible by car and taxi from town.\n\nIt is modern, has lots of shops selling clothing, shoes and gifts; many restaurants including Chili\'s and PF Chang; coffee shops, ice cream; and the two anchor stores - Liverpool (a Mexican department store) and Sanborn\'s; plus movie theatres, There is a lot of parking available. Sometimes special events are held there - special exhibits and concerts, for example.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

171546109.name: nice to walk
171546109.author: a TripAdvisor user
171546109.reviewBody: it has good boutiques, and if you\'re tired of the cultural thing this a good place to unwind. Nice for children and families.

address.streetAddress: Autopista Mexico-Acapulco km 87.5 Av. de los Cincuenta Metros

675577906.name: Plaza catalogada como la mejor de cuernavaca
675577906.author: a TripAdvisor user
675577906.reviewBody: Plaza de primer nivel, tiendas y los  restaurantes muy variados de primer nivel, acceso desde la carretera, vale la pena conocerla , su espacio abierto hace que te sientas realmente muy comodo, buen estacionamiento, me encant\u00f3,

673030303.name: Una plaza muy bonita
673030303.author: a TripAdvisor user
673030303.reviewBody: Es una plaza grande, un aspecto destacable es que esta al aire libre (no esta techada como otras en su totalidad) hay varios restaurantes como Sanborns, Toks, Sushi roll,... hay un cinepolis, y varias boutiques de cach\u00e9, un recorcholis, vale la pena ir, y distraerse, hayna zona en la entrada con una fuente y mesas con sombrilla para descansar o leer un libro...ademas hay un wallmart

666444057.name: Recorrido Familiar
666444057.author: a TripAdvisor user
666444057.reviewBody: Un espacio diverso para disfrutar una conversaci\u00f3n, repasar la semana, tomar una bebida o planear las vacaciones!!

662060185.name: Bonita y grande
662060185.author: a TripAdvisor user
662060185.reviewBody: Centro comercial al aire libre, grande, espacioso, fresco, moderno. Con muchas opciones de rstaurantes, tiendas, cine, entretenimiento, super mercado. \nF\u00e1cil acceso, estacionamiento grande. \nMuy recomendable para pasear, comer y comprar.

656608300.name: incre\u00edble
656608300.author: a TripAdvisor user
656608300.reviewBody: existe una gran variedad de marcas para hacer compras. los restaurantes de la plaza son sabrosos y es pet friendly.

656047470.name: Bonito y moderno centro comercial
656047470.author: a TripAdvisor user
656047470.reviewBody: El lugar es muy bonito, es al aire libre y visualmente es muy agradable. Hay mucho comercio, y el \u00e1rea de comida r\u00e1pida es amplia, hay muchas mesas y bien distribuidas.\nLos restaurantes tambi\u00e9n son buenos, y la fuente central es muy llamativa. Un plus que tiene es que puedes pasear junto con tu mascota en algunas \u00e1reas, pues es pet friendly. Tambi\u00e9n hay cin\u00e9polis plus, el cual es  muy c\u00f3modo,\nSu estacionamiento es amplio, por lo que es recomendable fijarte bien en qu\u00e9 nivel  en qu\u00e9 salida estacionas tu coche, pues es com\u00fan que las personas se pierdan temporalmente; afortunadamente ha vigilancia, quienes te pueden orientar un poco.

649193705.name: Bonita plaza, buenos restaurantes y buenas tiendas
649193705.author: a TripAdvisor user
649193705.reviewBody:
La plaza me parece bonita y sigue el nuevo estilo en "malls", de plaza abierta. Si bien en primavera/verano es un poco calurosa, al final es parte de la experiencia en Cuernavaca y no me parece un error si no un acierto. Hay otras plazas cerradas con A/C si no te apetece este estilo. 

Respecto a las tiendas me parece tiene una buena variedad, desde tiendas de lujo como Swarowski, pasando por tiendas medianas como Vans, hasta tiendas mas normales como H&M. 

Buena variedad de opciones de comida (aunque podría haber más), tienen desde argentina, pasando por cocina del mar y opciones mas informales. Por supuesto no faltan los cafés y lugares para comprar un postre helado.

La plaza central es pequeña pero bonita, tiene sus buenas sillas con sombrilla para pasar unos minutos tranquilo viendo la fuente del centro, la cual me gusta por amplia y diferente.

El estacionamiento es bueno y tiene elevadores si los necesitas para carreolas (como yo), sillas de ruedas u otra razón. 

Está bien ubicada sobre la lateral de la autopista. Es amigable con las mascotas, lo que significa que perfectamente puedes andar caminando con tu perro. Obviamente el perro no puede entrar a las tiendas, pero si puedes estar con el caminando por ahí. Hay estaciones de "servicio" para mascotas, con bolsitas y demás cosas.

OJO: La entrada NO es donde esta La Comer, esa es otra, hay que rodear para llegar a la entrada.

647216895.name: Linda plaza
647216895.author: a TripAdvisor user
647216895.reviewBody: Me gusta porque es una plaza moderna que conserva el ambiente para disfrutar el clima de la ciudad con sus \u00e1reas abiertas, adem\u00e1s que puedes llevar a tus mascotas en el primer nivel. Tienen gran variedad de negocios para las compras. Su jard\u00edn es bonito, alegre y tranquilo, el concepto es chulo. Lo que si siento que falta es m\u00e1s variedad de comida y con precios m\u00e1s accesibles. He ido a casi todos sus restaurantes y son caros, el problema es que ninguno es realmente excelente o tiene un sabor que te haga volver a ir, entonces eso m\u00e1s el precio elevado, prefiero ir a otro lugar a comer primero. Pero en si, es una plaza muy buena para ir en familia o amigos.

646147322.name: divertido y pet friend
646147322.author: a TripAdvisor user
646147322.reviewBody: plaza comercal entretenida agradable mucha seguridad amigable con las mascotas encuentras de todo buenos horarios

643563776.name: Bonita y variada
643563776.author: a TripAdvisor user
643563776.reviewBody: Fuimos de paseo. La verdad est\u00e1 agradable, es c\u00f3moda y con buena decoraci\u00f3n. Nueva. Variedad de sitios de comida. Tiene salas de cine. Si volver\u00edamos.

642909340.name: Es hermosa pero NO funcional
642909340.author: a TripAdvisor user
642909340.reviewBody:
He escuchado mucho sobre ella, así que decidí conocerla.
Llegué en automóvil, no hay señalización que me advierta que estoy por llegar, se presenta de improviso, la bahía para autos es pequeña considerando el tamaño de la plaza, la entrada del estacionamiento no está claramente señalada y una vez dentro del mismo es horrible! la señalización que indica las salidas es pequeña y en los colores equivocados y no es sencillo salir, ¡parece laberinto! da uno varias vueltas.
Ya en la plaza, la arquitectura y decoración es bella, pero no hay señalización CLARA y EVIDENTE que ayude a salir rápido en caso de emergencia.
Para disfrutarla la visita más se agradecería que hubiera directorio de las tiendas en ella y DIAGRAMAS por piso

639046995.name: la mejor plaza para ir con mascotas
639046995.author: a TripAdvisor user
639046995.reviewBody: super padre plaza para ir con mascotas pero le faltan mas restaurantes de comida rapida, todo esta muy lindo, muy recomendable visitarla

634710657.name: PRO: BUENA VARIEDAD DE TIENDAS CONS: LOS DIAS DE LLUVIA
634710657.author: a TripAdvisor user
634710657.reviewBody: Esta plaza tiene una muy buena variedad de tiendas. Incluyendo un par de lugares de juegos electr\u00f3nicos para los peque\u00f1os. El estacionamiento es amplio y relativamente econ\u00f3mico. Es un buen lugar para una tarde de compras aunque si llueve puede haber algo de agua dentro de la plaza. Por todo lo demas est\u00e1 bastante bien.

633305200.name: Riesgosa
633305200.author: a TripAdvisor user
633305200.reviewBody: Por donde le vea no hay salidas de emergencia!!!\ud83d\ude31\ud83d\ude31\ud83d\ude31\ud83d\ude31me causa terror, sensaci\u00f3n de encierro y peligro

624814240.name: Muy bonito lugar
624814240.author: a TripAdvisor user
624814240.reviewBody: Esta plaza de reciente inauguraci\u00f3n se encuentra al lado de Galer\u00edas Cuernavaca y es un lugar muy recomendable para pasar un rato agradable con la familia o con los amigos, hay muchos restaurantes de todo tipo para cualquier hora del d\u00eda, lugares de diversi\u00f3n para todas las edades, ir de compras o s\u00f3lo caminar o sentarse por sus pasillos llenos de vegetaci\u00f3n. Un lugar muy adecuado para todos los gustos. Cuenta con todos los servicios y seguro te va a gustar.

620312256.name: Bonita plaza
620312256.author: a TripAdvisor user
620312256.reviewBody: Muy agradable plaza abierta.muchos restaurantes tiendas y cines.pasaras un buen rato y comer a rico.

616492286.name: EXAGERADA Y MAL DISE\u00d1ADA-NO VALE LA PENA
616492286.author: a TripAdvisor user
616492286.reviewBody:
Una plaza comercial al aire libre en una ciudad como Cuernavaca, tan calurosa, me parece una tontería, por decir lo menos. Para ir de compras, uno busca comodidad. ¿Acaso no saben los arquitectos de esta plaza que existe algo llamado "Aire acondicionado"? Los pobres empleados de las tiendas, así como los visitantes, están sudando la mitad de la jornada ( y eso, en Otoño). Parece ser que fuéramos hacia atrás. Lo mismo hicieron en Plaza Forum. 

Por otro lado, la plaza en sí tiene muy elegantes acabados, pero está diseñada sin imaginación. No tiene "rincones" jardines o un lugar central, que atrape. Estando en Cuarnavaca, pudieron haber diseñado algo estilo mexicano modernista. ¿Qué tal haber puesto una fuente? ¿Por qué no diseñarla como un pueblito estilo mexicano con su placita y todo? ¡Habría sido una excelente atracción turística! 

Además, el instalar un Walmart desequilibra toda la idea. Y para acabarla de amolar ¡El Walmart es subterráneo! además, es horrible. Encerrado ¡y con pisos grises! Yo creí al principio que era piso de cemento, pero no. A algún genio se le ocurrió ponerlo gris, de manera que parece permanentemente sucio. 

En el Walmart el ambiente se percibe encerrado. 

Además, el estacionamiento parece diseñado por un alumno de primer año de arquitectura; no tiene lógica, los carriles son estrechos, y las señales confusas; se tiene todo el tiempo la sensación de que se puede chocar o atropellar a alguien. 

Es increíble la torpeza que mostraron los arquitectos en todo. No hay que confundir "grandioso" con "grandote". 

El Luxury Hall de plaza Angelópolis debió servirles de modelo. Yo esperaba algo así. También Galerías Insurgentes, en CDMX. 

En resumen, la plaza es calurosa, mal diseñada, enredada y poco atractiva. Personalmente, prefiero ir a Galerías Cuernavaca, que es más elegante, discreta, está bien diseñada, es techada   Y TIENE AIRE ACONDICIONADO.

648178385.name: Very nice place in close to el zocalo
648178385.author: a TripAdvisor user
648178385.reviewBody: Trying to find places to visit with a couple of friends who came from Europe I decided to take them to the Barranca de Amanalco and got lucky the day we went was open. We were impressed with the park, an amazing place in the middle of the city. Tried to take some other friends later on and found out the place is closed due to the earthquake in 2017

639937717.name: Off the beaten path
639937717.author: a TripAdvisor user
639937717.reviewBody: Most tourists visit the cathedral, pyramids, Cortes Palace, and Borda Garden, but you might want to take a brief nature walk in the center of the city. Not even many locals know about this. The entrance is at the small park by the late 19th-century Porfirio Diaz bridge and parallels the street that leads to the main market. The sounds of the city disappear and one can breathe fresh air and listen to the rushing water below. There are a lot of steps and lush vegetation, but we didn\'t see any birds or other wildlife. There is a small theater area, but I don\'t think it is often used.

467682511.name: A walk through a canyon in the middle of Cuernavaca
467682511.author: a TripAdvisor user
467682511.reviewBody: This requires some walking through this canyon, but well worth it for all the plants you see along the way.

461526609.name: visit to the Barranca de Amanalco
461526609.author: a TripAdvisor user
461526609.reviewBody: We had really looked forward to seeing the Barranca after seeing a picture of it in a tourist brochure.  It is a very beautiful site, but unfortunately the water is very polluted, federal police were on the lookout with loads of guns, and a trail was closed due to a broken bridge (it had been broken for years according to photos on the internet).  We stayed one month in Cuernavaca, and loved our stay. We will not return, however, because of problems with security after eight pm and so much water pollution.

430969952.name: A local\u00b4s choice to hang out throughout the day
430969952.author: a TripAdvisor user
430969952.reviewBody: Great to hang out and chill out with friends or your significant other.  Many activities taking place but not on regular basis, there is always something different to do, particularly for kids.\n\nI\u00b4d rather go during daytime for security sake, you will love the trees, I CERTAINLY DO, lushy, bushy, wonderfully natural.

406722388.name: Beautiful park
406722388.author: a TripAdvisor user
406722388.reviewBody: This park is an unknown and hidden gem within Cuernavaca -- none of the Cuernavaca residents we met knew about it! It\'s very pretty and relaxing, with fantastic trees and greenery. I recommend coming here for a picnic or just a walk around somewhere peaceful after a busy day of sightseeing.\nLots of young couples were there, so I would guess it\'s known by younger folks as a romantic spot. I believe it would be a great place to take kids or just go for a walk by yourself.

389617400.name: A gem inside the town
389617400.author: a TripAdvisor user
389617400.reviewBody: A short but amazing trail. Though we are running out of time when I saw this little green with a long river on Google map, I want to visit this trail. It didn\'t take too long, only 15-20 minutes, but the view is very nice, like we went down to an underground city with rainforest, waterfalls, and wonderful birds. The air is cool and humid, it feels like an oxygen bar. We did it twice during our two day visit. A real surprise. \n\u9690\u85cf\u5728\u57ce\u5e02\u4e2d\u5fc3\u7684\u5b9d\u77f3\uff0c\u5730\u4e0b\u7684\u96e8\u6797\uff0c\u7011\u5e03\uff0c\u6e05\u51c9\u7684\u7a7a\u6c14\u5373\u4f7f\u662f\u5728\u6b63\u5348\u3002\u68d2\u6781\u4e86\uff01\u6211\u4eec\u5728\u4e24\u5929\u7684\u884c\u7a0b\u4e2d\u6765\u4e86\u4e24\u6b21\uff01\u53ea\u898115-20\u5206\u949f\u7684\u5c0f\u5f84\uff0c\u611f\u89c9\u7115\u7136\u4e00\u65b0\u3002\u6765\u58a8\u897f\u54e5\u901b\u4e86\u592a\u591a\u4eba\u6587\u666f\u89c2\uff0c\u662f\u65f6\u5019\u6b23\u8d4f\u4e00\u4e0b\u5927\u81ea\u7136\u7684\u5947\u89c2\u4e86\u3002

378646142.name: Cuernavaca is a jungle
378646142.author: a TripAdvisor user
378646142.reviewBody: This lovely park gives the visitor a great idea of what Cuernavaca was and is till today. A lush paradise filled with gorgeous butterflies and singing birds. I couldnt believe I was downtown Cuernavaca, and I was enjoying this lush paradise. The sound of the river below flowing. The long roots from the top trees reaching for water. It is a great walk, and right downtown.

634469823.name: Interesting
634469823.author: a TripAdvisor user
634469823.reviewBody: This is an interesting and strange space.  You can see some huge Siqueiros pieces, and they also had an unusual contemporary art installation while we visited.

616723953.name: Save a trip - it\'s boring with almost nothing here.
616723953.author: a TripAdvisor user
616723953.reviewBody: I\'ve been there three times and I live in the neighborhood.  There is one mural outside, usually a poor visiting exhibit inside, but not always, and a pile of classrooms.  Very boring.  Give this a miss.

567543958.name: A small historic spot of the great Mexican art
567543958.author: a TripAdvisor user
567543958.reviewBody:
The Tallera of the master Siqueiros has more a sentimental air for those familiar with Muralism.
It will take short time to visit as it is a small venue, with only 2 rooms, one permanent with one of Siqueiros’ last pieces and the other for temporary exhibitions. On the second floor there are a couple of workshops for painters, but with limited access for visitors.

At the Tallera there is also located the last known residence of Siqueiros. It would’ve been great if they could open it for the public like the Frida Kahlo Museum.

Keep in mind there is very little to see if you go with great expectations, but on the other hand will take you less than 1 hour to visit an historic venue forma couple of bucks.

460515443.name: Interesting but Not That Much to See
460515443.author: a TripAdvisor user
460515443.reviewBody: Interesting building that was used by Siqueiro as his studio.  There is an exterior mural and also one inside. Not sure but  the murals were rather abstract so thinking it was some of his later work. (He is not really my favorite Mexican artist, and personally not impressed with these two works).Plus there is an exhibit by another artist.  I was told that his house which is next door is open on saturdays from 11:30-2:30 and is free to visit but visitors are limited.  Also it is not open every Saturday, think it may be posted on their website. I would have liked to visit his house.  The guards were very friendly and eager to talk about the space. I was the only visitor there.  Though not that much to see, still happy I saw it and the entrance fee is only $30mx, and nice to visit something in a quiet residential area.

441219214.name: A Hidden Secret in Cuernavaca
441219214.author: a TripAdvisor user
441219214.reviewBody:
The Siqueiros is a "hidden secret" here in Cuernavaca. They do not do a great job of promoting the exposition center, and thus it receives very little traffic. The locals know it and they go often.

La tallera Siqueiros is one of the best art museums in Cuernavaca. The space is large, open, and an exceptionally fine architectural building.

David Alfaro Siqueiros (born José de Jesús Alfaro Siqueiros, December 29, 1896, in Chihuahua - January 6, 1974, in Cuernavaca, Morelos) was a Mexican social realist painter, better known for his large murals in fresco. Along with Diego Rivera and José Clemente Orozco, he established "Mexican Muralism."

He worked in Los Angeles and New York before settling down in Cuernavaca, where he built La Tallera Siqueiros. There he was able to work his large murals. The tracks for the huge works can be seen in the ceiling of the museum.

However, the work of Siqueiros are seldom displayed in the current exposition space as it serves to showcase the works of other artists on a revolving schedule. One never knows what will be showcased during a visit, thus, we go often to see some of the best art from Mexico and elsewhere.

You do not want to miss this exposition space.

379023157.name: Beautiful, fascinating art museum
379023157.author: a TripAdvisor user
379023157.reviewBody: Very interesting and innovative museum of contemporary art. When we were there there was an interesting short film about the whistling signals of an Indian group and their connection to nature and religion.

339397391.name: Great exhibition space and fantastic murals by Siqueiros
339397391.author: a TripAdvisor user
339397391.reviewBody: This exhibition space is in the middle of a residential area. it has murals by Siqueiros and they do special exhibitions of contemporary mexican art. Very good!

334806975.name: Amazing
334806975.author: a TripAdvisor user
334806975.reviewBody: The sheer size and scale of the artwork here is breathtaking. I love how his former home (seemingly in the middle of nowhere) was suddenly converted into this gallery. Highly recommended!

641211078.name: What about local artists?
641211078.author: a TripAdvisor user
641211078.reviewBody: After cost overruns of 50%, the U.S.$15 million museum is an architectural wonder in the city. The garden, filled with interesting sculptures, centuries-old trees, and a small stream of clear water alone is worth a visit. If you\'re a Soriano fan, you\'ll enjoy the main exhibit, but everyone else asks why local artists aren\'t spotlighted (Soriano was from Guadalajara). What I enjoyed most was a temporary exhibit about sound. Free parking with access from the south. Sundays free; $45 other days.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Morelense de Arte Contemporaneo Juan Soriano

address.streetAddress: Dr. Guillermo Gandara S/N Col. Amatitlan, C.P. 62410 Cuernavaca, Morelos, Mexico

603531059.name: New Museum in Cuernavaca
603531059.author: a TripAdvisor user
603531059.reviewBody: First of all you have to notice the architectural design of the building - the \'floating\' corners. There are exhibits upstairs and downstairs in the main building; there is a sculpture garden; and there are several cubes (cubos) in the garden area with different art activities for children. Right now (summer 2018) there are a couple of exhibits by a Cuban artist that are spectacular.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Morelense de Arte Contemporaneo Juan Soriano

address.streetAddress: Dr. Guillermo Gandara S/N Col. Amatitlan, C.P. 62410 Cuernavaca, Morelos, Mexico

596537301.name: Finally a great cultural option in Cuernavaca
596537301.author: a TripAdvisor user
596537301.reviewBody: Finally a great art museum in Cuernavaca. The space is really fantastic with huge exhibition galleries and a fantastic garden with sculptures. Worth the trip.

itemReviewed.name: Museo Morelense de Arte Contemporaneo Juan Soriano

address.streetAddress: Dr. Guillermo Gandara S/N Col. Amatitlan, C.P. 62410 Cuernavaca, Morelos, Mexico

486566827.name: Wonderful Museum
486566827.author: a TripAdvisor user
486566827.reviewBody: We spent a wonderful hour in this museum that includes a number of exhibit spaces with impressive artworks and crafts made by local artists. A must visit in Cuernavaca.

461527309.name: a morning at the Museo
461527309.author: a TripAdvisor user
461527309.reviewBody: We stayed a month in Cuernavaca, and we feel that this art museum houses the most beautiful art of the City.  What a treasure.  We nearly missed it as this museum is not well advertised.

430967171.name: A must in Cuernavaca
430967171.author: a TripAdvisor user
430967171.reviewBody: I have been here for several reasons, several gatherings, several exhibitions and occasions, all of them wonderful and all of them inviting.\n

430761376.name: Activities programs couple with art installations.
430761376.author: a TripAdvisor user
430761376.reviewBody: Gallery rooms with quality contemporary work surrounds a courtyard that was set for performance programming.  A lovely collection well worth exploring.

404256171.name: Nice Museo Easy to Navigate but Very Difficult to Find
404256171.author: a TripAdvisor user
404256171.reviewBody: This place has some very nice examples of contemporary art from the various regions of Mexico. Some of the Indigenous Art is becoming very hard to procure due to the drug trafficking in some areas. The real surprise here is the awesome cafe- it is not a cafeteria! It is situated on the rooftop above the Jardin. The cafe has delicious well-priced breakfast and lunch. They can also prepare dishes not listed on the menu. Very fresh and delicious food and smoothies.

360742955.name: Hidden Jewel
360742955.author: a TripAdvisor user
360742955.reviewBody: Ignore Trip Advisor\'s directions. Address is 275 Morelos by Borda Gardens. Lovely peaceful place with fine exhibit of indigenous art. Cafe looked nice, but we didn\'t eat there. We were only visitors and I sensed that they didn\'t get much traffic.

349731824.name: Don\'t miss this
349731824.author: a TripAdvisor user
349731824.reviewBody: This is a small museum wih changing exhibits. Few people know much about contemporary Indigenous peoples of Mexico, and it is worth seeing. There\'s a small cafeteria inside, so enjoy your visit.

343191321.name: Great!
343191321.author: a TripAdvisor user
343191321.reviewBody: Wonderful art from everywhere in the area.  Beautifully displayed and easy to understand.  Well done!!

339398120.name: Nice Indigenous Art
339398120.author: a TripAdvisor user
339398120.reviewBody: This museum is a newly renovated building, they did a great job and it has very nice shows. It also has a restaurant on the top with a view to Jardin Borda

656595878.name: Tiny - nothing much to see
656595878.author: a TripAdvisor user
656595878.reviewBody: Not sure if this museum has been affected by the 2017 earthquake. It\'s free but  really small - took us about 5 mins to walk around so we were disappointed. A few ceramics, archaeological finds and art displays of local culture and that was about it.

637306249.name: Quick vist, free
637306249.author: a TripAdvisor user
637306249.reviewBody: There exhibits in the museum change regularly. It\'s a real treat to see the works of so many different craftsmen and women. Some of the best items are for sale in the gift shop, but you can get better prices elsewhere.

567575591.name: All in One
567575591.author: a TripAdvisor user
567575591.reviewBody: As I walked into this museum; my eyes open wide with all of the beautiful, autochthonous wares of Morelos.  Plus, the times that I have visited; different expositions were displayed.  the best.... is Free...

497208600.name: A nice little museum that is free
497208600.author: a TripAdvisor user
497208600.reviewBody: You can walk through in about 15 minutes. They offer a brochure in English, but none of the exhibits are. The staff was very friendly. It is right near other museums so stop by!

471343886.name: Small but interesting collection of folk art
471343886.author: a TripAdvisor user
471343886.reviewBody: Fascinating colorful collection of folk art. Easily done in less than an hour. It is in the cathedral and zocalo, Palacio Cortes area so easily accessible. Free

467682211.name: Popular art museum
467682211.author: a TripAdvisor user
467682211.reviewBody: This is right downtown Cuernavaca, so easy to get to, and you can see it in half an hour or so.  It always has a good exhibit of crafts from central Mexico, and it has a good store where some of the items are available for decent prices.

432480442.name: wonderful collection of folk art
432480442.author: a TripAdvisor user
432480442.reviewBody: Any one interested in the culture would likely love this museum... from pottery to weaving, a real treat to see...

430756534.name: Lovely step out of the hub-bub of the street to the work of a region!
430756534.author: a TripAdvisor user
430756534.reviewBody: Very smart exhibition  of varied pieces in a variety of media.  There are Spanish and English brochures available that provide excellent insight to set the stage for viewing contemporary objects in a small but delightful collection.\nSomething for all here!  Free and welcoming, centerally located, no reason in the world to be missed!

383794142.name: Nice Space Modern Space - Weak Exhibit
383794142.author: a TripAdvisor user
383794142.reviewBody: This Museum is meant to showcase artesanias/folk art from all over the State of Morelos. The pieces on exhibit showed little representation from across the state. The kinds of items were not exceptional in their quality. The museum store showed many more items of quality, variety and interest. \n\nThe person at the desk was a stickler for the rules. I showed up at the time posted for the daily opening, but was told the hours had been changed. I returned at 2 minutes before the time and she waved me away.

360210730.name: Great small municipal gallery
360210730.author: a TripAdvisor user
360210730.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this lovely space. Free exhibits and music. Small shop. I highly recommend it to everyone. Near center of town - close to cathedral.

355796991.name: Small and infriendly
355796991.author: a TripAdvisor user
355796991.reviewBody: The display was extremely small and uninteresting and the staff was more interested in eating their lunches.

349982994.name: A Surprisingly Good Museum
349982994.author: a TripAdvisor user
349982994.reviewBody: We were walking the main street and just happened to poke our noses into this museum.  From the street, it is extremely unassuming...one might think it was a restaurant or office complex.  But, no, it is a small version of the museum of the same name in the DF, where much of the best stuff can be found in the gift shop!  Aside from being smaller, we were impressed that the exhibits were presented with care and thoughtfulness.  And, even better, many of these modern renditions of folk art, were rendered with great skill.  We enjoyed virtually every piece presented.  Being a cheapo, I might say that the best part was that it was free.  But this collection was better than that.  Viva la Museo de Arte Popular de Cuernavaca.

348631119.name: Fantastic Folk Art Museum
348631119.author: a TripAdvisor user
348631119.reviewBody: As a collector of Mexican Folk Art for the past 40 years, this collection is by far the most impressive I\'ve seen with the best artisans represented from all regions of Mexico. Every exhibit is beautifully executed for viewing and the quality of the objects displayed are the best. REALLY IMPRESSIVE!

342386266.name: Must visit
342386266.author: a TripAdvisor user
342386266.reviewBody: I loved this museum, I think it shows the best of the Mexican heritage. Mexican artisans are not always appreciated and I applaud this place for doing it! Places like this prove Mexico is way more than tequila and sombreros, please don\'t miss the opportunity to come here!

341451127.name: Contempoary Art displays
341451127.author: a TripAdvisor user
341451127.reviewBody: A variety of contemporary art is displayed throughout this museum.  The full spectrum of artistic expression can be found here.

339792202.name: Fabulous FolkArt Museum
339792202.author: a TripAdvisor user
339792202.reviewBody: This new museum in a beautiful Colonial building has a magnificent collection of some of the best artsans producing the finest folk art from exqusite embroideries on huipiles to ceramic art of famous pottery families. Those who appreciate Mexican folk art will be in for a treat. This is the best collection I have seen in Mexico.

339396780.name: Niece Museum and a great store
339396780.author: a TripAdvisor user
339396780.reviewBody: This museum is very nice, just a block away from the cathedral it has some good pieces of new indigenous art. I recommend the store for very special pieces that you are not going to find in the markets around

332313776.name: Interesting museum
332313776.author: a TripAdvisor user
332313776.reviewBody: Interesting items and easy to view. When we went in there was a talk in Spanish with a large group of people. Wish we understood the language!

327703885.name: Nice short stop
327703885.author: a TripAdvisor user
327703885.reviewBody: I wouldn\'t rave about this as much as others have. Why? There\'s a new gallery, the (free admission) Museo de Arte Indigena and Contemporaraneo just a couple blocks away, and not listed on any of the city guides. (It\'s next to the Iglesia de Guadeloupe, also next to the Jardon Borda and nearly across from the big Cathedral complex.) This (new) museum has a much bigger and to me more interesting collection, in a 1549 vintage building remodeled just to present the art.  HOWEVER, having said that, the Museo Morelense de Arte Popular is almost certainly on your way\' in downtown historic Cuernavaca. It\'s free - has some \'fun\' art more than anything else - and I enjoyed my 15 minutes there.  It\'s just one floor, so you can pop in and out fast. If you don\'t like what you see, scoot back out. If you like it (and I\'m sure the exhibits change regularly), you can linger!

314347318.name: Beautifully presented local art
314347318.author: a TripAdvisor user
314347318.reviewBody: Super helpful (and mega-nice) staff.  Really great collection of display work and items for purchase.  Take the time to talk to staff and peruse the excellent selection of books.

305784476.name: A must in Cuerna
305784476.author: a TripAdvisor user
305784476.reviewBody: Take your time, this boutique museum is precious and eye catching.  Have been here in more than one ocassion.

299254840.name: Great museum of Indigenous folkart
299254840.author: a TripAdvisor user
299254840.reviewBody: One of many great museums in the City of Eternal Spring.  Fokart is usually seen as another item to buy for your suitcase to bring back and decorate your home, but these pieces show how art has always been used by Native Americans as functional pieces in daily life, not to be placed on walls like Western art...

286950987.name: An example of the best actual craftsmanship in the area
286950987.author: a TripAdvisor user
286950987.reviewBody: I love from this small museum, that all the pieces are from real working artisans, the exhibits are constantly changing and the pieces are both lovely and great examples of what is being produced in the region.\nHere you will find originality, craftsmanship, and tradition. The exhibits are constantly showing off the winners in community or regional contests, the pieces worth the visit.\nIm sure it will be hard to leave the place without original and interesting souvenirs from the store, which by the way resembles part of the museum.

280499441.name: Chinelos
280499441.author: a TripAdvisor user
280499441.reviewBody: Look at the exhibit and read up on this very interesting way that the locals mocked their conquerors.\n\n

261936117.name: Crafts and folk art in Morelos
261936117.author: a TripAdvisor user
261936117.reviewBody: This museum is just a few years old. It is on the \'cultural corridor\' that runs along Hidalgo street from Avenida Morelos to the Palacio de Cort\u00e9s in downtown Cuernavaca.\nThere are nice displays of some of the crafts from our state or Morelos as well we special exhibits. They also sponsor talks and presentations highlighting folk art or special art collections. It is worth a visit as you wander around downtown Cuernavaca.

246857502.name: Nice modern museum
246857502.author: a TripAdvisor user
246857502.reviewBody: A new and modern museum on folk art in Morelos. The museum has a permanent exhibit on typical folk art in Morelos which includes Chinelos and cuexcomatl. They also have a rotating exhibit that is currently displaying the wood art of Don Feliciano Mej\u00eda. A very nice regional museum.

656157630.name: Not worth your time.
656157630.author: a TripAdvisor user
656157630.reviewBody: Museum\'s claim to fame is the Diego Rivera mural in the entry. Second year in a row that we were there and mural was closed off. Lady at the museum said it would be 1 to 3 years before it would be viewable...probably means 5 years.

636762018.name: Not open
636762018.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762018.reviewBody: This is the same building as Cortes\' Palace, but the museum is closed to due to renovation for the earthquake, so, sadly the murals cannot be visited.

567575870.name: Is still Closed after the Sept. 1, 2017
567575870.author: a TripAdvisor user
567575870.reviewBody: Have visited Cuernavaca twice and this Museo continues to be closed.  All due to the sept. 19th  earthquake.  The outside is pretty interesting... its history, the monoliths.. the statutes.. Maybe next visit..

536405580.name: Closed as of october 2017 due to earthquake
536405580.author: a TripAdvisor user
536405580.reviewBody: We did not get to visit here as the Museum was closed due to the earthquake there was no indication as to when it would reopen so the number of stars that we\'ve given this is totally irrelevant

501652788.name: Nice
501652788.author: a TripAdvisor user
501652788.reviewBody: Nice museum. It is very old, but very well kept.  A lot of history. The paintings are great.Located in the Zocalo.

497283194.name: Meh!
497283194.author: a TripAdvisor user
497283194.reviewBody: Okay Mexican History museum. Nothing you won\'t see in the ones in Mexico City. I would pass if I was asked to do it again. It\'s the same building as the Palace of Cortez.

467653122.name: An oportunity for History
467653122.author: a TripAdvisor user
467653122.reviewBody: Take your time and visit this amazing museum. It\'s not big, it\'s not the best, but believe me, it\'s an oportunity to jump into Mexican History in many ways: the native cultures, the Colony and Cort\u00e9s and the artists of the muralism. And like a bonus: some antique fosils. Double check it!

466930932.name: Very nice, but not much in English
466930932.author: a TripAdvisor user
466930932.reviewBody: I know we were in Mexico so we should expect things to be in Spanish, but this fort has to do with their history.  It was surprising there was so little in English.  Not a big deal.  We still enjoyed our visit.  The market outside was great.

461535957.name: visit to the museum
461535957.author: a TripAdvisor user
461535957.reviewBody: Very informative especially for Spanish Speakers (although English is available in some areas).  the murals made by Diego Rivera are a must see for everyone!

455722865.name: Went for one reason...
455722865.author: a TripAdvisor user
455722865.reviewBody:
My husband and I visited this museum just to see the Diego Rivera mural. It didn't disappoint! Well worth the 55 pesos/each we paid to get in the door. 

The museum itself is well maintained, and had more of the signage been in English (most were only in Spanish, but some were in English, too) we probably would have stayed longer to soak up the history. 

Warning, no drinks allowed inside. But you can leave yours at the front desk at your own risk. We did with no problems.

445558455.name: An historical treasure
445558455.author: a TripAdvisor user
445558455.reviewBody:
The museum is in what was the home of Hernán Cortés in the early 1500's. 

There is an archeological section, history of the state of Morelos and the icing on the cake is the mural upstairs painted by Diego Rivera in 1929. The US Ambassador Dwirght Morrow commissioned the mural and it is a treasure to have right here in Cuernavaca.

There is a nice bookstore in the museum as well as a rotating exhibit gallery and a small auditorium for speakers and events.

It is a 'must see' in downtown Cuernavaca.

445026714.name: Very interesting museum at the former Palacio of Hern\u00e1n Cort\u00e9s.
445026714.author: a TripAdvisor user
445026714.reviewBody: Very interesting museum at the former Palacio of Hern\u00e1n Cort\u00e9s. It is not so big so you can make it in 1 or 2 hours. You can see the different uses this building had through history and also learn about this regi\u00f3n history.

441116524.name: Enjoyable variety....Amazing Diego\'s!
441116524.author: a TripAdvisor user
441116524.reviewBody: Notable for it\'s importance in the varied uses of the structure thru colonial and post colonial history, this museum is so easy to enjoy for the variety of the collection.  There really is something for anyone interested in the history and culture of the town!  One has a great view from the galleries of the surrounding environs.  The special exhibit of photography that was installed when I was there was excellent, and the crown jewel, the recently restored Diego Rivera panels detailing the history of the Mexican people make this well worth making this a must destination. Adjacent to the structure is an art and craft market.

439047069.name: Murals, artifacts, the history of Mexico
439047069.author: a TripAdvisor user
439047069.reviewBody:
We. Loved. This. Museum.

Well-preserved and well-displayed artifacts with historical context. "The mural." There is so much to see and understand; I could have stayed hours longer and been happy.

For those who get tired of looking at "old stuff" there are also beautiful views of the city from the balconies.

435104879.name: Great place to visit
435104879.author: a TripAdvisor user
435104879.reviewBody: Cool things inside to see.  I really enjoyed the layout of the museum and all the things it offered.  I was impressed.

434778144.name: Interesting
434778144.author: a TripAdvisor user
434778144.reviewBody: This is a museum of Mexican history. It is one of the original buildings of Hernan Cortez. It is really not worth the money, but is interesting to look through. Right in the heart of downtown.

399567771.name: brilliantly designed, great intro to the diversity of Mexico
399567771.author: a TripAdvisor user
399567771.reviewBody: I recommend everyone set aside a good 2-3 hours while in Cuernavaca to visit this museum, although if you have areas/history in which you are most interested, you could go straight to those and spend an hour or so. If you have small children, they may enjoy just being in the building while older children may find certain pieces of the displays fascinating. If you\'ve got surly pre-teens, maybe give them some cash and send them off to the market? You know your kids\' temperaments best.\nThis museum walks you through the history of Mexico from the earliest civilizations through the Spanish Conquistadores with archeological finds and art. Beautiful building, clearly written information.\nAt the time of my entrance, the price was 55 pesos (about $3+ USD) for non-Mexican citizens.

384988180.name: Entertaining.
384988180.author: a TripAdvisor user
384988180.reviewBody: This is a must see in Cuernavaca. Don\'t overlook it. Very entertaining and interesting. Great for families and friends.

382812708.name: Really interesting, a must see.
382812708.author: a TripAdvisor user
382812708.reviewBody: Give yourself at least 2 hours for the visit.  Really informative and well laid-out.  Could use more English info.  Good views of Palacio Cortes.  A must see.

351709158.name: Please don\'t overlook this attraction in Cuernavaca!
351709158.author: a TripAdvisor user
351709158.reviewBody:
I liked this museum so much, I went there twice in one week!  It is small and easy to navigate in an hour or so.  True, many of the explanatory signs are in Spanish, but since I speak it a little, it was not a big deal to me.  

I found the artifacts to be very interesting and some in very good shape.  The parts I liked the best:
#1 the Diego Rivera murals on the second floor.  Really stunning.  There are 9 of them.  The explanation for each is written on both an English and Spanish placards.  I spent about 20 minutes just at that part of the museum.  Also I found the Zapata photo exhibition very interesting.  They do have bathrooms at the museum.  Also on the second floor are a couple of balconies on the front side and the back side where you can sit an rest and look out at the city.  The admission is only 55 pesos.  If you bring a backpack you will need to check it at the entrance.  Also there is a very small gift shops with what looked to be high quality souvenirs. The museum closes at 5:30 every evening.

351596761.name: A Good Collection in an interesting Building
351596761.author: a TripAdvisor user
351596761.reviewBody:
As others have noted, this is not the archaeology museum in Chapultepec Park.  However, it has a solid collection, much of which relates to the surrounding state of Morelos.  

   At various points, there are openings in the architecture so that you can see the construction dating back to the conquistadores.  And there are a couple rooms with drawings and photographs that help explain the evolution of the building.  

  If you are a tourist in Cuernavaca, you definitely want to see this museum.

350599885.name: Worth a visit
350599885.author: a TripAdvisor user
350599885.reviewBody: The museum itself is meh.  But it\'s enjoyable to just wander around the building and see the ancient foundations.  Also, the Diego Rivera mural is worth the price of admission alone.

341017468.name: Boring
341017468.author: a TripAdvisor user
341017468.reviewBody: U can travel anywhere in Mexico and have better use for their museums. I love the architecture of the place but the museum is not interesting and Rich in history. Place needs remodeling too

334131672.name: See review on Palace of Cortes
334131672.author: a TripAdvisor user
334131672.reviewBody: I have covered this very important historical building in the Palace de Cortes. It is one of the oldest civil buildings still standing in Mexica and is remarkable for its murals pained in 1929 1nd 1930 by Diego Rivera

327705461.name: Good - not great - but still definitely worth a visit
327705461.author: a TripAdvisor user
327705461.reviewBody: Cuernavaca doesn\'t seem to have museums of the caliber of Mexico City (which would be very hard to beat so maybe I\'m being unfair!).  Still, this is a good museum for several reasons: first, it\'s an amazing restoration for a building that pretty much dates exactly from the Spanish conquest. Second, it also presents an interesting opportunity to see how \'excavations\' go - there are various spots that have been \'dug out\', so you can see what the building was in the past.  The history of the building itself is interesting. Third, the collection of art and artifacts is good enough (but then I was blown away by the Anthropology museum in Mexico City so maybe I\'m jaded).  Fourth, the Diego Rivera murals are a wonderful opportunity to step outside on a terrace, view the city, and turn and see a masterful set of murals by one of Mexico\'s master artists. So do stop in if you are in Cuernavaca - you can go through it in less than an hour if you wish, or linger for the views.

305783558.name: Impressive.
305783558.author: a TripAdvisor user
305783558.reviewBody: The collection displayed is really good, make sure to be there as early as possible, the lighting there sucks.  This is specially true for special events hosted here: cocktails, book readings, etc.  You can taste the colonial flavor and the boutique is really cute.

301564618.name: THE Historic Jewel of Cuernavaca, also known as the Palacio de Cortes for insight to Cuernavaca\'s history!
301564618.author: a TripAdvisor user
301564618.reviewBody: This is a MUST for visitors in order to understand the rich history of Cuernavaca. The musuem leads you from the Pre-colombian epoch through the Colonial, Revolutionary and modern eras.  A famous Diego Rivera mural depicting this history and conquest of Mexico entitled, The History of Morelos, Conquest and Revolution is emblematic of this Mexican muralist.

268114758.name: The Palace of Hern\u00e1n Cort\u00e9s
268114758.author: a TripAdvisor user
268114758.reviewBody: The official name of this building is the Museo de Cuauhnahuac, but everyone in Cuernavaca calls it el palacio de Hern\u00e1n Cort\u00e9s. I already reviewed it under that name, so won\'t repeat my review here. It is well worth a visit. Remember, it is a small regional museum so don\'t expect it to be like the museums you\'ve seen in Mexico City. It\'s worthwhile just for the building itself, and for the Rivera murals. The other displays are modest, but interesting if you want a quick overview of the region around Cuernavaca.

264583076.name: Even if all you visit is the Rivera mural you\'ll have your money\'s worth
264583076.author: a TripAdvisor user
264583076.reviewBody: But there is so much more.  This gem of an anthropology museum is interesting at every level.  The architecture of the building spans centuries, it not only contains pre-hispanic artifacts but wonderful moments of the Mexican Revolution and Zapata who was a native of this area.  But... the jewel is the Rivera Mural.  Definitely worth having a guide or good guidebook to talk you through this monumental work about the history of the Conquest of Mexico.

233549833.name: Fine Collection and Wonderful Diego Rivera Murals
233549833.author: a TripAdvisor user
233549833.reviewBody: Visiting the Museo de Cuauhnahuac, also known as the Palacio de Cortes, was totally enjoyable. The "salas" allow you to see artifacts that allow you to better understand the history of the state of Morelos. \n\nMuch care has been taken to explain the different periods of time and to display the artifacts in attractive manners. Additionally the murals by Diego Rivera are impressive and he provides his lens on the time periods illustrated.

177254687.name: A not very well known arqueological place
177254687.author: a TripAdvisor user
177254687.reviewBody: Funny the beeing right in the city it is not very visited. I find it interesting and warranting the time spent there. Is a very classical pre hispanic center, with pyramids, temples and a good deal of history to it. Really if you are in Cuernavaca visit it.

152911686.name: An interesting visit
152911686.author: a TripAdvisor user
152911686.reviewBody: One of the top things to see in downtown cuernavaca. A place to see any day of the week except monday.  It doesn\'t cost much and you can likely see it all in 90 minutes.

129126499.name: same thing as palacio de cortes
129126499.author: a TripAdvisor user
129126499.reviewBody: see my notes for palacio de Cortes as both are the same.

585788461.name: Closed due to damage from the earthquake
585788461.author: a TripAdvisor user
585788461.reviewBody: We came to visit in June 2018, and were told by a few shop owners that the waterfall is closed because of damage to the site from the 2017 earthquake. You can\'t even get close to it. Apparently only limited repairs have been made so far and there is no foreseeable reopening date.

467682924.name: a waterfall in Cuernavaca
467682924.author: a TripAdvisor user
467682924.reviewBody: There have been some efforts to clean up this place, it is beautiful but sometimes there is too much trash in the water and on the paths.  There are several steps to get the best views of the waterfall, but worth it.  In the same area, there are plants for sale and places to eat and drink.

461524078.name: Feb. 2017 visit to Salto de San Anton
461524078.author: a TripAdvisor user
461524078.reviewBody: We had looked forward to seeing the falls after seeing it in a tourist brochure.  Unfortunately, only the bathrooms were open, and the lookout near them.  The river bank is full of trash coming down from the falls, and the water is very polluted.  The site is still very beautiful, and truly worth restoring.  Local residents told us, however, the government is closing it down instead of restoring it.  Many of the residents make  and sell arts and crafts, and therefore, will suffer if this major tourist attraction closes.  I hope that it does not.

446944215.name: Surprisingly beautiful mini-adventure!
446944215.author: a TripAdvisor user
446944215.reviewBody: After reading several negative reviews about how trashed this place was, we were very pleasantly surprised to find it relatively clean and very beautiful! As one reviewer wrote, the path to the waterfall is closed by order of some government agency. There are two levels of closure, it turns out. At the top of the path is a gate with three government seals, all of which are broken. It was locked with a padlock, but a shopkeeper nearby had the key and, hearing we were from the United States, said it would be a shame if we couldn\'t see what we came for. She cheerfully unlocked the gate and let us through. The walk down to the first viewing area was immaculate \u2013 no trash at all. Gorgeous view of the waterfall, the ravine, and the houses that astonishingly perch atop the ravine. Following that was the second level of "closure" \u2013 an open gate with a sign indicating that only authorized personnel were allowed through. This was understandable, given the dangerous condition of parts of the sidewalk and steps, as well as the overhanging chunks of basalt, some of which appeared overdue for a fall. But the closures and the semi-dangerous atmosphere served to enhance the experience \u2013 perhaps because we had the place to ourselves or perhaps because it gave mildly adventurous travelers a greater sense of adventure. Overall, we were very glad we went!

349837609.name: Chance to Basalt Columns & a Waterfall
349837609.author: a TripAdvisor user
349837609.reviewBody:
We decided to visit the waterfall and basalt formations in the community of San Anton, not far from Centro Cuernavaca.  It is not widely advertised and finding it requires a little sleuthing. Its open from 8 AM to 6 PM and access is free.
The waterfall is 36 meters high, with its water coming from a small tributary of the Zempoala River. The vertical walls of the ravine are of basalt and broad-leafed vegetation grows in nooks and crannies of the stone.

To get there on foot from Centro Cathedral:
Walk north on Highway 95 from the corner of Hidalgo at the Cathedral intersection (the entrance to Borda Park is here).  At the next intersection  (Ignacio Rayon) turn left, walk to the next intersection (Alvaro Obregon) and turn right.  The next intersection will be Inpendencia (major road crossing the gulley), turn left, cross the gulley and arrive the intersection of Av. Jesus H. Preiado.  Make a slight jog to the left and walk down small Av del Salto.  It will turn into a pedestrian only street shortly, keep on walking until you come to a T intersection (still called Av del Salto).  Turn left, past pottery and plant shops and you will see a small park in the split road.  The entrance to the falls and basalt formation is beside a small tienda on the right where the stairs begin.  There are free washrooms down the stairs.  You can only go down about half way now as the gate is locked so no access  under the falls but there is a good view of the falls, pool below and the basalt formations on the right.  Apparently the lower walkway is closed for safety from potential chunks of basalt falling on the trail.  Walk time from Centro is about 25 minutes.  We were glad we made the trek.

Other locations in Mexico where basalt columns or prisms can be seen include a quarry between the towns of Jamay and Ocotlán (Jalisco) and the south-facing slope of the hills overlooking the town of Chapala (Jalisco). Best ones are out of Pachuca at Santa Maria Regla.

323964290.name: Nice walk with a great view...
323964290.author: a TripAdvisor user
323964290.reviewBody: There is a nice little walk to see the waterfall in the center of Cuernavaca. I think there was a $20 pesos fee to access to falls

668462186.name: De compras
668462186.author: a TripAdvisor user
668462186.reviewBody: El centro comercial es bueno amplio al aire libre muy buen estacionamiento y tiene buenas tiendas y restaurantes, cines y \u00e1reas para los ni\u00f1os como la feria o el jumping.  Manejan tiendas estilo outlet con buenos precios as\u00ed que vale la pena darse una vuelta.

657684131.name: Excelente lugar
657684131.author: a TripAdvisor user
657684131.reviewBody: Divino lugar al aire libre con restaurantes tiendas con excelentes precios y atracciones como trampolines y feria ! \n

630792593.name: Compra y comida familiar
630792593.author: a TripAdvisor user
630792593.reviewBody: Una plaza nueva muy bien puesta, con vigilancia, espacios abiertos, vigilancia. Hay un buen n\u00famero de tiendas y de marcas reconocidas como Adidas, Nike. under armor, Lacoste, Boss, etc\nHay un food court y varios restaurantes buenos y variados. \n

524653015.name: Agradable lugar
524653015.author: a TripAdvisor user
524653015.reviewBody: Es una plaza nueva en Cuernavaca, ya con varias tiendas de marca abiertas como CK, Hugo Boss y un cine muy moderno, cuenta con \u00e1rea de comidas de la cual recomiendo ocupar las mesas que est\u00e1n al fondo ya que esta cerca el jard\u00edn!! Ademas van abrir dentro de la plaza una Feria con su rueda de la fortuna... "el ojo de Cuernavaca" ;)

487507885.name: For hard core Catholics :D
487507885.author: a TripAdvisor user
487507885.reviewBody: Beautiful church in the heart of Cuernavaca\u00b4s downtown.  This parish is quite crowded all the time and of course Sunday mass creates a traffic chaos.  \nShow up at least 20 minutes early to make sure you leave your party at doorstep so you can find a decent parking near by.

address.streetAddress: Calle Profesor Agustin Guemes Celis 2 Centro

349273753.name: A Nice Small Church
349273753.author: a TripAdvisor user
349273753.reviewBody: We had a little extra time in Cuernavaca and saw a picture of this church.  It is on a busy street, with a large shrine dedicated to the Guadelupe out front.  The church was OK and we were happy to spend a few moments there, but it is not a must do site.

address.streetAddress: Calle Profesor Agustin Guemes Celis 2 Centro

333387434.name: Virgin of Guadalupe Chapel
333387434.author: a TripAdvisor user
333387434.reviewBody: This is not a chapel but rather it was where Cuernavaca ended and people stopped for a blessing from the Virgin of Guadalupe before taking the road to Mexico City. Now we feel like it is almost in downtown Cuernavaca! On December 12, the feast day is delebrated and there are special masses, as well as traditional dancers, food stands, and fireworks.\nGroups take floral wreaths to deposit in her honor. It is a special landmark in Cuernavaca.

address.streetAddress: Calle Profesor Agustin Guemes Celis 2 Centro

249771886.name: The Cuernavaca spire
249771886.author: a TripAdvisor user
249771886.reviewBody: Also known as the "Templo de San Jos\u00e9 el Calvario", this church is located in the center of Cuernavaca. The exterior is lovely and churchy. Unfortunately, I don\'t know what it\'s like inside because it was closed when I visited. Sad kitten.

address.streetAddress: Calle Profesor Agustin Guemes Celis 2 Centro

249768267.name: Quaint church near Jardin Borda
249768267.author: a TripAdvisor user
249768267.reviewBody: This is the church that directly flanks the Jardin Borda to the north. The large church is somewhat modest but still enjoyable to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

558000891.name: wish we could have gone in
558000891.author: a TripAdvisor user
558000891.reviewBody: but it was still neat to hang out in the plaza of the old hotel, and imagine zapata and his army kicking it there. beautiful.

396383784.name: art by Adolfo Mexiac
396383784.author: a TripAdvisor user
396383784.reviewBody: The art is brilliant -- poignant and beautiful.\nThis is a small museum and costs pennies to enter so a reasonable place to take small children. There is space for them to run around while you read the descriptions of the art :)\nThe young docent did a great job and was obviously enthusiastic about his subject.

430757025.name: A lovely picturesque tiny castle, with an awesome panaroma opposite.
430757025.author: a TripAdvisor user
430757025.reviewBody: Three rooms of photos from the earlier days of the City.  The building and site is itself a treat.  It is free.  If you are looking for fine art, perhaps you should allow that the historical value of the collection is the focus...perhaps best visited after an opportunity to walk about the town and have an idea of locales to contrast with the past.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Fotografia El Castillito

address.streetAddress: Prof. Agustin Guemes Celis 1 Cuernavaca Centro

351703855.name: Perhaps we missed something
351703855.author: a TripAdvisor user
351703855.reviewBody: We happened upon this museum by chance.  I recognized it from the picture.  It was small and thre was no one ot help us.  Not much of a museum!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Fotografia El Castillito

address.streetAddress: Prof. Agustin Guemes Celis 1 Cuernavaca Centro

260333475.name: An enjoyable walk down memory lane
260333475.author: a TripAdvisor user
260333475.reviewBody: If you enjoy looking at old photographs as I do, it\'s nice to visit this museum and marvel at how Cuernavaca was before it became the awful urban eyesore it is today. One who knows the main streets of Cuernavaca will probably enjoy the exhibit much more. The castle itself is cute but otherwise not too remarkable.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Fotografia El Castillito

address.streetAddress: Prof. Agustin Guemes Celis 1 Cuernavaca Centro

249770967.name: Cute little museum
249770967.author: a TripAdvisor user
249770967.reviewBody: Pro tip - this is really a museum about antique Cuernavaca photos, not about antique photography in general. This tiny museum is located in the bottom floor of "El Castillito" which is a small house that looks like a teeny castle near the "Calvario", or church in the center of Cuernavaca. There is no charge to see the photos in the museum or to explore "El Castillito" itself. Pro tip - leaving a donation is nice. A nice place to chill and see what Cuernavaca looked like in yesteryear.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Fotografia El Castillito

address.streetAddress: Prof. Agustin Guemes Celis 1 Cuernavaca Centro

574616709.name: Contemporary art in Cuernavaca
574616709.author: a TripAdvisor user
574616709.reviewBody:
We visited this gallery without knowing anything about it and spent a pleasant half hour viewing the art. Hosting contemporary artists it is set in a beautiful old building with a well appointed gallery space.

The staff were friendly and spent time telling us about the art and artist in both English and Spanish- as my partner is fluent in Spanish but I am not!

There is a separate restaurant upstairs and it is located near plenty of bars and restaurants. A nice little addition to your itinerary.

address.streetAddress: Juan Ruiz de Alarcon No. 13 Cuernavaca Centro

430762299.name: Saturday weddings add to the drama of the setting.
430762299.author: a TripAdvisor user
430762299.reviewBody: Remembering churches filled with numerous weddings of Saturday, the bus dropped me near the church just in time to find the bride at the door.  So, I confess, I did not make it into the building for a more extensive report.  It seems an amazing space...BTW, just down the street to the right a block away is the "little castle"  museum of photography of the city.

382815906.name: nothing special
382815906.author: a TripAdvisor user
382815906.reviewBody: If you have the time then go look, but don\u00b4t go out of your way.  I have visited better churches. However, there is a good coffee shop/ bookstore next door.

305787270.name: Great for weddings
305787270.author: a TripAdvisor user
305787270.reviewBody: As a tourist and if you like Catholic churches you should come over here.  Chappels and churches here in Morelos (the Catholic ones) are really antique and the preservation witholds a challenge by itself, so, take a look and take pictures because you are allowed to do so! :D

644536842.name: No es comparable con el de CDMX
644536842.author: a TripAdvisor user
644536842.reviewBody: Es museo est\u00e1 bien, aunque el de CDMX nos pareci\u00f3 no solo mas grande, sino que mucho mejor. Fuimos con nuestro hijo de 6 anos, y algunos juegos eran para menores de 4 y otros para mayores de 8, por lo que pudimos hacer poco.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Vicente Guerrero 205 Lomas de la Selva

643161335.name: Buena ma\u00f1ana con ni\u00f1os!
643161335.author: a TripAdvisor user
643161335.reviewBody: Aunque en tama\u00f1o es muy diferente al de CDMX cont\u00f3 con lo necesario para pasar una buena ma\u00f1ana con los ni\u00f1os, salieron muy contentos y la exposici\u00f3n de Lucha Libre, muy buena.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Vicente Guerrero 205 Lomas de la Selva

639484952.name: Su fama traspasa cualquier comentario
639484952.author: a TripAdvisor user
639484952.reviewBody: un lugar extraordinario para ni\u00f1os y j\u00f3venes pero tambi\u00e9n divierte a los adultos con los diferentes puestas y \u00e1reas interactivas

address.streetAddress: Avenida Vicente Guerrero 205 Lomas de la Selva

639306399.name: Buena Opcion para un fin de semana en Familia
639306399.author: a TripAdvisor user
639306399.reviewBody: Iniciemos con la parte de los dineros para esta actividad encontraras las siguientes tarifas $60 ni\u00f1os, $50 adultos o bien el paquete familiar de $185 para 2 adultos y 2 menores, en virtud al costo no podemos pedir mas, apesar de ser relativamemte bajo el costo del museo ofrece actividades diversas para los peque\u00f1os y la convivencia familiar, conserva la tematica toco, juego y aprendo,  las actividades  se desarrollan en un edificio de 2 niveles, por lo que para recorrer en su totaludad el museo y disfrutar de todas las actividades te llevara no mas de 6 horas, el area de burbujas es una de las favoritas de los visitantes por lo que no dudo en recomendarla, dentro de las restricciones esta prohibido ingresar con alimentos y bebidas sin embargo en el exterior se cuenta con una area especial para poder comer un refrigerio, cuenta con elevador para personas con discapacidad, en breve puedo recomendar invertir unas horas de su viaje en este museo si viajan con ni\u00f1os la pasaran muy bien, la parte del estacionamiento se hace atravez del estacionamiento del centro comercial frente al museo el cual comparten el area, por lo que al salir se te recomienda selles tu boleto de estacionamiento ya que se te condonaran 2 hrs de estacionamiento, cada 8 o 15 dias se realizan espectaculos especiales tematicos por lo que te recomiendo sigas la pagina de redes sociales para estar atento y programar tu visita.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Vicente Guerrero 205 Lomas de la Selva

321181913.name: Imponente, Impresionante.
321181913.author: a TripAdvisor user
321181913.reviewBody: Para mi el mejor templo y de la ruta de los conventos de Morelos. Impresionante desde que lo divisas a lo lejos. Adem\u00e1s el pueblo hermoso, las casas homogeneas de color cafe tenue y techos de teja. Por dentro el templo es aun mas hermoso y siguen guardando la disiciplina antig\u00fca al entrar: mujeres por una puerta con rebozo (si no llevas, te prestan uno) y hombres por otra puerta. la plaza principal tambi\u00e9n es hermosa, con una estatua del Chinelo (porque sice la palca que ah\u00ed nacio) y de un Zapatista que no recuerdo su nombre. Vale muchisimo la pena visitar Atlatlahucan, Morelos.

itemReviewed.name: Ex-Convento Agustino de San Mateo Apostol

642878840.name: Aprovechando el clima de Cuerna
642878840.author: a TripAdvisor user
642878840.reviewBody: Es una plaza en su mayor\u00eda, abierta, con lo que es m\u00e1s agradable pasear por all\u00e1 o toomar un caf\u00e9. Es mi plaza favorita de Cuerna pese a todas las que hay \u00faltimamente.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rio Balsas Col. Vista Hermosa

611273556.name: Great for large functions
611273556.author: a TripAdvisor user
611273556.reviewBody: I have been there for weddings, religious reasons, and expos. Quite an array for a place that will cater your every need, particularly on rainy season, when everything in Cuernavaca is open air, here you have a great place to celebrate, the parking lot is super big and the staff is friendly and efficient.

address.streetAddress: Autopista del Sol Cuernavaca - Acapulco km 112
